kxCfV0RL0Qe89fjz7nZPMA.text: Amazing customer service! The food was amazing and fresh, they even know my order! The teas are refreshing! And the owner is awsome!!!

73z51NTqeskoxh3wO23k1g.text: What a fabulous late lunch we had today at Zooks  ! They have a location now with plenty of parking , it lived up to  every review I've ever read.  We had # 10. photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Number 35 is vegetarian and very yummy

la3pB7nStz1wdC1K1RtK5w.text: I wish I could give 4.5 stars. It's just shy of 5 stars due to infrequent issues that have happened. Overall - this is a great little sandwich place. The owner (Carole) is friendly, down to earth, cares about her customers.    She has come up with a unique type of sandwich you just have to try. It has interesting toasty bread and different fillings that one would not expect.  You don't just get a boring old turkey sandwich here.  My favorites are 1) the Zinger.  A breakfast sandwich with fluffy eggs, cheese, bacon bits, green onions and a zesty sauce. 2) I think it is #55 - a dessert sandwich with Nutella, bananas, peanut butter, and nuts. I also love their turkey sandwich but can't remember the number. I just know it has green apple on it and a tasty mustard sauce.  The other big pro for this place is these sandwiches aren't pricey.  They are very reasonably priced and most come with a side (either a salad or chips). The sides are also very tasty and unique. Even the potato salad side is twice as good (and different) than other potato salads.  Right now this store sits on Central south of Camelback but will be moving to just north of  Camelback soon. That is good - since parking at the current store is very tight. The new location will alleviate the parking issue.  If you are in the area, do yourself a favor and try this place. I found it from other Yelp reviews and I'm glad I did. I live in the north part of town, but make a point to get here at least once on the weekends. It's worth the trip!

SlCKZhBVjfrKr6BwTU-xhw.text: First stop after we landed at airport. Delicious sandwiches. Very nice staff. Enjoyed the setting.

OmNNhooVQFY_zN1WCPuhEA.text: I'm here at least once a week getting sandwiches and salads to go.  The sandwiches are creative, delicious, healthy and made fresh while you wait.  And service is fast and efficient.  I have gotten hooked on #60 and #10.  Salads are creative, delicious, and healthy too.  Owner Carole and staff are fantastic.  I actually dream about these sandwiches.

daTAPewmE9AkSyfY9l_w1A.text: I'm still not completely sold on the concept as a regular thing but these "Zooks" are pretty dang tasty.  They make the sandwiches to order (expect a couple minutes wait) using a few simple but fresh ingredient combinations (ie. mozzarella, tomato, greens or egg, bacon, cheese, beans).  The owner is very friendly (and the other staff for that matter) and the place is always clean (why can't all other fast casual places do this?).  I do wish the sandwiches were just a little bit bigger though.  If you're looking for a unique 'sandwich' option give it a shot for breakfast or lunch.

nZnauJizRjpFMT7vxjrcaA.text: Found this place on accident. Pleasant surprise. Super friendly staff, they seem to really like the place and excited to talk about menu. The sandwiches are round with a crunchy crust. All seemed very fresh. Price point is at the higher end but still within range.   I would definitely come back. Great food, clean, fast, friendly and nice vibe and patio. Small so not a lot of people but...

lgR6v6fqCGnkpQtE2hwe9Q.text: This is my first time here and it's delicious! I can't wait to come back and try everything else. Everyone is so friendly and the patio is wonderful.   I'll be back, Zookz!

_qw1g9vf_KKJlN7ImzZqFQ.text: Wow, I could not be a bigger fan of this place.  The first time we went to this place, the ladies (owners) were so sweet.  They chatted a moment with us about their options and top sellers.  They managed our order fabulously.  I got the #35, a fabulous SW potato salad, and a dessert sandwich with nutella and powdered sugar.  ALL, and I mean ALL, of it was fabulous.  #35 is like eating a burger, but not so awful for you, the SW potato salad is not spicy but has a SW flavor that is addictive, and the nutella sandwich was SO decadent. The biggest problem is due to all of the carbs/starches, I was SUPER full, so plan on taking some home if you are a light eater. BUT, it refrigerates and microwaves well at home. (At least the #35 did). :)  The restaurant is spotless, the hand washing station is magic, and I love the recycling section of the trash cans.   This place is officially in our lunchtime rotation and I am obsessed with how sweet the ladies are that work here, they are what make the place magical.  I will definitely be back for more.

xrg7MdxfIQ4RpGu6WMXXeQ.text: You are now aware that Zookz makes uncrustables for grown-ups. And while you can't get a PB&J, they are delicious.   I must have stumbled upon a meeting of sorts during my first visit to Zookz. About six workers stopped, looked my way, and greeted me with huge smiles. I can tell when someone is faking it, and these grins sure were genuine!  I wanted the very best they had to offer, so without hesitation I went for their most popular lunch--turkey, bacon, avocado, and sweet mustard. It came with a tiny, but scrumptious side salad of kale, craisins, and walnuts. Delightful! Some say these are small, but this is a right-size lunch at a good price. Totally snagged a little jug of apple juice with my sandwich and dropped less than $9 for a satisfying meal.   A fair criticism to ding a star for is that it's not as flavorful as the ingredients would suggest. Rather than an eclectic sandwich, it almost tastes like the best grilled cheese you've had in your life. I would use less cheese and probably go for something sharper, just to let everything else shine.   Whoever writes the menu has some creativity and a keen palate for mixing flavors. If you're around CenPho and seeking a tasty, casual lunch, don't pass this place up!

w2j9zLcFOT8OXo8uXnWrGQ.text: This place this unbelievable awesome. I am a vegetarian. I didn't know no.45 has cheese at first. After I noticed, they customized a no-cheese veggie sandwiches for me free! Great service!

thF_u441FcIcvweOAt63Lw.text: Stayed in a place up the road from this place. We came in on a Sunday morning and beat the rush. The restaurant is really nice and the windows were open because the weather was fantastic. The sandwiches were so good, unlike any other breakfast sandwich I've had. The owner took the time to welcome us and thanked us for coming in. Also, their iced teas are really refreshing and have a great variety of flavors. I will definitely come back when I'm around these parts.

Shq5LjzUQR67hJbBjw3cog.text: A poached egg. That is what was at the center of this lunch, literally and figuratively. I went into Zookz for two reasons. 1. It's near my work and 2. every morning I pass it and it has this huge banner outside that reads "Best Sandwich in Phoenix". I'm not sure which of their sandwich's are the best. Unfortunately their lead sandwich, the #11 is not the best sandwich in Phoenix.   The sandwich is a panni-esk meal with two "poached" eggs, bacon, tomato, cheddar cheese, cream cheese, and basil. When my sandwich arrived it looked like it was cooked in one of those sandwich makers someone gives you as a wedding gift. I opened it up to hoping to find two perfectly poached eggs bursting with yoke over some thick applewood smoked bacon and fresh tomatoes and basil. What I got were two incredibly hard boiled eggs, some bacon shavings, a very tart tomato along and some wilted basil.   The sandwich doesn't work. The problem is you can't poach an egg and then press it in a sandwichmaker and expect it to not come out overcooked.   Zookz gets two stars (Meh. I've experienced better) because the owner was terrific. She came out immediately and tried to explain to me that their egg cooker is set at five minutes (so its not really a poached egg) and that the eggs come that cooked. She said they would try to undercook the egg and hope that it worked with the press.   To their credit the second sandwich, though still over "poached" was better than the first. The owner was very kind and went as far as to reimburse me for my meal because it took about 20 minutes for me to finally eat. It was an underwhelming sandwich, great staff, but wrong concept. Overall it's kind of a hot mess, literally and figuratively.

blquxMI97c1SmO9TgSvPJA.text: A MUST stop. Incredibly lovely shop with the most delightful owner and staff. They had me at their story, but the food was creative and delicious. They don't skimp on quality, or quantity. I loved their large assortment of non-carbonated beverages and the cup size was extremely generous. Attention to the detail in the decor. Overall 5 star experience.  And did I mention the owner is enchanting. This is a must support place.

Q_QGjVnM1CJ-kV9tjLcSEg.text: Yesterday, we wanted to try something new for lunch..  We were in the mood for a good salad and my friend did a search and Zooks was on the list.  We headed over and in my mind knowing where this was located, I dreaded the parking situation I was going to find.  Luckily, the parking wasn't bad because we went at 1pm, but we did get the last spot that we had to squeeze into.  A truck would never fit.  Anyway, we walked in and the atmosphere is pretty fresh and clean with bright colors and images of fresh veggies adorning the walls.  Pretty nice.   When you walk up to the counter, a pretty nice guy greeted us and asked if we had been there before and when we said no, he explained the menu to us.  We went right for the salads, even though some of the sandwich options looked pretty good. I got the #5 and an iced tea.    We took our seats and one thing that stuck us as a little odd was that the AC system was over the windows but the air was so forceful it didn't matter where you sat in the dinning area, you were going to be blasted.  Not a huge deal, but it was noticeable.  It's Arizona and it's hot, so I guess we should be thankful.    Once we got our meal, it came in a plastic to-go container.  One thing I might recommend to them is using something less environmentally unfriendly and costly for people who are dinning in.  I mean it seems very "pre-packaged" and not to mention it's totally crappy for the environment, but I digress.... The salad was full of wonderful ingredients, crumbled bacon, roasted almonds, dried cranberries, apples, carrots, and Zookz Creamy Apple Mustard Dressing.  It was so good, it left me wanting more.  (Meaning it was great, but it have had more to it or at leas greens at least.  They should bottle that dressing for sure, though because it was awesome!   This is a great place to grab lunch so check them out.  I think I definitely want to try a sandwich next time.  Maybe split it with my friend and have the salad again too.  I hope to see them fix the way they package their salads so when you dine-in you aren't getting it in a to-go container. Heck, it's going to save them money in the long run anyway.

w4zlSqe3Q_xhhCcatCsdtA.text: Just had lunch at Zookz and I must say that I'm impressed, this is the type of place that you want to try everything on the menu.  The service was excellent and I recommend checking this place out.  A great spin on the traditional sandwich a+

mnu2su2DAWZK3ksIhNR5oQ.text: I really enjoyed this casual and inviting lunch spot! I ordered the mozzarella and spinach salad and it was yummy! Klutz that I can be, I dropped half my kale salad on the floor just as I was telling my friends how yummy it was. When I mentioned it to the owner as an aside, she brought me another one without me even asking!  Talk about customer service!

The level of service is how it should be nice, receptive, and willing to help you out as soon as possible. Can't say enough about Zooks. If you haven't tried it give it a try.

FW8Jqg9nzJdtxc-4ZGQ7GA.text: I love Zookz and it has been an integral part of the central and camelback neighborhood for many years. Zookz offers a unique sandwich filled with delicious ingredients that have not been replicated elsewhere. I recommend the #35, with roast beef and horseradish and the kale salad. I will have to return to try the soup that will be coming to the menu soon! The owner is very warm and personable and the story on how Zookz came to be is very inspiring!

vPO0zn8LYSDn_pwxBLowOA.text: Saw Zookz while driving around. Stop in for a sandwich, had no idea what to expect. Each sandwich comes with a side: chickpea salad, potato salad or kale salad. Got the Kale and the Chickpea, both were pretty good. Would recommend the chickpea. Got the number 10 and 20. $18   My take on it was just a different version of a grilled cheese. The contraption they use is pretty cool. I'm glad they didn't use the basic white bread I remember having when I was young. It's a bit of an upgrade I'd say.  Would I come back? Probably not, when I think of a good sandwich, the bread is my deal breaker. Cool concept if you love grilled cheeses. Just didn't tickle my fancy.

ZX8iRjxUmgZOwe_i2ISfkA.text: I am a regular lyft driver and today i picked up a woman with limited mobility and very limited eyesight. I have to admit i would have never have gone here, if she hadnt asked. Nonetheless, i was skeptical about how this encounter would go and asked if she had gone before and what the deal was. She said it was The best but another nameless rideshare company wouldn't help her out with the whole journey. We ordered pickup from her house and then cruised, 10 minutes tops on a Friday during lunch. The counter person was extremely friendly, helpful, and compassionate. The owner greeted the woman and they discussed her love of the restaurant at length. The space itself is quaint and has the coolest door in the world. I loved the selection, menu, and overall atmosphere. The sandwich itself is like a empanada made out of bread. The bread is pressed in a panini manner. Served hot. After the transaction was completed, she asked if i could take her home. At a stop light she begged me to take a bite of her sandwich and we ended up sharing our #24 and #25 in the car. It was a truly beautiful sandwich. I wouldn't have found it wasn't for this nice ole lady.  I guess i need to bring someone here and repay the favor to appease the sandwich gods.

The service was outstanding, and when I got back to my office to eat at my desk...I had to stop eating to pick up the phone, and call them to compliment them on how amazingly delicious my sandwich AND potato salad was. (I had the #20)  No lie...this was ridiculously delish!! I am headed back there at least once a week. Congratulations to Zooks!! Glad your here!

KrRP1MHfQaUqHnAjC00RBg.text: One day, after scouring Yelp for a breakfast spot loved by all I stumbled upon Zookz Sandwiches, a central Phoenix, family owned shop specializing in crafting circular sandwiches. After visiting a few times and receiving consistent service I have been a regular, visiting once every two or three weeks, just enough for the small group of employees to remember my name and order. The menu is fairly simple with no more than two dozen sandwich choices for their breakfast and lunch menus, which is served all-day. Identified solely by numbers the ordering is a little unique. When placing an order the number gets written on a small brown bag, similar to a pastry bag, and handed off to the back. Remaining loyal to my 44, partially due to the cheaper price, I've never been disappointed. Frittata eggs, bacon, ham, basil, red peppers, and feta cheese are all toasted to perfection in a special apparatus used to craft the pockets. After placing your order at the till, you are given a number and choose a seat, where an employee will deliver your order to you. Their sandwiches are delivered on long rectangular trays, a little odd, and inside that brown bag from earlier is your sandwich on a round paper plate holding the halves together. As you wait for your meal or eat away, employees coming around to wipe free tables or tend to the floor strike up conversation and make sure you enjoy your visit. Their customer service is genuine, the conversation flows organically and never seems forced. When you walk in you are greeted by a smiling face and a genuine hello, typically from the owner.   The concept of a circular, panini like, sandwich was introduced to the owner by her grandmother while she lived back in Egypt. The modifications her grandmother made to recreate them for her grandchildren became entrenched in the owner's childhood and eventually the motivation to begin this shop here in Phoenix. They offer breakfast and lunch sandwiches, with breakfast sandwiches priced at $5.95 and lunch sandwiches are around $7.95 although they are the same small size. This is the only downfall, the relatively high price of a full meal with sides, as they cost just as much as the lunch sandwich options. It's only due to the excessively large drinks, either a choice herbal tea or soft drink my breakfast choice can get me full. They also offer a few alcoholic drinks like five-dollar mimosas and some local beers, a plus to them, but I've yet to try any to really share an opinion on whether this seemingly low price is a good deal or speaks to the quality of the drinks.   They do tend to get pretty packed in the mornings and lunch time, as they are located in a high-traffic area but there's plenty of outdoor and indoor seating. With small two-person free standing tables, a long cushioned bench along one wall, a larger table along another side, and individual seating neat the door they've got you covered. These wooden tables and the bright yellow and gray themed decor and intimate feel inside fits well into the somewhat posh area. A sweet touch is the large mural of the owner's grandmother that runs along one wall. I assume due to them being in central Phoenix their hours are more catered to accommodate a typical 9-to-5 worker's schedule, making it the perfect breakfast and lunch spot. However, their hours from 7am-4pm, have been another downside for me, as I can hardly find the time to make it in, during their slower times. All-in-all Zookz is definitely worth a try, their friendly service and unique product will leave you wanting more.

XmuUsgOWvgKqtO826xIaWg.text: I took the fam out for breakfast on Memorial Day...this is a major undertaking because NONE of us can agree on anything these days!  Option A was too expensive and Option B was too loud.  Option C was not open for the holiday...you get the drill.  I made the executive decision to go to Zookz...it's been on my bookmark list for a while now and I had ceased to care about anyone else's opinion ;)  We arrived at 10:30 and were all excited about getting caught up.  After ordering, we grabbed a table outside under the misters and noshed on a coconut/oatmeal cookie for our appetizer.  Breakfast was delivered quickly and was packaged picnic-style.  The outer layer of these sandwiches is intriguing,.....sealed all around and crisp.  The insides contained poached egg, cream cheese, and a host of delicious options.  Our menu selections had been recommended by the staff and we enjoyed them.  I took half home for the next day's lunch.  The sides were all interesting...Nephew got the potato salad and declared it delicious.  The cookie was really yummy as well.  Niece and I had coffee which was excellent too.  The price was reasonable...I fed 6 people for $55 and we all left satisfied.  All in all, it was a nice outing and a great get-together.

HGFRygLNvNvghpFOjSbLoQ.text: Absolutely loved it. We came and had a #20 and a salad, so we could try them both. When the salad first came out, it looked small, once I started mixing it, it was quite filling. The bread that the sandwich is made with is so yummy and creative. Love the crust.

33FeE6DrSOKVVmS3qTCmtw.text: My wife and I were checking out eating places we haven't been to for lunch and came upon this hidden, one of a kind sandwich restaurant.  We went in because of the mouthwatering pictures on the billboard just outside the front door. The outdoor seating looked like a fun place to catch some rays and enjoy our lunch.  Upon arrival the outside tables and tables inside restaurant were clutter free and the restaurant was very clean. We were greeted by the Owner, Carol, and she welcomed us with a big hello. She was very helpful in explaining all of the sandwiches and asked us what we liked and then guided us to specific flavors and toppings that we might like. I had the #50. It was awesome. The capers, olive, tomato and the artichoke tapenade really married with the mozzarella cheese and ham. The crispy crust on bread was flakey like a empenada. So different and one of a kind, than any sandwich on this continent. Carol designed and Patent the sandwich press to be just hers. It was designed after her grandmothers cooking vessel from South Africa, where she got the idea from grandma's breakfast she always was served. My wife had #44. I tried the sandwich and was in heaven. The eggs frittata were perfectly cooked, moist and super flavorful. The roasted peppers and cheeses blended together with the bacon, basil and ham. My wife didnt want the feta and substituted cheddar instead. Carol explained, we will make whatever you want. She was so awesome and friendly. The cashier was super too. Very helpful in describing what ingredients were in food. The potato salad is crazy good!!! Wasn't real sure by looking at it, corn and black beans in it, but it is my new favorite potato salad. This place is so different, you have to try it. Cant compare this type of sandwich to anyone. One of a kind. Very creative. Carol does it right. By the way, for dessert we got a treat. Carol made us #55. A great way to finish lunch. Warm Peanut butter, Nutella, bananas, and roasted almonds. Very sinful. Not being a big dessert type guy, all I could say was, oh my God. Chef John's Stamp of approval. Definitely will be back soon. If you go, tell Carol, John and Linda recommended trying Zookz.

XzY9L-1ppn9_IPc2micv9w.text: Staff is super nice, and the pocket sandwiches are really good -a bit small tho- I LOVE their kale salad: the best in town!

exqNNRJUZBEaoq6Pi8liwg.text: I've drove by zooks several times and always wanted to go in. Today I finally did and I'm glad I did I had to very picky teenagers with me so not trying zooks before I was a little worried. As we walked in we were greeted by a nice guy behind the counter who explained the zook menu I ordered the #20 and my kids customized their sandwiches they got chips and I got kale salad. We got our drinks and sat down shortly our sandwiches were delivered and they were great pot pie like sandwiches, my picky kids loved them everything at zooks was great we're going back soon!

sNCcYix_dkfYkWi_SnAZLw.text: What an an incredible variety of choices. There is something for everyone. Fresh Fabulous and Fantastic. Zooks is my favorite place to eat.

hkmXKilRfHH8APNN6t0gGg.text: Different but great.  The sandwiches, sides are awesome. In a nice plaza with outdoor and indoor seating.  For your health.

C4aqnXgNMloDdSgf10g-rA.text: Stopped in to get breakfast after reading Yelp reviews.  Sandwiches were yummy and really fresh.  My husband got a lunch sandwich and loved the kale salad that came with it.  Great coffee as well.  Owner was really friendly and helpful.  We live in Washington, DC and are sorry that this is not a place we can frequent!

kqrxPcZYpkHNeInAiAxOxQ.text: Interesting concept for a sandwich. I enjoyed the taste but still find myself to be a sandwich traditionalist so I'm not sure that this is a place that I will frequent. The staff was very nice and the service was quick.  The bread tasted a little sweet, almost like a griddle type of bread.  With everything baked in, I almost feel like I lost the the taste of the individual ingredients.

InNeuVXDPr1S5FjKpoVQXw.text: We live in Medlock district, within walking distant to Zookz.  Watched it come up and intended to give it a try early on but didn't.  One Sunday morn, on a walk with my older girl and with the baby in her mei tai, I realized they would be open by the time we finished.  When I arrived they had JUST opened for the day.  I was a sweaty mess and dragging my girls in.  The owner Carole was working and she was a VERY gracious host.  Explained the concept, asks us to make adjustments as desired and mentioned the kale & mandarin orange salad that is given with catering orders when I inquired for my office.  I got a few sandwiches to go so hubby and son could try them out as well.  She packed everything nicely for my walk home, poured the drink for me AND tossed in a sample of the salad.  BTW: Kale isn't high on my 'delish' meter.  However, this is now my ABSOLUTE FAVORITE SALAD hands down.  I actually drool at little whenever I think about it (darn it, there I go again...).  We have now gone a few more times and each sandwich has been warm, moist, toasty, crisp, flavorful and so wonderful it makes my husband smile to think about it.  One of our top 5 eateries and I personally LOVE her backstory (check out the About portion of their website).  Start-up businesses are rough.  We have a lot of great local-owned food establishments in the valley.   I truly wish her the best.  She's got a few more fans and regular customers from my house!

Re0ABgxHvKin508eb89k7g.text: Love the food and the concept. Original sandwiches, healthy, clean, and fresh flavors. Ate there for the first time today and the owner was a beautiful and kind lady. I highly recommend everyone check this place out and make it a routine!

z4ExdoB-w5NRRhXbWqKlTg.text: Amazing sandwiches! I have had the #11 and the #20. They were fresh and delicious. The kale salad is also delightful! If you haven't tried this restaurant, you have to go!

H1ZlF8EkvE5PW_-1BP0nTg.text: This place is amazing. The second time I came here the owner told me her story and talked with my friend and me for a while. She also had us try a side that she was working on at the time. It was great to witness such genuine passion. The food: absolutely delicious. Their breakfast and lunch options are incredible. I've tried almost all of them, and have yet to be disappointed. In addition to this, it is always extremely clean. The employees are all pleasant. The prices are extremely reasonable for the quality of food you get.

nkjaQzr_kVMGh6-AYPGbXg.text: This is a wonderful sandwich spot. Sandwiches are uniquely made and prepared to satisfaction.  This owner operated independent freshly clean new Phoenix restaurant offers a reasonable variety of hot sandwiches. Don't miss out on the kale salad.....it is heavenly.  We ended up having a bog bowl reorder after we were done with lunch.......it was soooo good.  The owner is very friendly, makes sure all customers are catered to satisfaction and custom makes sandwiches to your liking. It is definitely one of our new lunch/breakfast spots in town. :)

8ItHcFtUkp7WDXn_JDxpQw.text: LOVE this place...not only for their food but their excellent customer service which seems to stem from the owner herself. Each time I've been here I've been greeted pleasantly by both the owner and staff. My first visit, the staff was in the middle of changing shifts and my food took a little longer than usual. The owner recognized this without me saying anything and brought a free dessert. She even stopped by up make sure I enjoyed everything. My second visit the store was actually closed, but both the staff and owner were more than willing to still take my order. The owner even wiped our table off before I ate because she noticed the recent storm had blown dust on the table just minutes beforehand. It's service like this that really makes this place shine and coupled with the delicious sandwiches will keep me coming back!

rpLtTPweamoAUWf30Kf1CQ.text: Very tasty and original! Need to go back again soon to try some other sandwiches. They should get some decent locally roasted coffee.

UV0Xh1mAjakh2m1UWUBj-g.text: This place is great for lunch! The sandwiches are made fresh and the sides are delicious.  I ordered a #45 (Very similar to a caprese style sandwich), all the ingredients were put into a pita style bread, it didn't taste like pita, it tasted like bread if that makes sense.  Then the sandwich was pressed and heated. It was very tasty. My only complaint is that it was a little small. I easily finished it, and I rarely finish my food.  They have several sides to choose from, she gave me two so I could try them both. One was the kale salad the other was a chickpea salad... both were super flavorful. In fact, I next time I might see if they will put the chickpea salad in the bread and grill that up! Obviously, I plan on going back =)

2kJ-lgXnl00mQWLx8c4XjA.text: I typically don't like warm pressed sandwiches but this is totally different. The bread is really good, great sides (we had potato salad and kale salad), easy to eat on the go, can be eaten with one hand if necessary, reasonably priced, filling.   What I like most: fast, variety, healthy options, truly unique, great staff. The owner is very nice and truly passionate about this business.   Will be back next time I'm in the area.

a3kUZmfeViNPgpyAKQVdhg.text: If you're looking for something different, healthy and yummy, this is the place to try!

fAN_gUwiS1K55pvZdrdnAA.text: ZOOKS is so fast!!! I came during peak lunch hour and had never been here. I ordered what the girl at the counter referred to me and sat down. BAM! My food was already ready to enjoy. I Was pleasantly surprised at how big the sandwhiches are stuffed! The team there is happy to serve you, work really fast and if you follow them on social media they have off-the-menu items you can order!! They aim to please and rightfully so being ranked by Food Network's 'Best Breakfast in Arizona.'

L_ZVWIJwNHzKIMGKB9UqLg.text: Just tried this place for the first time for lunch, and it was really good! It's a really cute spot and in a great location, next door to a lot of other fun places like Huss or Flower Child.   They have really good prices, and you get a lot for your money. The sandwiches all come with your choice of three side salads, but the sandwiches themselves are definitely filling enough. I also noticed you can get craft beer for only $3.75!  We each got the No. 44, which is basically a caprese sandwich. It definitely wasn't the best one I've ever had, but it was still really good! I think what I didn't like was that the cheese wasn't melty and the sandwich wasn't that hot, which is more of a personal opinion :) And their bread is amazing!  The staff were all really nice and helpful, and the owner even came out and asked us if we enjoyed our food. It was really nice! I'll definitely be coming back.

cpk4Y0XrFzgYAkp4JG-gaQ.text: Ah. I love this place. The owner is ALWAYS working, even on the weekends. Which says a lot to me. When you're waiting for your order read the story behind the business, it is very inspiring.   I tend to avoid dairy and the number 10 with the cheese held is pretty dang great for others that are lactose intolerant. My husband gets the one with horseradish and potato every time and graciously allows me a few bites.   I ten to normally gravitate towards greens/very healthy sides, but here I LOVE the garbanzo side salad. Each lunch sandwich comes with your choice of side so that's always great.   The star of the show is of course the sandwiches. The way they are crisped is to perfection. The ice coffee is pretty dang great too. For those needing to avoid gluten, they offer gluten free bread for a few dollars more. Not sure if they use a different toasting mechanism for those with Celiac Disease.   The space is a happy spot that is very clean (another huge plus in my book). Couldn't recommend this place more! Support a locally owned business and come here!

z92-Rd3CbWtkHHAlpeWA1g.text: Quick easy place with delicious food! Stopped here this afternoon and I had bookmarked it a couple of years ago. Was happy to see a few delicious looking vegetarian options! I got 45 which had mozzarella, spinach, tomatoes, and some kinda delicious sauce on it. The sandwich being pressed that way made it a little easier to eat while driving haha. Plus the crisp bread was fantastic. I got a kale and carrot salad as my side and it was delicious. While I was waiting the owner was walking around and talking to people, she seemed very friendly! Food isn't priced too bad either for such wonderful stuff. I'd be happy to come back here!

Aybee3a20F53pcr2R5ZzUQ.text: So, to be fair, I ordered the wrong one and I took it to-go so it wasn't exactly fresh when I ate it.  That said, not bad.  Imagine someone took two not very sweet pancakes (more on the savory side) and crimped them together and stuffed them with fresh sandwich ingredients; that's kind of what it's like.  I had the No. 10.  I didn't carry for the almonds, but that's just a personal preference (again I accidentally ordered the wrong one).  The turkey however seemed fresh and wasn't dry and all the flavors worked well together.  It takes some time getting used to the whole pancake like bread thing.  I would have liked if it came with a side of fries, but they do offer salad or chips that comes with the meal.  All-in-all, I would try it again just to see what it's like fresh.  If you're ordering to-go you may want to look at other options, unless it's really close by.

JTb1WMiFOoYXkBedAagPQg.text: Uh-may-zing!!!! Like no sandwich I have had before. Eggy, cheesy, bacony!!! And what might be even better than the sandwich is the story of how it came to be. Glad that I stumbled upon this gem and so happy to hear they have another location downtown and now at the airport!!! Truly a Phoenix treasure.

WLrqWwch4lgGH3Ui7vG2mA.text: One of my fav go to lunch spots. Love all the different sandwiches and the kale salad is delish. Kind of pricy though.

0Q6XPNcAL3XZlqHKCz5nwg.text: So delicious! Who thought it would be a good idea to put a poached egg in this little pocket o plenty for breakfast?! Well they were correct!  Yum the breakfast Zookz are amazing, poached to perfection egg, with bacon, basil, cheese and chives! What the heck?! Then placed between two slices of bread to be toasted into a pocket of sorts (without butter) to a crispy perfection of heck yah! I' a huge fan!  They have a winning combination here!  Fast, flavorful, filling and affordable! If you haven't tried a Zookz what are you waiting for? Go here, get full, thank me later. :)

SqSp1zKmO2NmP-TYKuDObg.text: This was my first time trying Zookz and I was extremely pleased! I tried #20 which was a turkey, cheddar, bacon, tomato and avocado sandwich which was fantastic! Their sandwiches are round and toasted to perfection to where the cheese melts throughout the sandwich.  All lunch sandwiches include a side salad which was the perfect amount to compliment the sandwich. I choose to try the Garbanzo bean salad which was delicious.   The service and seating was superb! After you order you sit down and they bring you your meal. They have an open air concept with indoor and outdoor seating with misters. I had a great meal and experience and will be looking forward to my next sandwich here!

Cant wait to try the dessert ones. Kinda like a grown ups hot pockets!

w4Yr9jhh3cbBNSC8eGSD6A.text: This place is the option for a busy day, when you are hungry and you need something to boost your day. The personnel it is very kind and the service is good. The sandwiches N.33 and N.66 are tasty and well cook. Also so there are a lot of options to choose from. Definitely I'll return to this place.

54QaHnZJKD_lz4ywnty83Q.text: There is this cool, clamp sandwich applicance my family has used for years that was originally developed in India. Well, this brilliant Arizona female entrepreneur has taken that basic concept and adapted it to a larger, toasted sandwich filled with all sorts of incredible ingredients. I had a breakfast sandwich filled with poached eggs, feta, spinach and tomatoes that was delicious. I also appreciated how the owner came out and spoke with customers, many who were trying her sandwiches for the first time. I suggest that everyone give this creative endeavor a try--they're yummy! They have both breakfast and lunch items. Congrats, and best wishes to this winner of a new concept.

QXIllWwDnNVd1PinzYqrMQ.text: Zookz is a fun little stop to grab breakfast. It has seating both inside and out (the outer seating is very limited). Everything is made into these wonderful little sandwiches and it follows the recent trend of counter service with a flair. Although I cant recall the name of the exact breakfast sandwich I had consumed, I can tell you that it was delicious! The restaurant itself is both cute and quaint being tucked into the easternmost portion of Uptown Mall.   Twyla and I opted for the Mimosas which were a little top heavy in O.J. My first comment was that if they were going use a disposable glass for the drink, at least get something that Champagne would be served in. A 5oz squat plastic cup was not the ticket for me and really retracted from the experience of drinking a Mimosa. Additionally, If your operation does not have a dishwasher, there are ways to give your customers a more upscale feel without tapping into your profitability too heavily. I'm sure that they do not pour hundreds of these per day. Is the "Dollar Store" ringing a bell.   Our patio location was very enjoyable and ambiance was great for our breakfast. All of the staff that we had encountered were super nice and very helpful. Don't worry Zookz, We'll be back to see you but I'm going to ask what glass my Mimosa is coming in or I'll bring my own disposable...  #Irishcatv2 #vino2 #Vinosquared #vino2ultimate

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States

YnwOQ0cun8o1EGhcQrtNOg.text: This is a great place that serves affordable toasted pita pocket sandwiches for breakfast or lunch. Depending on the mood I am in, I get the #55 - nutella, bananas, peanut butter with powdered sugar or the #11 with poached eggs, bacon, cheddar cheese, cream cheese, tomatoes and fresh basil. I am sure if I would deviate from my favorites, it would still be good. Two sandwiches and two drinks will set you back about $16 or $17. They are extra fast bringing orders out. It is a definite stop when we are in Phoenix.

OZI3dF5vw7MHYoaW6L6_4g.text: We got our salad and sandwiches to go for our hiking trip. We got the No9 kale salad and 4 other sandwiches. Even after hiking for 2 hours our food was still good after putting them in a food saver bag. The kale salad was one of the best kale salads I ever had! The kale along with the mandarin oranges and they dressing was so delicious! I would definitely come back here to just eat the salad. The sandwiches all came with either chips or small salad. My family chose to get the different small salads and they were all good! Such a cute concept with the circle sandwiches and everything was fresh tasting.

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. No.9 kale salad so yummy!

SOMRHKsQgTjEWjczesY1jg.text: Must try sandwich place,  serves breakfast sandwiches all day,  best sandwiches I've had in Phoenix.  Hubby and i shared no. 20 Turkey and no.35 roast beef.  The flavors explode in your mouth,  making you close your eyes and say mmmmm with each bite. The potato salad and the garbanzo bean salad are so yummy too.  Definitely our new favorite place.

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States

9c_bBFA2tN3oWb6-h3yCBQ.text: Ahhh the memories of camp pies. Sitting around the campfire with a cast iron press, grab two slices of bread and some filling and you're on you're way. Egg, roast beef, spaghetti, berries, apple pie, or what have you. Zookz have capitalized on the idea and have turned it into a thriving business, and their sandwiches are top notch.   Star 1: How were the service and atmosphere?  The service is fast and friendly at Zookz, and they're simplified the process so that you'll have a sammie in hand shortly after ordering at the counter. Star Granted.   Star 2: How were the portions relative to the cost?  The sandwiches at Zookz aren't huge, but they're priced affordably, and my #22 breakfast sandwich with egg, ham, black beans, and chipotle sauce came to only $6.50, which was a great price point. Star Granted.   Stars 3 and 4: How was the food?  As others have stated, the bread is what really makes the difference here. I don't know whether they add some spices to the mix or what, but I could have eaten the bread plain. From there, the fillings in my breakfast sandwich came together nicely into what was a good sandwich, although I'll note that my sandwich was seriously lacking in the ham department. Single Star Granted.   Star 5: Would you eat here every day if you could?  I've known of camp pies for decades now, but I'm thrilled that someone has made a great business out of it. I'd gladly come here daily. Star Granted.

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. #22: $6.50

QC42S1j1DT8eyAukCF_tYg.text: The store is trendy looking. It has outside seating and walls that open up to let the air in. In March, it was quite comfortable. I'm not sure how that works in July.  When I grew up, we had a sandwich press which was fun to use. Put in a slice of bread, meat, cheese, and another slice of bread. Put the top down and cook for a couple minutes. Well this place has made a business with these machines.  The edges are a little hard, but that's a result of the sandwich press. The insides are hot and melty.  This is a great place for a sandwich!

-smILETelGuw1Ym9XqFcWA.text: You've gotta try it! A great variety of delicious combinations, toasted into sandwich pockets. Worth going out of your way for.

tqi2VK6tCGbglXQBH7MLNQ.text: Zookz never disappoints.  The flavors in each sandwich are perfectly balanced to make your mouth water.  Plus since the sandwiches are made fresh if you don't like an ingredient just ask for it to be left out.  However with the quality ingredients they use I doubt you will want to have anything taken out.    My only complaint (as if it's really a complaint) is that I can't convince Carole or the Zookz crew to become my free personal chef.

8gCT-OTXXZqotQOqns7UmQ.text: Sandwiches were a little small but delicious and very different as a toasted circle. The chipotle potato salad was worth the price of admission!

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States

rqVBL70TYORK7A3s-0tc_Q.text: They have good breakfast sandwiches and the staff is always really friendly. They could do a few things better taste wise on some stuff but they are definitely creative with their food.

G6azV9L8PW0JOmZs2LszYQ.text: I love breakfast sandwiches! Zooks are amazing! I went off menu with a simple pouched egg, bacon and green onions with gluten-free bread.  Loved it.  My spouse had number 66 and she was very happy also.  Sure hope this becomes a franchise and will spread across the country!

dDgfQX0peyHuF6YfkBn1sA.text: Zookz offers panini-type sandwiches.  They're the shape of a circle and they're delicious!  I don't like the crust on my bread so this works out for me!  Being from Seattle, I grew up eating Tim's Cascade Chips and miss them so much -- to my delight, they offer them here!  Such a great surprise!  And they offer various kinds, too!  Even better!  They also have a killer kale side salad available!  It really is good - and this is coming from a kale-hater.  Anyway, they are also open for breakfast - not just lunch.  And during lunch they're pretty busy and parking is limited/tight but it's sooo worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Zookz sign

AfCdAmTbUNarlK5W_bVqDg.text: Amazing sandwiches. My coworker would eat the egg sandwich everyday if she could. I had a salad which was incredible fresh but could have had more chicken.  I understand they are mostly a sandwich shop but I wish their other menu items got as much lovin! The entire staff was very friendly, great location, clean, and inviting.

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. #22

wXubiogjMKVS-Nc0vdCtjA.text: Today was my first time eating here. I got the no. 66. First bite, and I was like... WOW. That's all I gotta say. So good!

JuurQnjk5mYT5T1WwOkH-Q.text: I really appreciate the creativity of this place. It's more than just your average sandwich. I personally enjoy the breakfast themed items. The staff always have great recommendations and the owner always comes out to ensure my food was made correctly and thank me for visiting. It's a cute place to grab a quick bite to eat or to hang out and enjoy the fun atmosphere.

xpx2LPBfe3l878WAdSlZHQ.text: One of the best sandwich place I have been to, hands down! Went in here with family and each of us ordered a different sandwich. We all loved it except my daughter decided she didn't care for the one she ordered without even tasting it. The owner was so nice she decided she was going to make her an other sandwich to her liking - on the house!! Who does that?.. wow!   This place is a little far for us but anytime I am near the area, I'll make sure to visit this joint again.

tHP37FybJ55D3GiGEuengg.text: Luckily I saw ZookZ on check please Arizona, what an incredible place to go the sandwiches are absolutely perfect, I had the number 66 and it was incredible and for desert I had the 55 . The service was impeccable and the owner absolutely knows what she's doing, the perfect hostess, great job can't wait to go back, I recommend this place to everybody 10 out of 10 .

5XzAjHoJKmrrhqmJowb5-w.text: What a lovely place! The owner came out to my table and talked with my mom and I about our order. She talked about how those sandwiches came to be and about how this new location was working wonders.   The food is excellent! My sandwich had green Chile and macaroni on it (it was a special that day). And holy hand grenades it was amazing! So warm and toasty, spicy but not hot, and made with love.   I chose to have the side kale salad with my sandwich as well. I didn't think I liked kale but gosh d*rn it was really good! It had this tangy vinaigrette on it and came with mandarin slices. I give it an excellent out of 10!   I just wish the sandwhich was a little bigger. But other than that this place is great and I will be back soon!

TVX1OSCxmp6pWSgYXnTGgA.text: Wow, great place: open layout, centrally located and, most importantly, good food! I had the No22 and a passion fruit mimosa--both were very tasty. I'll be back.

aAV6qRdrERFamQ-HLJO30Q.text: This place was so cute! I loved the decorations as well as the vibe of the place!  It was pretty modern, yet rustic at the same time! I really enjoyed the uniqueness of it all! But, on to what I'm actually here for, I really liked the food! I got number 35 and my bro got 20. Next time, I'd probably get number 20 because the horseradish sauce on number 35 was a little too strong, and overpowered the rest of the flavor that I otherwise could've enjoyed. I don't count that against them because it was my choice on the sandwich. I tried some of number 20 and my mind was blown! It was so good! My mom also got number 20 with ham instead of turkey. From the circle-sandwiches to the sunflowers, this place was awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States

reYPBFilKtbbH1tYJ6NiEQ.text: Easily one of our favorite sandwich places in town. Even the side salad that comes with the sandwich taste great.

w8LIeijRzIf5io7Tf91QnA.text: LUNCH OUTTING.   I've been driving past this place since I moved here April 3rd and finally stopped in....   I am now kicking myself for waiting a month before I was introduced to coolest places for sandwiches.   We first walked in around 1145am and it was too crowded but we had to wait in a small line. My friend and I l we discussing to each other what we were going to order. As we wakes up the lady at the counter was already on top of our order from hearing us and wrote down a 15 and a 20 on our bags. we then proceeded to talk to my friend about the 15 and how they tried it with a new ingredient recently which enhanced the sandwich. At that point I asked the lady if this was her shop. She told me it was hers and that they would love to hear our feed back with any suggestion on sandwiches and ingredients.she always gave us her recommendation on which side was her favorite and the most popular. (the sandwich comes with a side or a bag of chips).   I ordered the turkey with avocado and bacon and a spicy Dijon sauce. My side was the garbanzo bean salad. We sat down at the table and the owner delivered our food herself. The sandwich came out pressed, toasted, and eye popping. My mouth began to salivate immediately!!    The sandwich was as delicious as it looked. crispy from the toasted bread. smokey from the bacon. creamy from the avocado. spicy from the mustard.  would I go back?  Verdict: ABSOLUTELY!   let me mention it was impressive to get such personal service from the owner of the business. she was attentive, helpful, inclusive, and genuine. you don't get service like this very often from the proprietor very often. the price was appropriate and the service was above and beyond excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. number 20 with garbabanzo bean salad and green tea.
Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. the owner

QRbZEEnNJtvnCRvxPAcH0A.text: I love how genuinely happy and helpful the staff are. Of the two times I've been to Zookz, the owner has approached me and asked if everything was up to par and how I heard about them.   I had the Turkey Avocado sandwich (I believe it's No. 20) and it's delicious! I also had the kale salad which was really good :) I'll be back!

HFcxmoAmw8I2wbmNlWCR0Q.text: Although our offices are in North Scottsdale,. We always get a yearning for one of these great sandwiches.  And although the drive is 35 minutes one way we come and partake in these unique sandwiches and desserts.  The only complaint I have,  is they do not have a location in Scottsdale.  I hope the people of Central Phoenix and Downtown Phoenix appreciate this wonderful restaurant.

bu4ovzvMpHuf5Zexy3Fk-g.text: Really cool place to eat. Friendly and fast service. Sandwich was bomb, but the price was a bit high for the size even though it's a neat concept for a sandwich. Just wish the sandwich was a little bigger.

q-XEx5og1lR1Ts03-cibFw.text: Delicious food and friendly staff.  Even had a chance to meet the owner.  Tasty salad, had the no. 5.  My husband had a Jaffle- one of their signature sandwiches!

9T3qZBBFqPTYXlzjJgd0Xg.text: This is such a quaint sandwich shop with delicious food and great service. The owner Carol was great...very friendly, informative and welcoming! I highly recommend checking this place out...we will be back!

neqszX33KxDSM4Zle4n2Vg.text: Delish sandwich and amazing little salad.  If the items were cheaper or the portions bigger I would give them 5 stars.  Come if you're feeling peckish, not famished!

xvwRkEjVtZ7JP67cWb51Tw.text: I went back to Zookz today and I ordered the #35, it was as delicious as it was when Carole opened her restaurant a few years ago! Zookz is a great option for a light sandwich! The kale salad was delicious and I love the Tea! I hope there are plans for soup on the menu this winter and I will be back every day!!!

DYiXqu0aIOWQYWKDMv_DzQ.text: My husband and I just had Zookz for the first time. Got the breakfast sandwich and roast beef. Couldn't wait to take a bite so we jumped in on the breakfast one when we got in the car. What a flavor blast!! We live far but we will definitely be back. The owner Carole took time to talk with us and was very sweet. Highly recommended! !

uhTGJY5nlNzzJwVM8SKj1w.text: This is a delightful little find in Central Phoenix. The proprietor is engaging, warm and friendly and her staff embraces her tone.   Love, love, love the circular sandwiches & the fact that the staff will make some special off-the-menu combinations from the listed ingredients for my daughter. The kale salad is extraordinary - now don't go making a face at the word "kale" - this is not your mother's kale, nor her kale salad. It is delicious & doesn't taste or feel at all like an obligatory, virtuous but hard to swallow dish. If there is enough salad, you can request a large size to take home & impress your family.   And if you like chocolate, the brownies are excellent.  Now is the time to start enjoying the patio out front.

2HCdmV9ZTDhE8eV0mWefSw.text: I absolutely love this place.  I went in about a month before it opened and talked with the owner, and she convinced me to come back when it opened.  And boy, was I glad I did.  Each of their uncrustable-styled sandwiches are DELICIOUS BEYOND ALL BELIEF.  At first, it looks like they won't be super-filling, BUT THEY ARE and the prices are more reasonable and service is efficient and friendly.  The owner and manager are always out and about, talking to customers and sending samples.  I got to try their nutella-banana zook before they started selling them and it was ridiculously amazing.  This is one of my new go-tos on Fridays and I will definitely be in again and again.

fqFLoW4jkb4E6LdsPKREDQ.text: Great little spot for a quick bite, but furniture is not comfortable enough to hang out.  Cool twist on a sandwich with the perfect ratio of bread to yummy fillings.  Loss of a star because parking sucks.

H-3PfbAIOTK3SsxxyGvlHg.text: My first time here, and I had to kick myself for not coming sooner!  Delicious sandwiches and salads. The kale salad was so good I could actually picture being a vegetarian. I will definitely be back for great food at a great price.

KDGhP5x06Ih0n2gk-QExaQ.text: Got the no. 33 sandwich and even after reading the positive reviews and viewing the photos, the sandwich managed to surpass my expectations! Service was excellent as well. Keep doing what you're doing.

0pEv3UDJaJtzxEzdgasPlg.text: Stopped here for a lunch after reading good reviews. They were pretty spot on. The owner is a very nice lady who is very involved and is local, which is cool by me. Always good to support local small businesses.  The menu isn't too large but you can customize your sandwiches. I tried to have my sandwich with chipotle sauce instead of mustard, and it even said it on the bag, but i definitely still got mustard, or their chipotle sauce tastes exactly like mustard....   The sandwich was pretty good. A little small and the flavors are kind of all blended together which is a little different, but good. They have Tim's chips which are amazing (try the sour cream chips) and the price is reasonable, although if you are really hungry this is probably not going to be a place to order just one sandwich.  I appreciate the owner's dedication and effort in a tough area (near the light rail in north central phoenix), but I worry about the ability to run a successful business there. I think a place like this would do amazing in old town or PV or near ASU. Probably even in growing rural parts of Chandler and Gilbert. It's got a tough battle being located where it is, mainly because of the lack of foot or car traffic. I hope they do or that they move somewhere closer to me because I did like the place.  I will definitely stop by here again if I am in that area and I wish this place the best, thanks again.

EPEM0yEJxHWw0brEIsz_Dg.text: My husband and I took a late morning ride to our fave bookstore and decided to use the gift card for Zookz that someone had given him, for an early lunch. Now is the time to experience this place...while it's still not too hot out. We sat close to the wide open doors and got a nice mist going while we ate our sandwiches.  Try the #20 on the menu, their most popular sandwich.  If you've been stuck out in the burbs of Phoenix, now is the time to support the small establishments that have cropped up in the central corridor area of downtown Phx.  A great place to try out some awesome sandwiches, either breakfast or lunch. They have outdoor seating, but the parking is on the short side, so do this...............get there early on a Sunday morning, bring your fave electronic gadget or NYTimes, and enjoy the kind of weather other parts of the country will only see in 2 months............

1W7NVB5BjUG-3aFZjNbJXA.text: Oh my goodness!! Amazing Sandwiches and sides!! The people here are also so nice. I had an amazing first time experience  all around!

ZTbexr6MSGV_UvNMNbW7Dg.text: Stopped by for breakfast on our way out of town.  The ladies were very friendly and didn't mind some special requests (for my kiddos).  The sandwiches were very tasty and just the right size. Will definitely come again to try their lunch sandwiches/salads.

7_7XAbsAH5y6bKJDatA6Jw.text: I feel in love with Zookz the first time popped in one Friday in March 2013.  I ordered a breakfast sandwich requesting no meat and was immediately offered fresh spinach as a substitute! Wow!! I have been hooked ever since and absolutely adore the curried turkey sandwich with kale salad. Alone or together these elements are outstanding!! Truly delicious with a wonderful melange of ingredients and a mild curry sauce. I like really hot curry but this subtle sauce works well for a general palate. The physical space is light and airy and the outdoor seats are nice. The place is always spotless (including the restroom.) This locally-owned eatery should be a must go-to place on a foodie's list. The pastry of the "sandwich" is neither heavy nor greasy and provides a nice crunch to the ingredients. Do yourself a favor and support a local business and enjoy some tasty food.

ZNBqfTirTHmVzVZNbqRHoA.text: I highly recommend Zooks. I drove by Zooks for months always wanting to try it and now I regret waiting so long! The staff was excellent and gave us some great recommendations since it was our first time. I had the Turkey, bacon, avocado (sorry, I can't remember the number!) and my boyfriend had the #22 breakfast sandwich. Both were delicious. I wish we would have split our sandwiches instead of both eating our own! For sides, we had the potato salad and garbanzo bean salad, both were great. They had a slight lemon zest flavor which was a nice touch. The owner stopped by to check on us and she was very friendly. The lack of parking doesn't bother me because we walked from my apartment and it is walking distance from the light rail. Overall, we will be returning and recommending Zooks!

wgJ5OzWADLSFMQ1aH1s4FQ.text: I stumbled upon this place with my boyfriend as we were driving up Central Avenue looking for a place for brunch. It's perfect if you're looking for a relaxing, tasty experience that won't be expensive. They serve sandwiches for breakfast and lunch with fantastic side dishes. My favorite sandwich is the one with ham, brie, apricot jam, and almonds! I have been back multiple times and I have never had something I did not like. The absolute best thing there is the kale salad, which seems crazy I know, but they dress it up so well that the kale is soft and sweet. I could eat multiple bowls of it in one sitting (this coming from someone who despises kale in most settings.) The owner always comes to check on how we liked everything and sometimes brings us the sandwiches when they're ready. They have a nice patio with outdoor seating and the front of the store opens up so everyone can enjoy the morning breeze. Overall this place consistently provides delicious food and awesome service!

KoOQXXwN8_an4hYcfXtz7w.text: I just died and went to heaven.

fACfG-6eUsn-fvSY3Ovv6w.text: I really enjoyed my sandwich very much, I don't eat meat and the veggie sandwich was probably the best veggie sandwich I have ever eaten. The flavors collided together to provide such a unique taste that was delicious! I will definitely return for another sandwich!

Vh1DG6mlhtmWJy-Ukxo_7w.text: Absolutely love this place. Everything was amazing! The service and food! The cashier and chef were extremely nice and they said that if I didn't like my food they can make me a new one. Of course that wasn't necessary because I loved what I ordered. 100% recommended.

uB9kUDnkxKYp9C3UztduvA.text: Delicious, unique, and you will be so glad you tried it! Best. Sandwich. Ever. Plus, amazing service!!!!! Thank you Zooks!!!!!

6cJKgCtlMtCfKHmYkvjRFg.text: My boyfriend and I were in the mood for a good sandwich so we decided to try Zookz after seeing all the positive reviews on Yelp.  We are very happy that we did - actually, we were so happy that we went back 3 times in 1 week! The sandwiches are very unique and there are a good number of variations to try. The Kale salad is also very good and is a nice and healthy accompaniment.  I also recommend trying the "carrot" cake which the owner told us is not made with carrots at all, but actually beets. It is really delicious.  Not too sweet and just the right amount of frosting!  The owner is quite friendly as well and you can tell that she really cares about the quality of her food and providing a positive experience for her customers.  Overall, I'd say that Zookz is a fantastic new addition to the Central Phoenix area when you are in the mood for a tasty sandwich for breakfast or lunch at a very reasonable price.

W8yrVsv59vukyos2bhJLNQ.text: We love this casual sandwich shop that specializes in disc-shaped toasted sandwiches. The owner is always around greeting her patrons and making sure that the quality is consistent. The sandwiches themselves are awesome. Perfect crunchiness every bite but never burnt.  My wife had her favourite, curry turkey (no 15), and it was just as good the first time we came by. I had the poached egg and bacon (no 22), which was good, but I probably should have gone with a lunch sandwich given the time of day. Every item on the menu has been an explosion of savoury delight. This is our favourite sandwich place in the valley.

HPPW7ncrOuEGTzzU18hwQA.text: Super yummy!! My husband and I ate at Zookz today and it was truly delicious. We ordered the breakfast Zinger and the lunch #20 and shared-both were fabulous. You wouldn't believe how many restaurants can screw up a poached egg, but Zookz is great. Oh, and the potato salad was superb. My husband is not a potato salad fan and he loved it. The Owner was so nice-very engaging with all of the customers, helped with setting a highchair at our table for our baby boy, and made sure we knew about the specials available. All in all great food and service. We will be back!

5jv0KeJ_NoJw6zkxLBPj3Q.text: I live in San Franciso and was visiting mom in Phoenix, when two of my mother's friends turned us on to Zookz for sandwiches.    My mother and I have lived all over the world and we really appreciate a good meal and yes, and it takes a little to surprise us -but Zookz did in a very delicious way.     Zookz sandwiches are indeed unique/cutting edge and incredibly flavorful.  We had #30 and #45 - we split them so that we could each try two, additionally, the kale salad was tender and flavorful.  (Despite the amazing nutritional properties of kale, I am only a kale fan if it's tender,  doesn't have a real strong kale flavor and is tasty - this salad met all of those requirements :)) Last but far from least was Zookz chocolate dessert. It was truly an after thought as I really didn't think a "sandwich nook" would have an exceptional dessert in their "to go" refregerated case; however, my mother who has a real sweet tooth insisted on splitting a dessert :)   I am a True chocoholic - very selective - I went in for that first bite with an average expectation and wow!  My mother and I were competing for the finish :)  Carol, the owner, came up and introduced herself while we were trying to decide on what to order.  We peppered her with questions on sandwiches as well as Zookz origination, given we just read the history of Zookz on the wall which begged more questions... We found out that Carol too has had the fortunate history of living abroad along with a real passion for baking and cooking.  Prior to starting Zookz, Carol made and distributed a number of her own receipes, including homemade sauces which she incorporates into her sandwiches.  Carol is a True inspiration starting Zookz after the age of 50.  She is an energetic, very attractive businesswoman who has created a unique and delicious sandwich not just to Phoenix but the United States - I have never had anything like it!  I look forward to returning on my next visit,  tasting several more sandwiches along with another chocolate dessert :)!!!

nplxsbWmN7zhekLXBK60Kg.text: Love this little place!  Great food, great customer service, and reasonably priced.  Highly recommend trying out this little neighborhood shop!

VB5GG343n6wSKY-X3fGEkw.text: A very cool twist on the traditional sandwich.  Great menu choices.  Side salads were different and wonderful.  Don't miss the peanut butter/Nutella sandwich as a desert. Great staff.  Terrific food.  We will be back for sure.

BptCVVeVsMTk4V68986BGg.text: This is great, fresh and delish.  My only complaint would be that I would love more salads.  I am a wheat free, gluten free person and can't eat the "bread."   I love the kale salad and hope that in the future, they will expand their salad menu.  Love the crew that own and work here.

Agkq6KhuYY0dqltb-oUS3g.text: Went here to pick up a sandwich to go.  Counter lady was friendly.  Chose the Mozzerella/basil/tomato.  When I opened the bag, I thought- Oh, man- it's so small. (the size of a appetizer paper plate)  But it was REALLY, REALLY good and filling!  There are no bread choices- it's sorta the 'Hot Pocket' concept, but fresh and round.   I wasn't offered any side choices other than the kale salad which was really good.  It was a bit soggy n the middle when I got back to work.  Had I eaten in, rather than to go, it would have been perfect.  This is not a buy the sandwhich and put it in the fridge until lunch kinda place.  I will definitely go back and eat in or within a few minutes.   I hope they make it!!!!

KsBws9occl3wmUmS7zunrQ.text: Fantastic customer service! Delicious food! My sandwich was soooo yummy! And reasonably priced! So glad I came in!

5npJ8mBwUkJgzCwjZqT8uA.text: I'm in my first trimester of my pregnancy and woke up craving a breakfast sandwich. I found this place online and after seeing the pictures of the sandwiches I had to go. Ive been extremely nauseous this pregnancy and I hardly enjoy my food as much as I normally do, but I remained optimistic... It was raining today so, my fiance and I dressed our two toddlers in some warm clothes and headed out. When we got there the parking was sparse, but luckily we found a spot right in front of the restaurant. When we got out of the car I noticed the place was a bit smaller than I anticipated, but I liked that there was a nice, large sliding glass door which was opened. I liked that there was a good amount of seating outside as well. When we walked towards the register we were greeted by a very kind and friendly lady. I let her know it was a first time there and she seemed very happy to help us. She told us about their most popular sandwiches and kindly recommended the sandwich with nutella, banana and almonds for our children. My fiance ordered The Zinger which was amazing according to him and that's a huge compliment because with his father being an impeccable cook, he is all about quality and taste when it comes to his food. I'm not sure if my sandwich had a name, but it had turkey ,bacon, avocado and honey mustard I believe. I asked for the mustard on the side, because I wasn't sure if my unborn baby would take to it. The woman who took our order told me a side was included with my order and showed me to their refrigerator which had a few health conscious options. I decided on the garbanzo bean salad and she kindly handed me her kale and tangerine salad as well. I enjoyed both sides. My family and I sat outside since the rain had died down and enjoyed the fresh air. The woman who took our order also took our food to us outside while we were all taste testing the sides. My sandwich was amazing, my children's sandwich was amazing and the pomegranate green tea I ordered with my sandwich was VERY good. The woman came outside to check on us and to also let us know they will be moving down the street to the plaza with AJ's Fine Foods by the end of December because they are aware of the parking issue. I think with the food being so good they've outgrown their space. I had a very good overall experience  and will be visiting them at their new location in the near future!! I have not had many GREAT experiences with food in the last 3 months, but this was definitely one of them!

cQQkY6M65taFAoC_TGj5eQ.text: Awesome delicious and different sandwich place! Corn and bean salad was good, would like some other options.  Definitely want to go back and try one of everything! Staff were friendly.  All around great new little spot

OMBfktdK3auHL8Mrr8hkkQ.text: Zookz is my new favorite weekend lunch spot!  Their sandwiches are unique (they are crunchy and shaped in a circle) with great ingredients.  You can't find these anywhere else (that I'm aware of) so check it out when you are in the mood for something different.  The owner is always there and is very nice.  They are still new but I really hope they make it!

qnvtT6dg2f7lc1J7iZrzFg.text: If you are a sandwich lover, you will enjoy this place!  They also have really yummy salads including a kale salad that is to die for!  Fresh spin on the typical sandwich, fresh ingredients, and a great atmosphere!  And the owner is super sweet and nice! What more can you ask for.  Oh yeah, the price is just right too!

NSIO1Dh_5DwUfUIX_SN-Ug.text: 5 stars just cause i got a free sandwich for waiting too long. lol i'm a lazy writer but i had a good time so five stars.

hw1hqY9oeS7BmLTZNeXKRQ.text: Simple, tasty, fast - it was exactly what we were looking for. The prices are great too!   Their "sandwiches" are close to an empanada or calzone with all of the ingredients sealed into a sourdough crust.  It's crispy on the outside, but still soft and moist inside. My son keeps dreaming about his meal so we are on our way back there today!

qpKdLesLVu6tAbQfL64J6Q.text: My fist time here I was doubtful of what to order but I went with the pineapple coconut sandwich I think is 44 or 40 really good and make feel so happy and light

gWEzmKWCWBN7RwGGFvBUug.text: This place is adorable.  There are so many things to like, but the reason they only get 4 stars is they have a pretty limited menu, so you may not be able to find something for everyone to enjoy.  I walked in expecting a sandwich slapped together on two pieces of bread. The sandwich I received was far beyond this. I ordered a sandwich with poached eggs, avocado, and cheese. The sandwich reminded me of a toasted uncrustable, except with eggs and cheese instead of PB&J (but they have that if thats your kinda thing). Although, the bread is definitely not white bread -- it is more of a pot pie, uncrustable, sandwich, with breakfast on it. The poached egg was fantastic -- perfectly cooked! I 100% ordering a breakfast sandwich. They know how to cook an egg.  The atmosphere -- Its in a great location. They have a dog friendly patio and the inside is trendy. Service was quick and they were friendly. Nothing to brag or rag on.  I definitely suggest a visit to Zookz -- It is an out-of-the-box sandwich shop that's a perfect spot for brunch.

YQLW0f5DAzoX6zPGSmTOZA.text: Stopped by for a snack. Breakfast sandwich was amazing. Flavorful and delicious. Sad I haven't tried this place earlier.  Can't wait to try more menu items in the future.

itBlol46hiGP00d2vSbAnQ.text: Awesome place and atmosphere!!! Super friendly employees as well. Great food highly recommend.

k8nenWJw4EJ2tgYtRETsZQ.text: I came here mid afternoon for lunch on Sunday. It's in a plaza with a few other very popular spots in an area with quite a few good dining options so it can be easily overlooked. If you have a hard time looking for it just turn into the big plaza on central and camelback.   The interior is set up for a small-mediumish occupancy. You order food at the counter and they bring it to you. The open windows and large glass panel door is a really nice touch as it lets the sun in and brigthens up the dark wood/industrial interior.   I ordered the #33 adding avocado and chicken. Be aware that the sandwiches are quite small, one would probably easily in the palm of an adult's hand. But they are packed to the brim with their fresh ingredients and are quite filling.   The one thing I was really looking forward to was their poached eggs they put in the sandwich and I have to say I wasn't disappointed. It was a soft deliciously poached egg smack inside of a toasted sandwich. I'm not sure how they actually put the poached egg in there to be honest. I wish the yolk inside would've been runny but I can imagine it'd make the sandwiches a lot messier.  Although the ingredients inside the sandwich were terrific I really disliked the bread they used. I'm not sure what it was but it felt like toasted plain white wonderbread brushed with olive oil. It tasted flimsy with little substance and I found myself wanting to skip the bread and just eat the insides. I wish they used bread that was a bit better and more substantial but overall this is a great spot to get a quick bite to eat.

drFSZ32SPNGHpir8leTXsg.text: I come here probably once a week for the #22 and a big iced tea. This spot is perfect for a hot summer day or an early morning breafkast on the go. Takes probably 5 minutes from the time you order.   #22 is cheddar cheese - two poaches eggs - avocado - bacon - ham - black beans - and zookz chipotle sauce  This is a must have if youre in central phoenix or off camelback!

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. #22 is my personal favorite!

YzGGzCtWbEBk-oB0lzuVSw.text: The #55 Sweet sandwich is Nutella, peanut butter and bananas all warm and gooey. It is so yummy! Protein and fruit, it makes a great post workout treat. You can order ahead on the Yelp app so that it's quick.

0cJVeRjL3ZGct09-Q_eMew.text: I always order to go but I just have to say that their sandwiches are the best sandwiches EVER. I love them so much. I think about them every time I'm hungry. Who ever prepares my orders thank you so much, you guys are the best.

4kr2Ur2_MvfR-maTkDCH_w.text: So impressed! Will definitely be back again. The #20 was delicious and reminded me of a better hot pocket but with fresh ingredients! Fair priced and tastes good. Also have gluten free that is good!

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Gf #55

fWhbBjuSLpZKWE6AFvAjvw.text: I was in the Pheonix area visiting one of my best friends and decided to check this place out one morning.  The exterior is very inviting with a large bouquet of fresh sunflowers that match the bright yellow covered outdoor seating area. The interior is an open space with some bench style seating and private tables offering warm and fluffy pillows to make you feel at home. The menu is great, offering a plethora of rounded toasted breakfast and lunch sandwiches, in addition to healthy salads and juices.  I opted for the "Zinger" #66 which is crusted toasted bread pocket filled with poached eggs, cheddar cheese, tomatoes, bacon, and green onions, topped with a Zinger cream cheese sauce. So YUMMY! The lovely woman at the register was a ray of sunshine!! She was very welcoming when I walked in, offered to go through the menu of the most popular items and then gave me a free kale salad on the side -also delicious! I will be stopping back for sure!!!

One of the sandwiches had horseradish on it and I didn't like it and the owner kept her promise and made me a full new sandwich! The kale salad was also delicious. AFm90p3hxUWclhdu8BpWAw.text: We were looking for some quick sandwiches for lunch after a hike and stopped by Zookz to see what the fuss was about. I had the #20, and yes, $8.75 is pretty pricey for a fancy sandwich, but it was pretty darn tasty; good combination of turkey, bacon, avocado, tomatoes and cheddar cheese.
