BA00AK8__yf8INh5VJE0zg.text: Finally made it to Zooks for lunch and cant eait to come back. I had the #20 which has like turkey, avocado, some other stuff and a honey mustard sauce. SO amazing! Everything comes in like a little break pocket and heated. The only thing is that I wish they would open more locations...north Phoenix would be great!

8pfMRh-UD6pAFiKyHQF-QQ.text: I had the best lunch ever before I even had my meal. I shoot the sh*t with people nonstop because I'm a complete *sshole and like to have fun. Anyhow, the cashier pretended to ring me up for $35 regarding the imaginary Fifth of Vodka in the fridge on the right. (Long story) Anyhow, she rolled with the punches and had me dying laughing. An excellent sense of humor. She ended up telling me that she owns the place.   Excellent food, beyond excellent owner. I'll gladly give her my business anytime I'm in the area.

WhUFCbsBE9jd3DwFGfusWA.text: Breakfast is my favorite meal of the day and I have had a lot of breakfast sandwiches in my short lifetime so far. I would say by far this is one of the top 5 breakfast sandwiches I have ever had. It is not at all what I expected and the value for these sandwiches is fantastic. As a Arizona chain, I hope they continue to expand and bring zookz up to the PNW ASAP.   We came on a Saturday around lunch and I was expecting Zookz to be pretty busy and overwhelming. They had one or two customers in line, but the wait was not long. It only took about 10-15 minutes to order and get our food. The restaurant itself reminds me of southern california. It is open with patio seating and quaint tables that optimize the cozy restaurant space. The bar area had little hooks in front of your seat to hang coats and bags which I found very convenient and the chairs and stools were all quite comfortable (yes I tested multiple seats before deciding on a table).   The menu has a good variety of breakfast and other sandwich items. They also have a full-service espresso and coffee selection which is very appealing and more than I had expected. My friend ordered the No 66 and I ordered the No 22 (see pictures for menu). I also ordered a cappuccino. As they were order and sit, they give you a number and bring the food and drinks to you. As previously mentioned the food came in an extremely timely manner. The sandwiches were fresh and hot - I think I burned my face a little on my first bite. The bread outside is not quite like bread, but not quite tortilla either - it is like a crispy thin hybrid cooked to perfection. They invented their own sandwich press that seals in the sides much like a calzone (without the braiding) and keeps the runny egg yokes from spilling directly in a sad mess on your plate. The eggs themselves were poached to perfection and the rest of the ingredients were generous and proportionately placed. Overall, my sandwich was more than fantastic. It was still busy, but definitely a contained delicious mess that was well worth it. The value was also good at 6.25 a sandwich it was afforable and worth it. The cappuccino is the reason they are given 4 stars. It was bitter and tasted funny, perhaps because of standard water used. There was not much foam and it was a bit cold when it arrived.  However, overall, this was a great experience. I would likely recommend the breakfast sandwiches. They are AMAZING, but I look forward to trying all the other sandwiches at future Arizona visits. A must have while in the area if you are into breakfast or sandwiches or both of these things!

If you're looking for a cute place that isn't crowded, come here!! I order the number 66 which is the most popular and it is amazing. We also got a complimentary sandwich stuffed with warm and rich Nutella, bananas, and nuts. Come here if you're tired of trying Einstein bagels or average breakfast sandwiches. Price is worth it. Oddly shaped roast beef sandwich, but it sure was delicious.  Portion size is a tad smaller than expected, but given my waistline, I should be grateful for that. wICKPEzBnWQc2U18TiXMfA.text: Zookz is one of the most creative concepts I've experienced in Phoenix lately. I really love the founder's story of how she began to make these sandwiches and where her inspiration comes from.   If you haven't been to Zookz, let me explain why it's so special.   The founder created a special sandwich press that perfectly toasts a round, crustless sandwich filled with delicious items of your choosing. They have a number of amazing combinations - both sweet and savory, breakfast or lunch options.   I love the menu items with eggs in them, and I LOVE the nutella one, too. Favorites are No. 22,  No. 10, No. 7, and No. 55.   No. 22 2 Poached Eggs, bacon, ham, cheddar cheese, black beans, avocado, zookz Chipotle Sauce  No. 10 Thinly sliced Turkey, crunchy apples, tangy parmesan cheese, cranberries, almonds, zookz Sweet Heat Mustard Sauce  No. 7 (Salad) Kale, shredded carrots, crushed pineapple, coconut, roasted almonds, and zookz voodoo dressing.  No. 55 Peanut butter, nutella, bananas, roasted almonds, and powder sugar  Don't stop at the sandwiches - the side salads are wonderful, too (like No. 7, above)!

BoX_2mD8JlXxOtWJAfAK6g.text: Brought a group of hungry girls during a basketball tournament.  Great food, friendly service and fair prices.      Five stars plain and simple

MvZhX_tFkOMcwmcQbJ2x3A.text: So original and delicious! Breakfast or lunch you can't go wrong. Great flavors, texture and presentation. Can't wait to come again.

G5oDy3iMfQU6bzNzoRJbaA.text: Fast and feel good lunch options. Great house infused teas and the salads are awesome.

8MYbrr9O0rc9oBqauMCNSw.text: Zookz deserves an A+++! I always order their food through Uber eats and my meal never fails to be delivered intact and still very warm. Turkey/cranberry sandwich with the mandarin salad is my go to. All the gold stars for Zooks!

wOIVYsBrNYjJ7-ThCjFPWw.text: Really good and unique sandwiches. They use a press that I've only seen sold in India to make their sandwiches.  Wash sandwich comes wit a side. The side kale salad was very good too.   Everyone who works here is very friendly. I will be back!

0XU3RTQSmgRy9PFNTgCzIg.text: So after reading all of the reviews and seeing the delectable pictures of the sandwiches here, I just had to try this place out. I happened to be in the area, so lucky me.  I was impressed by the store front. Very modern, with large open windows and this really cool, big glass door. I can see this place great as a spot to work at.  I got 2  breakfast sandwiches. I don't remember the numbers though. One was their classic one made of poached egg, bacon, basil, and cream cheese. The other was made as a frittata with red peppers, bacon, ham, and Chipotle cream.  They were definitely stuffed and I loved the crispy bread. But with the rave reviews, I was expecting more. I feel like flavor was lacking and I find myself sad after eating it. I make breakfast sandwiches that are so tasty and I wasted my appetite on something less than expected.  While the sandwiches weren't bad, I will just find myself somewhere else for breakfast.

DgD6eErcqLYnzCAH9mCu-g.text: I've been to this place more times than I can count. I usually try to come here on the weekends for a quick brunch after Zumba or before doing errands. If you haven't been here, you are missing out.  Where do I even begin?! This place is a quick, to-go breakfast & lunch sandwich place. Personally, I love breakfast sandwiches, especially if they are quick, cheap, and amazing! You get all of that plus more at Zookz. My personal faves for the breakfast are the No.11 and No.66. Both are oozing with flavor. For lunch, my go-to is the No.10. I didn't think I'd like the sweet mustard with the apples + cranberries combination, but to my surprise, this one hit the spot. Other times, I just stick to the 11 and 66 because who doesn't like breakfast at any other time of the day? Aside from the sandwiches, this place has killer potato salad.  Inside, there's corn, black beans, green onions, and more. You'll have to try it yourself.   The service here is superb (hi, Adrianna!). Because of coming here so many times, I see how consistent the service AND the food are, which both keep me coming back. The ambiance of the place is SO cute and charming. The yellow color scheme makes the place feel vibrant and fresh. The owner is awesome too! Even when it's busy, she tries to walk around and address customers inside.  The parking is shared with many other places in this area, right in front of the entrance and on the sides. I haven't had much of an issue with this. They're usually open 7am-4pm... although I do wish they were open later (breakfast for dinner is one of my faves).   Overall, if you're looking for a quick breakfast, whether you want to sit inside with a date, group, or by yourself, or just a quick pick-me-up, Zookz is definitely worth the try.

qml6tk-D1ebNfbDpmu1gag.text: My wife and I had a meeting in downtown Phoenix we wanted to find a new place to eat. we heard about this place and stopped in for a quick bite. bxK2kGOTVqjoub9lyTpVnA.text: Number 66 is great. Both dessert ones are great. The owner is great. The location is great. Even the oatmeal coconut chocolate chip cookie is great. The prickly pear tea is... That's right... Great. This place should be everywhere.

dERhqXMglavVww0Xlf4BYw.text: These are bizarre little sandwiches - and hippy dippy salads - but, they are SO YUMMY! Anytime I'm in Phoenix, I hope there's time to have at least one lunch here. They are just perfection.

zhIcSWitMNVcGxheASzJ0g.text: Very cute interior and the staff could not have been friendlier. They were so pleasant!  Craving a sandwich of some kind, I went here on a Friday afternoon. I'd read a few reviews prior to going so I was expecting to be little disappointed in the size of the sandwiches but not the quality. And that was True.  Greeted so kindly by a host at the door (which is an old garage door, very cool) with a menu and suggestions for what to order at lunch, I knew the place was so hip and cool. The guy at the counter greeted me and again helped me order a sandwich with plenty of helpful suggestions. I ordered thier most poplar sandwich, #25. Anything with turkey and avacado is my weakness. I grabbed bag of chips and paid like $8 for it. The register girl complimented me on literally everything I was wearing. Um, hello new best friend.  The sandwich was hand delivered to me and was so delish. They're more like sandwich pockets. We used to make the same things as a kid but put pizza in them. Just take 2 slices of bread, add your ingredients in the middle, take a circle cookie cutter to punch it out. Then Glaze it with butter or something and bake in the oven. Zooks did the same thing but way better. Was I sad to see the sandwich was so small? Yes, I was. But was I pleased with the shredded turkey, avacado, tomato, and spicy mustard... you betcha.  I'd give Zooks a 4 but I wasn't exceptionally im pressed with the interior or seating arrangement of the place. But don't get me wrong, it's still really good!

FZEJvd1EAlZxj0rPDmZ77A.text: This place is awesome, good food and they were all very friendly. If we are ever in Scottsdale again we will defiantly be back!

tdLaWjnc0-RGM2BgRvE78A.text: Love this place! Unique little sandwiches with quality ingredients! The best service, not the kind where they pester you, but the kind where they ask if you're enjoying your food and if you've been there before. I like this spot when I'm in uptown Phoenix.

S7xk4Me4BJZ8wsHoUfmWsQ.text: I always get the #25 with turkey and potato salad! The staff and owner are very friendly. Digging their new location.

rMLfA2AgMHbv73Tomr5SXA.text: I don't want to sound like a broken record but...place is amazing. Order the #25 and chase it with the #55 peanut butter banana masterpiece. The kale salad was excellent and this is coming from one serving of vegetables a week guy.  The establishment was immaculate and the staff friendly and efficient. I highly recommend it. Parking is tight so you may have to walk a bit. It will do you good. People should move around more.

bwmZRtoN8Z0YBs4EEBE0kA.text: Really tasty sandwiches!  The menu has good options and the sandwich style is different, creative, and delicious.  The restaurant is clean and has a minimalist feel to it.  The service was great and the price of the menu is easy on your wallet.  I got a #22 and I cannot remember a better tasting breakfast sandwich.  My girlfriend is vegetarian and the manager was very accommodating: offering to make her additional items not on the menu.  I wish there were more locations.

BouKbUPU_-AUy-SwfsOO8w.text: Super interesting and delicious spin on a traditional sandwich. They have a lot of unique options, and are always willing to substitute anything. It's made it order so very customizable. Very friendly staff and owner as well. Lots of seating. Free WiFi. Giant window which slides open for great weather days. I've introduced a lot of friends here and got them hooked! The desserts and sides are also really good. Give it a try!

3NEwyvhSSejj3JLZzXmX5Q.text: Really cool concept. They have a special griddle that can take two pieces of bread that grills your sandwich while piching around the edges to create a sill, thus making a pouch to hold all the yummy goodness inside. Nice atmosphere and staff was very helpful. Only downside is the sandwiches are on the small side and do not feel up my teens.

UJtlGmSrh6LSxlgc7iC7ng.text: This was our first time here. We called for directions because we were a little lost. It was a wonderful experience from that phone call to the time we left. The sandwich we ate was #33..from the billboard! It DID NOT DISAPPOINT! The owner and manager came out to greet us. You can tell much love and attention-to-detail that went into, not just the restaurant, but also the phenomenal sandwich.   Why can't more places be like this place?

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States

XQ5flXbRyp-in68_shUX_A.text: Came here for lunch today and I was pretty impressed! I think it's a little bit pricey, but at least everything is freshly made and is very yummy! I got a #25.

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. #25

3WheRz1GFTQIfa0sed3K2w.text: Sandwiches are a fun round shaped. All sandwiches are toasted and made to order. You can also add or subtract from the sandwiches. Try the kale salad, too. They have a great house dressing. The employees are highly motivated to ensure that you dining experience is wonderful! I can't wait to go back!!

6LhpQc-9mxqmpY-vMmcZ6Q.text: The kale salad is off the chart! The whole experience was fantastic. I had a question about ingredients and the chef was right there to happily answer my question. The atmosphere was cool and clean. Zooks is an instant fav

0EPnCGrNgzDuhqwJmFmCNQ.text: I have a friend who comes here almost every day, and her pictures and posts of Zookz made me HAVE to make the trip to Phoenix to eat there. The location is really cute and I loved the decor. Service incredibly friendly and attentive. They asked how I heard of them and I told them how I heard through my friend (they immediately knew who I was talking about). I really enjoyed the feel in Zookz. You can tell it is a small, locally-owned business that treats their employees right.  The food: I got #20 with the potato salad (and a soda, because their cups were cute. I'm weird). My friend got #25 with the kale salad. I'm forgetting what exactly was in mine... I think turkey, avocado, cheese, and tomatoes... but it was delicious! I was really impressed with the bread, which was crispy and light but with great flavor. My sandwich + soda was ~$9. Pretty good price for a locally owned small business.  I highly recommend Zookz to anyone who is in Phoenix (or even by making a trip out there for those of us who live in N. Scottsdale). I've already told all of my friends about Zookz, and I can't wait until I can go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. #20 and #25 with potato salad and kale salad

DPsyUrqYLpxMvelU5x5TuA.text: Quality, consistent and so tasty! Been there many times and have been going down the breakfast lunch dessert and salads - before writing this review. Yes great food across the board and plesant caring staff appears to filter down from an on site working owner/creator chef. If you have not tried this reasonably priced eatery you most definitely are missing out.

sUYVc2s3vlhptrx52lHZYw.text: I had the opportunity this morning to stop by and try the new Zoosk on Camelback and Central   And I can say I was extremely impressed with the sandwich,  service and ease of ordering.   I ordered a great lunch sandwich instead a breakfast sandwich.  They have so many great sandwiches to choose from,  You should  make up your mind before you go to the counter.  I live in North Scottsdale but I'm definitely going back and trying some other sandwiches as this one was fabulous keep up the great food and service.

vRcRCMeiRmd-wDBJj1brxg.text: After months of having this place bookmarked I finally went. Me & my coworker ordered a #20 (turkey, bacon, avocado,  tomatoes & cheese, sounds delish I thought) & I got  the kale salad...we got it to go because I work way too far for for my 1hr lunch.  I got to my desk and to my surprise they're was no avocado in my sandwich :( & I love avocado!! I thought they just maybe had my order wrong but as I moved on to my other half there was one tiny piece in there. My coworker had the same issue.  Also the edges on their sandwiches are really hard. But honestly that's just a nitpicking complaint.  So the kale salad was really flavorful if you like greens, their green tea is pretty good. & I give the sandwich I got a 6/10. I'd try this place again but I'll ask for extra avocado even if I have to pay for it. (Which I shouldn't have to since it should be already in there, but whatevs)

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. #20: Turkey, bacon, avocado,  cheese &amp; tomatoes.

KJ2L5B5vD8Ggvo4KHI8vvQ.text: You have to read the story on the wall.  I read the story while I waited for my zook and it made me enjoy my meal so much more.  I dunno, it really touched me, like I still think about the story weeks later.    Zookz are unique and unlike anything I've ever tasted, they're delicious though.  The strip mall is currently under construction so it wasn't easy to find but it was well worth the search!

Cq1QBEVr_vQbejFO4957tg.text: Hands down my favorite spot to get breakfast during my morning bike rides. The No. 44 is my favorite egg frittata. Bacon. Ham. Yummy!!!  I usually get a couple sides to go with it. The kale salad is to die for!!!  Great job ladies!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cute and quaint!!

4qMVluNC0BjQNxBsB1z2Rw.text: I have been wanting to try this place since it opened and when my dental hygienist told me to go because she loved it, I finally decided to stop by. I'm not too big on eggs so I went with their lunch sandwich. I got the #20; which is turkey, bacon, avocado, tomatoes, and cheese. It was delicious! I devoured it! The way the sandwiches look reminded me of the frozen PB & J's we used to get in school. It's sealed along the sides and stuffed with goodness. Loved it! The place itself is small but they do also have outdoor seating. The customer service was great! Also, if you check-in while you're there, they offer a 10% discount! Give this place a try, you'll love it!

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. #20

LlSpybjbHVFd1cuKPfWtrA.text: The sandwiches are very flavorful and a decent size (not too big) for lunch. Also comes with salad. I enjoyed the #35 Roast Beef & cheddar with tomato, bacon, & horseradish. Quite tasty! And the kale salad is light an refreshing with mandarin oranges.  Very healthy option when you're looking for fast-food alternative.

uQxD7WD8DaDPhr7GeK0ZRA.text: Wow! So amazing. Fresh and flavorful sandwiches. Whatever this bread they use, it's out of this world.   My wife had number 11 and I had the number 35. We also got the garbanzo bean salad...now garbanzo beans are not something I would buy on a trip to sprouts....but this was SOOO good.   The owner (manager? Not sure) came by and made sure we enjoyed our food. She asked if we tried the kale salad and, of course we didn't. My wife knows I hate kale and kale fads...lol...well she made is try it, and I finally found kale I enjoy! It was flavorful and sweet. Very fresh.   We will be back as our church is right up the street.

6ZC2kkC4ddyRAilgTI7mLw.text: Had lunch there today and the sandwich #10 and kale salad were amazing. Next time we'll try one of the breakfast sandwiches. Owner is a sweetheart and the place has a great vibe. Highly recommended!!!  Teas are also amazing.

5nPoRZQtydBHCm2qGsd-8g.text: I thought Zooks was alright, but obviously I didn't enjoy it as much as others. The sandwiches were small and the ingredients (while fresh) were so mashed together they were hard to decipher. I couldn't tell if I was tasting a tomato or an avocado, there was just too much going on inside that little round pouch. The kale salad tasted like watery sweet coleslaw and I wouldn't order it again.   Overall it was just ok, I made similar sammys in my college dorm with a plug in press I had for years... Service was great and the place was extremely clean.

R8Jn0v8aFCdiEqC7o66LYg.text: Zookz is one of those places where the cool concept works well. I had one of the breakfast pockets number 66 and all the fillings tied together perfectly. In that delicious pick was poached eggs, cheese, a chipotle sauce and some other filling that I forgot. Each bit was crunchy, savory and just damn good.

lKkQWLmdhy1guITB7iTqLQ.text: Yesterday we decided to have some tasty sandwiches.. the only place we go lately is Zooks. They are very good. Every single one we've tried. I highly recommend giving them a try.  5stars for the food

SFd69zk40HasiIUvFQTumA.text: One of the more unique sandwiches I've had. I feel like I'm eating a sandwich with a pot pie crust instead of buns/bread. Breakfast sandwiches are great hangover food.

HpIV9pGPZJ2xjcC6_STMjA.text: If your wanting a quick breakfast or even lunch this is your place!   The food is absolutely amazing and great prices no more than $10   The owners are awesome right when you walk inside. They always ask if you have been to zoosk and can probably tell/if you need a little help understanding the menu or what it is exactly.  The eggs are always cooked to perfection, the place is clean and bright and fast service !   I highly recommend but you have to go early because they close at 3pm !

EGX8kDJaoIyIBSRinv0-AQ.text: The cashier z is amazing she recommended the number 20 and it's amazing I will most definitely be coming back it's a very clean place and the workers are very friendly

XCsI8VQnHnCIhCLaAjlASA.text: Tried this place for lunch today and it was great! I ordered delivery and it came so fast I didn't even have time to wonder where it was. I got Tim's Cascade with Honey BBQ chips and an Oatmeal Coconut Chocolate Chip cookie. The sandwhich was delicious, crunchy on the edges and soft but not soggy in the middle. Great taste and fresh veggies. I will definitely be ordering deliver again! Highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States

0V15PilhZ5JcDH3NeuF-fQ.text: Oh my gosh, my Mom called these sandwiches "flying saucers" when she made them for my two brothers and me when we were kids. They are delicious and the garbonza bean side salad was good too. I recommend stopping for a tasty flying saucer if you are in Phoenix!

5oYRNkmn3gvDegHOJiw5lw.text: Love this place! I have tried half the menu so far and every sandwich tastes so good! The food tastes healthy and has so much flavor. I also always get the potato salad with my lunch sandwich and it is so good! The service and food quality is never disappointing! So glad I found this place.  Oh and the people that work here are so friendly. Almost every time I come in the owner is working. She is so kind and ensures her customers are happy and satisfied with their food.

BNow7KYbDMKQC-6xcJRx4w.text: The sandwiches here are delicious! On the smaller side but they bake the bread so it's more like a hot pocket style. Was delicious. The salads are on the bigger side. Every sandwich comes with a side salad but they aren't very appetizing looking. The restaurant is open concept but I believe they close the windows during the summer. Overall good food, decent prices, and they have $5 mimosas. The teas are also really good. Would consider if you're in the area and want a sandwich.

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States

nHEjOGEGUohWUthbMzrfGA.text: First off, I'm a huge sandwich fan so this is right up my alley. I had just landed in Phoenix and wanted something quick. Dutch bros coffee recommended i go here as I grabbed a coffee and it's down the road. So good! I got mine to go but staff was very nice when I was there and it was clean. She knew I was taking mine on the road and cut my sandwich up more for me, #20. It was delicious! Bread toasted crisp, fresh veggies, just enough sauce. The garbanzo salad was also good and everything was very reasonably priced.

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States

rwJAIl8yY0T6zWERFG3mxw.text: Sandwiches are crunchy and creespy. I love the food inside of the sandwiches like a box. Salad is good with sanwishes. But the drinks is so artificial flavor for me. I ordered the tea, it was not a real tea.

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Crispy sandwiches! A lot of flavors of drinks. 3 types salads. Very high quality food and service. Beautiful restaurant.

8oKxxhQ7pvvA4Q4R-furdQ.text: My coworkers and I came in here for lunch today. We got in at about noon... It was busy but not overly crowded for it being prime lunch hour.  I ordered the Number 45 (caprese sandwich) and they both had the turkey, bacon, avocado. All sandwiches come with a side of either potato salad, chickpea salad, kale salad or chips. I also ordered a large iced tea. They have an awesome selection of freshly brewed tea. I did think it was unusual that iced tea was about a dollar more expensive than the fountain drinks (in the same size.) Not a fan of that.. but it is unlimited refills on all drinks so I will let it slide. All in all my sandwich, side, and iced tea rang up to about $13.  The sandwiches are the perfect size for lunch. The panini press makes them into cute little pockets that don't leave you feeling too full. Overall I enjoyed my sandwich, but it was just your typical caprese panini. Nothing to make it out of the ordinary. I didn't really enjoy their take on potato salad. It is more like mashed potatoes with black beans and corn. It was pretty bland even with the chipotle and my coworkers and I had to season with salt and pepper. I think I would go with the kale salad or chips next time! We enjoyed our lunch! I am not sure Zookz will be at the top of my list, but it was still a nice lunch spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Number 45
Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Number 45 &amp; potato salad

Y9KWyzXjx7M89sZi1N32xg.text: Wow, really good Sammie's and side salad.  I had roast beef, wifey had poached eggs.  The kale side salad was excellent.  They also had a nice assortment of fresh tea.  Two Sammie's side salad and drinks $20.  Best part might be the owner. She was very nice and went out of her way to be sure we enjoyed our lunch. You want to eat here.

1yF8o6eSJ9PCxDrDr_tWpQ.text: I don't usually go for sandwiches because they're not my favorite type of food; however, this is probably favorite little sammie shop! Their setup is also very inviting and welcoming.

0loszPZUHa7TbzIL6XWQUw.text: This doesn't even fall into the category of sandwich because it is so much more amazing than just a sandwich!   Nom nom nom!  If you like anything between bread you have to try it. That's all there is to this place. A must stop. Cute story, cute decor, kind staff and amazing food!

dArLSWeTt1E2c0HkbCfcbw.text: I should start by mentioning, I love sandwiches. They're my favorite. So when I Yelped restaurants near me and Zookz Sandwiches came up, I knew it was meant to be.   The staff was very friendly and helpful. We made small talk while I ordered and she helped me choose a delicious sandwich (the No. 10, more on that in a second). The other patrons were also friendly. I live in Southern California now, this is rare and special. There was also plenty of seating, with options to sit inside or outside, on stools, chairs, or a cute cushioned bench with throw pillows.   The coffee is out on the counter where I could get my fill and mentally prepare/caffeinate myself for the day. My sandwich was a perfect, toasted, sweet and savory hug from the inside. There was turkey, almonds, cranberries, and apples on it.   Thanks, Zookz! See ya next time I'm in town!

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Coffee at the open window table

sDLUKXLzB4FeEEcIj-P73w.text: One of my favorite places and the owner, I believe she is the owner, is always so welcoming and kind! Amazing food and amazing prices. I used to go to the location before you relocated and same type of service! I am getting my office on board too....hopefully real soon we can have you cater!

hbRYt0jb17MIw8zrLnYnhg.text: I kinda don't like Subway, but I'd rather have Subway.   In short, it was nothing special except the decor and sandwich shape.  I ordered the roast beef horseradish sandwich, I think the #35, with the garbanzo beans salad.  The food was all lacking basic seasoning, needed more salt.  There was very little roast beef, and what was  there tasted like a cheap supermarket slice.  There was at least twice as much potato in the sandwich than meat.  The quantity of food for the $9 wasn't horrible, but felt like less than what it should be.  The bread was tough and almost flavorless.    I was expecting much more given the reviews.  If they address the shortcomings, this could be a special place.  For now, it is just "meh".

A9egFcTv2m9gbJWq0IS0Pg.text: These sandwiches are the bomb! Made to order within minutes, full of flavor, wonderful texture of crunchy, melty, and soft! The owner personally greeted the customers and made sure there order was perfect! The atmosphere was great! The had windows that opened to allow for the customers to enjoy the amazing Phoenix weather! Awesome all around.

JT2RJ4zHR8sS3dEgH73_fQ.text: I adore these sandwiches! We made them camping as a kid and called them Hobo Pies. They are hot, melty, yummy circles of deliciousness. I'm usually in a hurry and they are always fast. The place itself is also very cute so I wish I had more time to sit down and enjoy it! They have 4 selections of fresh brewed tea and an awesome kale side salad (and this girl doesn't normally like kale). The sweet sandwiches are a decadent treat as well. Happy to make this a stop in my weekly routine!

lnI1f-JfMqImc4M69L0lmw.text: I do enjoy and have enjoyed zookz from their original storefront. Though I've never gone in, I've always enjoyed their food when delivered for our large corporate lunches. Today I made my first visit in and was impressed by the variety as well as the layout and locations of the menus. Makes it very easy for someone to decide what they want. I mainly chose to come in based on knowing a side salad is included with the lunch portion. However it's very easy to get confused when the signage reads "your choice of one of our homemade side salads".  When ordering I chose a salad from the board, which is apparently not protocol. "It sounds like you haven't been here before. You choose one from the cooler and give it to me and I put it in the bag" I was told. In a slight sense of confusion and shock I had to leave the counter from ordering to select a salad, none of which were labeled at the chiller aside from "contains nuts" on the lid. It was unclear to tell what was what so I grabbed something that was green. While I do enjoy the food just a few words have put a "bad taste in my mouth".

oJpRGrSokzd5z5O_f_7Xww.text: Love their sandwiches! I highly recommend to others!

iOWRN3fAkUTjFxqIF6gTEA.text: Gotta give where credit is due! Upon walking in, we were first greeted by the owner herself. She asked if we had been in before, which it was our first time. She told us about the tops sellers and informed me they have gluten free bread, which 100% won me over due to my gluten sensitivity. I got the 66 breakfast sandwich with the gluten free bread, and my fiance got the 20 sandwich with the garbanzo salad as a side. Everything was AMAZING! Seriously so full of flavor. We loved the story to how Zookz came about. We will be back! Customer service is everything, thank you!

vUT95PxRAR78Vr3oq_aLLg.text: Best sandwich we have ever had. One plus half a desert sandwich proved satisfying. If I didn't live in another state I'd eat there every week. I probably think about these sandwiches once a week. Owner was charming as well.

yxIgwOZgkGwT_DQBuxbYgQ.text: I forget the number but I got the turkey, avocado, and bacon sandwich and the kale side salad. The sandwich was really good and I loved the salad! I asked for my sandwich w/o tomatoes and it was delivered to me with tomatoes so my husband took it back for me to get it fixed. It wasn't a big deal, I'm a picky eater and used to my food not coming out to me the way I ordered it, plus the food didn't take long to cook.   While we waited a woman came out, I think the owner, and apologized and offered dessert to us dessert on the house. She made us this delicious peanut butter, banana and  Nutella sandwich, so good!!  Overall, the food was really good but the 5 stars is for the service. I used to work for a well-known foodie deli in Ann Arbor, Mi (Zingerman's), where not only was I taught to appreciate food but also the value and importance of great service. If we made a mistake, we went the extra mile to fix it. Even though I wasn't upset about the mistake, I REALLY appreciate that they went above and beyond to make up for it. This is part of the reason eating at local, small businesses rock!

pYDMEeNhmPmSOMDykwRzZw.text: Solid sandwiches (4 star) and great service (5 star). They were very helpful at the counter in explaining the food and gave great suggestions. The #20 and #25 were excellent. Owner and staff very welcoming.

k6qcXr3ZKideuIROuiK4Pg.text: They moved to a new cute location!!!! Love the new spot and the new sandwiches! The pulled pork is craymazing!!!!

oAktYci9NBHSwOSAcM5wew.text: Took my daughters here for a quick, light meal.  I was unfamiliar with the business, and didn't know all their sandwiches were pressed.  I had a turkey sandwich, with bacon, and feta. It was AMAZING!  My daughters had turkey, and roast beef sandwiches, which were equally delicious.  I met the owner, who was very pleasant, and gracious.  I will likely return.

1Qx3QMNA-t2721cDCJSibg.text: This place is so over rated on yelp. Only went because of the ratings. Had a #20 with potato salad. Portions are small prices are high. Not a great value. The sandwiches are not like anything I've ever seen before very innovative, but doesn't change the taste... It's just very trendy and in an area with a bunch of trendy people. Worth a try, but not anything to ever recommend to anyone.

9xAcUA17NC7ITiUdh0h_Rw.text: What a great find!! The food was exceptional and we loved the vibe of this place. The owner Carol welcomed us and walked us through he menu- feels like a family here! I'm visiting from San Francisco - please open one there!

N9UsF3hwOsW7fWPm2euvqQ.text: Wonderful, wonderful, wonderful. Every single item we ate (two different turkey sandwiches, the peanut butter/Nutella/banana sandwich, chickpea salad, and the kale salad) was an absolute delight!  The owner is lovely and what a great story gave birth to the idea and the restaurant.

9H6QnG0n9zYFrGoL3g0x1Q.text: Exactly what I expected! Sandwiches were perfect, creative, and fresh. Great atmosphere and service. I would eat here weekly if it was closer! Well done ZOOKZ!

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. #25 and #35.

JyHxFKrjBWkEaQUeQwfn4A.text: These sandwiches are just alright.  I don't understand the hype.  They're on the small side and I found the turkey sandwich to be rather boring.  I won't be back.  If you're into uncrustables this spot may be for you.

4p3z7lwehUvTrxCrFfVM7g.text: While over on Central decided to check out this sandwich shop, it has been on my radar. I chose the roast beef with the horseradish sauce. It was absolutely delicious. Kale salad was fresh with a nice mix of ingredients. Coffee was great too. Will be back to try something else. Oh and the ladies behind the counter were great too.

NlFPljaj913D8NTI4QZopg.text: This place rocks,  a must try I'm only disappointed that I haven't tried it sooner. The roast beef with horseradish is excellent.

m15O6X7olVoTu_7rRUDwGg.text: I'm absolutely addicted to this place. My boyfriend and I stopped by here on a whim while googling places nearby to eat. The sandwiches are always delicious and you can't beat the customer service. I've tried a variety of the menu and it's all good, I haven't been disappointed yet. It's definitely a place to try if you're into sandwiches, comfort food, and a great environment. Now is the time of year to be in Arizona and it's great to dine in a restaurant with the option of sitting outside. I wish there were a way to give this place more than five stars. Try the Zinger and the #25

CYF_GBKF4p_sYkhtpNPpew.text: Guys, these sandwishes (if you can call them that?) are amazing.  Hands down, they were some of the best sandwishes ive ever had. We tried 4 different ones and we loved all of them.  And my wife loved the kale salad also.   That being said, im giving it 4 stars instead of 5 because i felt like the price was a little high considering how large the sandwiches were.   Will i be coming here again next time im in the area? Yes!  Would i come here often if i lived in the area? No. Too expensive for my big appetite.  My wife on the other hand said she was filled between the kale salad and the sandwich. Me? I ate 2 sandwiches and most of my kids sandwich (2 and a half) and i could have eaten the other half...

AnJX9KeiAfI0ppjn8EuB4A.text: service was sub par, ordered the number 22 for breakfast and it had very little avocado on it bacon and ham and was overloaded with black beans, I was very unimpressed

Vj06W4Ol57221V0HH8-IsA.text: Both the sandwiches I shared were delicious.  They use uncommon ingredients that really give this quick sandwich place such upscale flavor. I love how crispy and warm the sandwiches are.  The sides were awesome especially the kale salad.

72dx-Z6JjstHk3QzxH6DlQ.text: Amazing place!! Their sandwiches are out of this world, especially the #22 of the breakfast, which is what I personally had. Hands down this is the best sandwich shop in the U.S. A trip to Phoenix would not be complete without this restaurant.

1MKUSWLUOOY0Fq8d4nmITQ.text: Only downside is parking.  Unique and delicious sandwich.  My favorite is the PB&J... Nice little treat!

d-wlFkAz8pvozXEV5P1B0w.text: I enjoyed Zookz sandwiches quite a bit.  Their breakfast sandwiches in particular, as I'd pick one up before work.  No more.  I learned a dirty little secret.  Their bread is delivered and stored outside their back door on the ground.  Yep.  On the ground.  They keep it outside for several hours while they are open and could possibly move it indoors.  Aside from the obvious, they're located in the same complex as a large condo building, one that's dog-friendly, and has lots of pets.  So, the next time you have a Zookz sandwich, check to see if there is perhaps a little extra flavor to the bread.  Shame on you Zookz.  Change your ways.

FjbE7gZ5Hc2rJgBXzSPIBA.text: A cool idea for sandwiches. Toasted, circular, and sealed. Fantastic service. Very friendly. Had an egg frittata sandwich with feta, bacon, ham, Parmesan cheese, roasted red peppers, and basil. It was really tasty, can't wait to try the lunch sandwiches.

bIg-hPYIf05dKPXpIyzSSg.text: I brought my dad here while we were driving cross country. The service was great and the sandwiches were everything the reviews promised. I had the# 35, roast beef with horseradish and dad had the #25, ham and cheese with many delicious things. both were great, but we agreed that the roast beef was the better of the two. It's all about the horseradish!Each sandwich comes with either a salad or chips, we had the kale salad, it was pretty good. The owner came out to chat with us for a bit; it's exciting to talk to passionate people, and she is passionate about her business and the concept. Over all, we were very satisfied. It's worth getting off the highway for some True local flavor and to support a local business. Google maps navigated us there perfectly,.

1dFg-Bj0e6iSVdn6ft-GPg.text: This place was amazing! Absolutely hit the spot for a breakfast sandwich! I had #22 and hubby had #11. Both were awesome! Will definitely be going back to try the lunch sandwiches

_t4x41woP3AzxpEuAkTg_A.text: This was my first time here; but won't be my last. I enjoyed a #25 off their menu. The way they craft their sandwiches is innovative. These pressed and baked sandwiches have several intesting types of combinations. The staff is real friendly too. Just the right size. -Andy

lL_o-DCtY3ikZ8hhvEr_4w.text: I love this place. Came here with my girlfriend and her sister for breakfast. Customer service was superb and the sandwiches were delightful. And the manager is so nice always checking up on how everything is going. Definitely coming back for more.  I got the sandwich #20

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States

rGVdwRsdu9XDw9E7xDCUTQ.text: This place right here.  I've been going to Zookz for probably close to three years--as long as I've been living nearby.  I'm a regular, going once every week and a half or so.  90% of the time I order a #22.  Most of them know me by name, and know I'm going to order a #22.  I'm convinced this is the best sandwich in Arizona.  I want them to name it after me.  I'd have the best sandwich in the state named after me.  It's perfect for breakfast, lunch, or brunch.  Filling, crispy, but not too heavy.  Cures a hangover too.  It's magic.  Every visitor I fly out to Phoenix, friends and family alike, I take to Zookz while they're here.  Every time they're back in town they beg me to go back.  Every single person I've brought here.  I've even flown a #22 2000 miles across the country, just so my friend could have another one.  It wasn't soggy either.  Like I said, those things are magic.  Conveniently located near the light rail too, on the Central corridor.

8DNR4bcpoI2wTpkal00qzA.text: Overall: Best sandwich shop in town! (Possibly ever). Can't wait to go back!  The food:  Delicious! We tried 7 different sandwiches and the 3 sides--everything was excellent--fresh and flavorful.  The service: Exceptional! Very friendly staff, made me and my family feel welcome.  I especially loved how involved and incredibly gracious the owner was. She came around to every table to ask about their experience and seemed genuinely interested in making everyone feel welcome and happy with their meal.

rz5DeCbQVuLe8Qmcl4m8WA.text: It's like eating an adult uncrustable, but better and not soggy. The ambience is nice, and they have a washing station! Say what??! Order the #55, it's the best dessert sandwich. It's like eating a Peanut butter, banana, Nutella goodness. Their #15 with turkey and mild curry was a little sour for my taste which isn't a flavor I expect from curry.

e0V3NESaz0Sg7t0qi1tslA.text: As a lover of any form of food wrapped in carbs, this place was wonderful. The sandwich fillings themselves aren't too special, but their unique method makes for a great balance of crispy and soft. The story behind the place is pretty cool too.

91nym2nhqsO3NP3mKhbDUA.text: Ate here this morning with my wife. Ordered number 66 and a 22. We really enjoyed it and has a unique style to delivering breakfast. It's simple but good. I've been told by a couple friends to check it out that are in love with it. And I think it's worth the money.

KSGk98Hs4GQTgJTZ4iVDVg.text: Oh, this is just the best! Sandwiches, side dishes, everything. I was taken there by a friend who said it was a good restaurant. I say, GREAT. A refreshing alternative for the usual ho hum.

pZPb8WSJsbnBmnJ0Z7YvxQ.text: My boyfriend and I decided to try this place after waiting way too long to be helped at Ellys and I'm glad Ellys didn't work out because this place was awesome. As soon as we walked in the owner greeted us and gave us some suggestions. I ordered the 44 and my boyfriend ordered the 35 and they were both great (he just wished there was slightly less horse radish, but no biggie). As we were eating she brought us out a complementary kale salad which was very good. I didn't realize they had coffee when I ordered so I asked for a coffee instead of my drink and she gave me my coffee for free! Awesome place, awesome service, awesome food.

GLhkx5tnMbGFqq5SyKCjnA.text: I always see this place when I go to Maizie's and have wanted to stop by. They are strictly breakfast and lunch, close by 3:30. After driving around the other day in circles in the dreaded "Where should we gooooo", I finally took a sharp turn and ended up here.   They serve breakfast all day and lunch comes with a side salad. I tried a number 30 (ham with brie, apricot spread, and almond) while the sis had a breakfast hot pocket, I mean sandwich. I opted for the garbanzo bean salad with feta. It was tasty, but I asked for an extra lemon to kick it up a notch. The kale salad also looked pretty tasty. While we were eating, I leaned over and said, "It's like eating an adult Hot Pocket!" She totally agreed. I mean really, you have crispy, hot french bread (almost croissant like), filled with various forms of meat and cheeses, served hot.   For both Zookz', a medium drink, my included side salad, plus an extra 10% for checking in, it was less than $14. Not too shabby for lunch in Cen Pho. I definitely want to come back and explore the menu more, especially their frittata breakfast sandwich and whatever one mentioned Nutella.

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. #30
Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Garbanzo bean side salad

NHQPil4BcwkV11TB_Qhdug.text: My hunger quest brought me to Zookz. The sandwich that I ordered was the number 10 consisting of turkey and apple. I loved the sandwich. The place looks nice and brightly colored. Service was good and I will definitely will be wanting to comeback.

HBCrViFB_tSr8KnmSYXIYg.text: This place was amazing. Server at the front was very helpful and explained if there is anything you order and don't like, you can choose something new. We had the #25 and #35, the food came quick and the iced tea selection was superb. Will come back again soon!

EDffJ1b3ZMHpiyvBb_3EIQ.text: Omg let me just say best sandwich ever ! Not only is there sandwiches the bomb .com but the customer service is outstanding  the decor is amazing gives you a beach vibe very vibrant and they play good music !! Get the number 20 with the potato salad and must get a cookie lol very good will be back and I will recommend

md0JR-SPcuPx7_NvrQeSsA.text: Awesome lunch place!!  The owner greeted us at the door and explained the sandwiches.  I had the kale salad after reading the yelp reviews about it.  I was not disappointed.  Great find in Phoenix!!

_jtwlJvpVa3jxexD3uLM3w.text: This place is great for breakfast or lunch! Fun take on a different kind of sandwich, similar to a panini. I had the #20 turkey, bacon, cheddar cheese, tomatoes, avocado, with sweet heat mustard. My sandwich was so yummy and I would definitely order it again. I also had a side of potato salad which was okay but nothing impressive. I kinda wished I had a pickle on the side. Their assortment of iced teas are awesome as well. I Mixed the prickly pear with the green tea  The atmosphere is my favorite part, great patio seating! Can't wait to try their breakfast and fresh squeezed orange juice/ mimosas, next time for sure.

s5nyiwk9enLsO5jYnouFcw.text: This was one of the best breakfast sandwiches I've ever had! I had the No. 22 with the chipotle sauce! It was super yummy! The sandwiches came out fast, and hot and tasted so fresh. Service was great and the restaurant was clean! Definitely will be coming back soon

X6jnxOb0aaLOzkSRWt5z5A.text: My husband suggested going here for lunch today as he's a sandwich lover and we hadn't tried Zookz yet. I really wasn't expecting much as sandwiches are typically pretty straight forward.   We walked up to order and I saw they had breakfast sandwiches, I asked if they sold breakfast all day since an egg sandwich sounded really good. They said that they usually only serve breakfast in the morning, but will check to see if they would do it for me anyway, I said "No prob, I'll just order from the lunch menu." as I didn't want to be a pain. They checked with the kitchen anyway and said it would be no problem to make a breakfast sandwich. I asked for mine with no parmesan as I can't eat cow's milk. The chef then came out and asked if I would like anything else in replacement, I told her I couldn't eat cow's milk dairy, so she then offered to give me goat cheese instead. How cool is that? I try not to be a pain with my dietary issues, but they went above and beyond with their service and to accommodate me.  As for the food; my sandwich was really tasty, eggs were cooked right with fresh spinach and tomatoes, and the bread was nice and crusty, and it had extra goodness due to the added goat cheese.   My husband had the turkey avocado, I tried a bite and it was equally as good as my sandwich. The sweet mustard dressing was a really good addition. His also came with a kale salad which was as good as the sandwiches.  I would highly recommend Zookz and will definitely be back!

Sh56INRDqXShiXSkmdomSA.text: Came here on a Sunday. The cashier was extremely friendly and was patience while I stared at the menu for a good hour deciding what I wanted (everything looks good). Finally, I ordered the one with poached eggs, spinach, and tomatoes. The sandwich was small but filling, it was nice and toasty, and the bread was delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Poached eggs, spinach, and some other stuff

ijOHV1kvo7Le-H6i5vF5wA.text: Delicious excellent flavor combinations not over powering friendly helpful caring staff will be back definitely!!!!!

f3fQACtYmBVKxAq4BJEQbQ.text: I know this isn't the popular opinion here, but I really didn't care for this sandwich place.   Customer service is stellar. Owner was there and friendly and helpful.   The food? Kind of boring and bland. My son called it a glorified hot pocket. I do think it has a lot of potential, but it's just not there yet.

8OFLC6cCD69Ke7UiBEZwoQ.text: These are hot pockets. Portion size way too small. Taste of sandwich was ok, but I'm an adult and need an adult sandwich. Does not live up to the hype, sorry.

uHU95RKmQGcveA4DwGsRlg.text: Came here last week to try this new craze, I ordered the turkey since that's what they recommended and it was very delicious. The crust was a little hard to eat but the sandwich overall was very good. Parking is tough in this location but I hear they're moving nearby to resolve that. I can see this type of place blowing up because it's got a very trendy & casual atmosphere. Will be coming back soon.

_oDRSw_qH4IGsaDSLKYd-w.text: All my family love this place. Usually we eat at home. But when I'm not in mood to cook, first place that coming to our mind is Zookz. Great people, great atmosphere, unique delicious sandwiches. I highly recommend this place. My favorites- for breakfast #66 and for lunch #60 (But others good too).

a4KznM3pV6C_Kb6VlzYA4w.text: What a cute fun way to eat sandwiches! They look small but don't let that deceive you. My sandwich was very filling but it did not make me feel disgustingly full after. I loved that it comes with a side of salad of your choice. I will come back next time I'm in Phoenix.

QELHFGHS3PoHi-BV0HErQQ.text: Very Tasty, but I left hungry...  Sandwiches are very well made and then pressed in a sandwich maker to seal the edges. $8 gets you a sandwich and a side salad. Only issue is I could have eaten 3 sandwiches, but if you have a smaller appetite you will enjoy, I will not be back.

Bes-_oKe1HxtF0PbvFO01w.text: OH MY GOODNESS!!! I don't even know where to start with this restaurant! I ordered a turkey with brie and apricot jam, and it was one of the best things I have ever tasted! I totally recommend this place. There might be a little but of a wait depending on which sandwich you get, but its totally worth it.

YBI288a1eV4xq2IFPNKRGg.text: This an awesome place to have breakfast customers service is great the food is wonderful the owner is very nice she was asking everyone for there opinion and introduced herself she's very nice. The food came out fast and very well cooked my husband and I had a wonderful experience here.

d7mFQ2I8kgQV-qCopxkUsg.text: Hands down best sandwich shop in the valley. The sandwiches are BOMB and the lady who owns the shop has nothing but sweet vibes for customers.

NJO7GTrVRbWSsX4uiWBYmw.text: Went there in the early morning on a weekend just after they opened.  The owner was there and the lady working the counter.  They were both so friendly and sweet.  I wasn't familiar with the menu or what exactly the sandwiches were all about.  I ordered the most popular breakfast sandwich, and it was very yummy.  I ordered a coffee which was also very tasty.  I liked the whole backstory that's on a big sign on the wall.  I love that it's all inspired by her grandmother and the amazing travels she would go on.  The decor is very cute and cozy and I wish I had the time to sit in there.  I'm almost never early enough to work to have the time to stop in, but I hope this place does a lot of business.

neCO7SyPzgwr4dRFKRE-ug.text: Came here today for the first time with coworkers as it's super close to our office. My husband has raved about it so I had to bring friends to try it out!   We ordered a variety of different sandwiches - both lunch and breakfast sammies - and we all enjoyed what we ordered. I got the curried turkey sandwich and side kale salad. The real star here is the customer service and friendly staff. The owner came out to personally ask if we enjoyed our meals and offered to replace the sandwich, no questions asked, if we were unsatisfied. They were super fresh and delicious! I also really liked the kale salad.   The only thing I would agree with about other reviewers is that the portions are not huge. In many ways this is great, and I left feeling satisfied, but I was STARVING in about 2 hours. I think many local places overserve you and Zookz does not. I would have probably had room for dessert. However, the prices are fantastic.   I can't say enough pleasant things about the customer service and that will bring me back for another lunch experience. Next on my list is the ham sandwich with black beans and chipotle sauce...yum!

yRB5do8RylpBMryvIrvHDA.text: Zookz wasn't even on my gastronomic radar as I was driving south on Central Avenue on my way to Burton Barr Library around lunch time today.  However, it was the first restaurant on Yelp's list as I searched on my phone.  I caught a glimpse of it as I drove by to my right and immediately took the first right to circle back to it.   Very friendly staff is what greeted me upon walking in.  They could sense immediately it was my first because I most likely gave an impression of a Golden Retriever puppy that walked into the neighbor's house: confused, lost and maybe a little intimidated due to unfamiliarity.  The staff eased me in however and made me feel at home within moments, explaining what they offer and serve.  I asked what their recommendations were and both gladly obliged.  Tara (I didn't get her name but calling her that because she looks like the young Tara Reid) chose No 11; while Guy (just because he was a guy) picked No 45. Both choices looked equally appetizing based on the ingredients' description from the overhead menu, but I was leaning towards No 11 because it was Tara's choice plus it had cream cheese which we both like.   As Tara was taking my order, Guy threw in a last-second recommendation - No 25 - which he said I could customize by adding cream cheese (yay Tara) and bacon.  I decided to sit outside on the patio so I could enjoy this fantastic weather and have a chance to observe the surroundings.  Soon after, my order was brought to my table, enclosed in the paper bag Tara had written my order on.  Taking the sandwich out of the bag, the aroma alone whetted my appetite even more, but I was a little disappointed because a wall picture inside had me visualizing a more substantial delight.  I stared at it for a few seconds as I struggled to mentally grasp what I was looking at because it looked like two slightly larger dollar-sized pancakes fused together in a panini fashion. Nonetheless, my first bite could not have prepared me for the explosion of flavors in my mouth; all the ingredients popped and the flavors blended well together with every bite.  The consistency of the sandwich was toasted/baked/paninied (however they made it) perfectly.  It was crusty on the edges but soft and gooey in the middle.  As unsubstantial as I thought it was, I took my time relishing it anyway because the place invited me to just relax and to enjoy the moment.  The head cook/chef perhaps owner even took the time to check on each customer which added to the relaxed and welcoming atmosphere.    Overall, it was a worthwhile snappy decision to choose this place and I'll definitely be back.  P.S.  Owners of Zookz, give Tara and Guy raises because those two were excellent wait/counter staff.  They were both helpful, engaging and definitely knew what the cafe had to offer.  One last thing, can I get Tara's number?  ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. No. 25 with bacon and cream cheese added.

o2rk34LtAf4BvVk1mgYRrQ.text: I've been wanting to try this place since I first saw a photo of one of their sandwiches. It was everything I had imagined and hoped for. I met the owner Carol who was kind enough to buy me a cup of coffee while I waited for the cooking contraption to get hot enough to make the sandwich. It was a delight speaking with her and hearing the story of how this place came to be. I highly recommend this place  and fully intend to be a regular.

WSiWTH2HRl7W9G2ZfU4xCg.text: This is the best place ever try the number 66 always on point and always smiles . I love the inside of this place especially the sunflowers , if your looking for the best toasted sandwiches in PHX and a wholesome welcome then zookz is the place .

h05tGlqrB3KCu12vZJA9dg.text: Wow... From the first moment I walked in!! Such friendly staff who greet you! I got the #33 without tomatoes and it was very delicious!! I would say the best breakfast sandwich I've had in a very long time. I'm not a fan of spinach but I kept it on the sandwich and it tasted great with the egg and cheese. All fresh ingredients and the taste definitely shines through. Easily a 5star place based on atmosphere, friendliness and taste. Thank you Zookz, a True Diamond in the rough!!! If I'm ever passing through Phoenix again, no doubt I will stop in and eat me some deliciousness!

hH2dE-g9upiyrEPdAeubVQ.text: Omg!!! I absolutely love this place. I came in here one day after seeing the billboard at camelback & central. The sandwich looked soooo delicious. I tried the #11 and now I'm hooked. I brought a sandwich in with me to work and now my coworkers are hooked too. So now I'm ordering for my coworkers and myself on certain days. Nothing like ordering 7+ sandwiches at a time.  This is a great concept. All the employees are super friendly. And the food is super delicious.

mS9gG9sLunriFzUgu-KnbA.text: First time going to Zookz and it was a great first time experience. Their menu is different and so unique, and since it was my very first time going the cashier was so nice and patient giving us time to take a good look at the menu. I got a Sandwich #42 and a potato salad. It was delicious! & to top it off, the owner Carole went to our table and greet us, and gave us a little chat about the background of how it all started. Definitely had a great experience going, and I surely go back again.

iishX6Smb_qge67EajmFgg.text: I was looking forward to coming here but I have to say I was disappointed. The portions are way way too small. It's also fairly overpriced for what you get. These sandwiches are maybe as big as a Cd/dvd disc....but probably smaller. We got two sandwiches and 1 water =$21. For me it just felt like a light appetizer, I was still hungry afterwards. It just felt like a waste of money. I like the location and the decor but I don't think I will come back for food that's for sure.

8KnAR13Clp_fR8r80PMVLQ.text: Five stars for this place. The best sandwich I ever ate! Not kidding. Not over loaded on bread.  The perfectly crispy, toasted, melty thing I've ever ate!  Met the owner who gave talked with us and gave us the history on Zooks! Yum.  We will be back!! If you are in the area this is a must try!

lKzS7A2B8Gk-tIVt0TGGZw.text: Delicious sandwich, not the usual. Great combinations. I tried #66 and I want more, it is so good, a little bit spicy, flavorful and yummy. Cannot describe the experience. My kids loved their sandwich, one got #26 abs the other has the grilled cheese and they are everything, they say this is their new favorite sandwich shop. This place is phenomenal, it is a must try when you are in Phoenix.

q0EJx8rgkQKepMaWMAgpaA.text: I went over to Zookz on a Sunday afternoon with family when we couldn't get in at another place. This place was a delightful surprise tucked away in a corner. Excellent sandwiches made in a handy "pocket" pressed style. I had the no. 26 There were many choices with great fresh ingredients, each sandwich is served with a choice of a variety of salads or chips. They also have a great selection of iced teas and drinks. While we were there, the owner was there, she took the time to greet us and explain the choices, she also checked on us after we received our food, to see we were doing okay. Overall a great experience, very good food, very clean place, great staff, I would definitely recommend.

tZjohjE3DxzG-qdRpQRKqw.text: When in Phoenix...this is my go to spot for Breakfast! I love the open layout especially on a great day like today! The food is nice and hot. Service is great! What more can you ask for

PHW60HMsXRBqaCiVWqSyQA.text: Gotta love this place and what a great location too. Right off of Camelback and Central. They're sandwiches are very unique and unlike any you'll find anywhere else. I just ordered the salad. It was healthy an delicious. They have an outside patio and the front window opens all the way so u get a nice cool breeze weather permitting that is. The owner likes to periodically come out and check to see how everyone is doing. I love this place and yes I'll be back often :)

9E37gucp813dlIr0K2T0cQ.text: Now that ice cone to except the smaller size of the sandwich here. I've come to enjoy the higher quality taste that comes from the ingredients that go into these fine sam'mich's !! I absolutely love the potato salad too !!!

L7TbuFww0ugaS5o0cI-Qrw.text: My co-workers and I go to lunch every Friday and thought we try Zook's as a new place. We hit the one downtown on Washington.  Oh my gosh, are we happy that we did!  Three of us had the #20 which was DELICIOUS!  Another had a salad (which she said was great) and another the vegetarian with black beans (and loved it).    One of the gals forgot to ask for no sauce on the #20, it was delivered and she said that was okay.  Nope they told her they would make her a fresh sandwich.  The owner came over and chatted with us. We will definitely be going back.    Only suggestion, larger tables and sweet potato fries on the menu :)

wbnGLDsBDGIqpojbbsGGlQ.text: I wanted to take a moment to talk about zookz. The food is amazing! All the sandwiches I've ever had from them have been delicious. However the main thing I want to comment on today is their customer service. This place has the best customer service!! I've been eating at their store for years as well as ordering through delivery providers. Today Uber eats cancelled my order for no reason and I called the restaurant to find out why that had happened. Someone answered and hung up, I was so upset I called back a few times till the phone was answered and was asked to be put on hold. I said no I had a question, I wanted to know if they cancelled my order or ubereats did. The girl said they were very busy however my food was prepared and there. Anyway after contacting ubereats I reordered still a little upset with the exchange because it was so out of the ordinary for zookz. THEN a few minutes later I received a call from the restaurant again, they apologized profusely and explained they were so busy earlier but really wanted to take a moment to call me back and say sorry and explain what had happened, and to let me know they had remade the sandwiches fresh for me.  I think this kind of customer service is so amazing! Thank you zookz!!

UdIy0G2qzDEChzUGJ8pMgg.text: I ordered a ham sandwich. The sand which tasted great. The price was good too, you get a little potato salad type side, or chips with the sand which. I also tried a sweet sandwich with Nutella, bananas and powdered sugar. It was also really good but didn't come with a side. The place was clean. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone in Phoenix during lunchtime. Very unique opportunity to try a different take on the good old sandwich.

VVqSS0QePuFBfa8NYbCr7w.text: Who doesn't love Zookz? Their sandwiches and sides are delicious, and prices are very cheap (about $6-8 a sandwich plus side). Service is super fast, perfect for a quick bite in the morning or for a quick lunch break. We usually order:  No.66: This has always been my go-to breakfast sandwich. Can't beat the cheddar cheese with the bacon and poached eggs!   No.10: This is typically not the kind of sandwich I get but I was pleasantly surprised. The turkey, sliced apples, cranberries and almonds were a great mix. This is definitely one of the healthier options. I love the sweet mustard sauce they here.  No.60: We all enjoyed this one. The apple cider pulled pork was tender and the coleslaw was delicious.  I am not usually a fan of kale but their kale salad is good (No.9). My absolute favorite at Zookz is their potato salad. It's honestly one of my favorite potato salads of all time.

nEyg0pg4IPXc2I93-HLNgw.text: Think of an uncrustable but adult version.  Mine was great! Ham,cheddar,bacon,tomato, potatoes (it works trust me), and avocado! This was delicious. The potato salad was great too, it has corn (for a touch of sweetness), black beans, and green onions. This looked weird but when I took a bite it reminds me of regular potato salad. So over all I would give this place another go soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States

OV-XCb0iixSR45RaF7ovMQ.text: These are the best breakfast sandwiches I've ever had. Hands down. That isn't something I say lightly, because breakfast foods are a bit of a passion of mine. Do yourself a favor and take the time to stop in. The atmosphere is casual and inviting.

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. No. 33 Sandwich + No. 11 Sandwich

k-gXWEIChlC2EKMdsyWBvA.text: I've never been a fan of sandwiches, but when I read about Zookz and saw how unique their style of sandwiches are, I had to stop by during my trip to Phoenix.  They have this cool contraption that makes the sandwiches and they end up a circular shape.  I got the no. 11 sandwich.  It was one of the breakfast sandwiches with 2 poached eggs, bacon, cheddar cheese, tomatoes, basil, and cream cheese for $5.75, very delicious.   I love how all the flavors just mesh well together and the touch of basil really gives it a good kick.  The amount of cheese was just right.  The service was great and it is in a big plaza, so parking will not be an issue! Great sandwich place!

dg1RPvUzBDCbb-4MJFfF2w.text: Had the #20 & #22 and they did not disappoint! I'm going to have to say that this maybe the wife & I new favorite place. Unique approach to a sandwich with all the flavors of the ingredients in every bite. Employees were welcoming w/ great vibes.

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. #22

vzxnfAGHfbfDhdFzC9BrJQ.text: This place is seriously so good.  The sandwiches are delicious, I was surprisingly full after one. I felt like the prices were super reasonable. I have only been once because it's like 45 minutes from my house, but I find myself debating on whether the drive is worth it on a somewhat regular basis.

UvNHvpiWXJUGWkcphuUmsA.text: Amazing. Simply amazing sandwich. I came here on a weekday afternoon and it was PACKED. The interior was fresh, bright, and airy. The story on how Zookz was created was on the wall and tables which was nice to touch to learn about. Carol, the owner, was so pleasant and truly doing her part to make sure everything was running smoothly and personally ensuring that the customers were happy.  I was starving so I grabbed a garbanzo salad from their grab and go fridge and ordered a number 20. I had every intention of eating a little bit of the salad while I waited and saving the rest for later. Yeah, that totally didn't happen. I ended up eating the whole dang thing. The sandwich was delicious as well. I can't wait to try more flavors. I also split a nutella peanut butter sandwich as a dessert. Can you talk about heavenly?!   I will definitely be back.... often..

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Number 20

Kark-VyDgOiUJoNAJwpk_A.text: These sandwiches are so unique - a closed sandwich with all the filling contained in the center. I ordered a breakfast sandwich and it was absolutely delicious. The yolk of the egg was perfectly runny!!

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States

FlCo5mH4Tand_Cd6Hl3J_w.text: This is my new favorite sandwich place! The sandwiches taste so fresh and good and he bread is out of this world! The sandwiches come with a homemade salad- we tried all 3! There is kale, chick pea or a potato salad! Everything was incredibly delicious and I can't wait to come back!!!!!
