tqkzn_J1kT0hxchzH-2z0Q.text: Unique sandwiches that are very tasty.  Breakfast is served all day and so yummy. Every sandwich can be customized so don't let the menu deter you.  The Kale salad is very good. Even those with us that don't like kale loved it.    There is a very good chance the owner, Carol, will stop by your table to chat and ask you about your food.    Highly recommended!

sF0evBAV9cXzuHH3RmXItQ.text: My husband I are visiting from San Antonio to celebrate our 40th wedding anniversary.  But because our hotel didn't offer a typical free breakfast that most hotels provide these days, we checked Yelp for a local affordable establishment.  That's how we found Zookz.  It was affordable ($) but held 4.5 stars.  So, off we went.  Lorrenna took care of us and made great recommendations. OMG, round toasted breakfast sandwich were so delicious that both my husband and I found ourselves making all kinds of noises while we were eating because it was so yummy.  The bread was perfectly toasty on the outside.  The eggs and other ingredients on the inside was perfect. The staff said we need to come back because their lunch sandwiches are even better.    And, because we mentioned we found Zookz on Yelps we received a 10 percent off their already inexpensive price (Breakfast sandwich was less than $6).  Good thing we don't live locally or we will be here every day!!  While you're hear, be sure to read the origin of Zookz! We'll definitely be back before departing Phoenix.

gMaPryZHeXVFJ6GIITZvZw.text: Just ok....  The portion is so tiny, I was honestly hungry when I left. I read others saying the same thing and I thought that was impossible. The side kale salad was great. I had the #20 and the turkey didn't taste like good quality freshly roasted turkey. It tasted like really cheap overly processed deli meat. A bit disappointing. The overall flavor was good (minus the turkey).  I think it would be a better breakfast option since I'm not as hungry in the mornings but a nice egg sandwich would be filling.

hpoPMckjpD1jpI_SI1_Ctg.text: Such a fun lunch! We went with a traditional turkey/avocado/tomato type (#20) and something a little different, a turkey/almond/cranberry/apple choice (#10). Both had an awesome tangy mustard sauce and we super satisfying. The hubs and I usually share but opted not to from other Yelp reviews. It was a good call; he devoured his and I ate almost all of mine.   The price was about $8.50 a sandwich, not bad at all but I would have rather not had the price of the side dish built in, as I didn't like any of the choices- kale salad/potato & black bean salad/garbanzo bean& corn salad. We went with the potato but it wasn't good.   We will definitely be back to try the breakfast options (served all day!) and one of the dessert sandwiches also.

Kq9Xb-BXIoFtO5vcp3ySFQ.text: Very good. My only complaint (as usual) is value for the dollar at this downtown location. I had a pulled pork sandwich, which came on panini type of bread despite my being told the sandwiches were on French bread - maybe they have a very skinny French chef. :) Snark aside, it was toasty and tasty. I took a citrus-kale salad from the fridge as my side dish, and was not disappointed. The issue of value is not so much the price, around $10 each, as the size. Both my son (I forget what he had) and I came away feeling more hungry than we expected. But our taste buds were entertained, as this was not a cookie-cutter kind of sandwich shop.

qnH9-9Utgw6HMF5wygQudA.text: Super yummy Gluten Free sandwiches! I ordered the No. 10 (Turkey with cranberries, apples and cheese) I could eat the Kale Salad with citrus vinaigrette every day.

19Qz5EfYqs2JUJMNorTeRg.text: Always amazing service, and the food is delicious and different. I like how the owner is always involved in the day to day, and interacts with the guests.

JncKf6h39wv0Y1yMTlhOBA.text: First time to Zookz today and i had a great sandwich at a decent price! The cashier immediately noticed I looked a little perplexed and asked me if I had ever been there before. I told her I had not and she quickly and cheerfully explained the menu to me. My sandwich came with a salad or chips. My food was brought to my table more quickly than I anticipated. The sandwich was great and the atmosphere was trendy but comfortable. I'm impressed! I'll absolutely be back for more unique, delicious sandwiches!

zwrVGxfX_F-nDOSDtqrpIQ.text: Found a new breakfast place! Food was delicious and the eating space is fun! Loved the decor. Food portion is great if you're really hungry or wanting to split with a friends and still be good.

0GgJ2h10x_-jkpwOZK8wkw.text: Great sandwiches, I had the #45 and it was delicious!! These sandwiches are like toasted pockets that keep everything in. Oh and definitely try the kale salad! Average price is 10 bucks. I'll definitely will be back

oAxMAH1_xAFNxLPgJXlSpw.text: What a great find!  I am having  the #66 breakfast sandwich and the poached eggs are perfect.  The menu is small but I like that.  I would rather have a few well prepared, delicious items rather than a vast menu that hasn't been perfected.  The staff is fantastic, the place is clean, and the prices are unbelievably cheap.   Cute and quiet indoor/ outdoor seating  makes it a peaceful place to hang out, eat, and read a book.  Which is exactly what i am doing with my yummy loose leaf iced tea.

6Hi9UNpN81321pJ31UE9Cg.text: I don't know if it was it the hunger or it was just that amazing, but I devoured my sandwich! I had the No. 40 which is one of their veggie sandwiches that has carrots, kale, roasted almonds, & this amazing dressing that brought out a great combination of amazingness all in one sandwich! They pretty much just have salads & sandwiches. I did wish they offered some lattes or something, but that's okay there is plenty nearby.

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. So scrumptious! The number 40 must try

NFu6ReCBkIWpeiCLS33CDQ.text: What a great find! Driving back to CA we yelped this amazing little sandwich shop and it did not disappoint. Circular, pressed sandwiches full of yummy happiness. We tried the turkey curry & turkey apple cranberry, delicious side salads, topped off with a gooey chocolate chip cookie.   The Zooks crew was also so accommodating to our picky 5 y.o.... Happy kid happy parents. :)  We will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States

hky2J5ejX-1zZhWzn_fmIQ.text: This place is amazing. Tried it for the first time today and there isn't a thing I would change, from the amazing food combinations, and iced tea varieties, to the outstanding customer service. I never write Yelp reviews but thanks to Brian, I just had to. Thanks guys! I will be back with friends! And soon!

EKTI0YXGD2i5WMBPdJZ9dw.text: I was shocked of how delicious the sandwiches are here. Very unique combination I tried 2 different sandwiches and they were both awesome  The iced tea is fresh and brewed 4 different flavors unsweetened and again lots of flavor kept going back for more  Only knock is they are round sandwiches size of a bagel and run about $8.50 each  Plenty of parking

Rnsr1A8JFqSWLakoZmGxig.text: On our way up to Sedona for the holiday weekend, my wife and I did a quick pit stop at Zookz as we were driving out of town. We got there pretty early - around 10 AM - so the restaurant was pretty empty, and Carole (the owner) was working the register herself. She's very friendly, and she brought out our sandwiches once they were done. The interior itself is pretty much what you would expect for a fast-casual spot, but you can also read the story of how Zookz came to be on the wall next to the television - a very interesting and cool background!  As for the sandwiches - it's really well-done, particularly the crisp on the outside of the bread, and it definitely fills you up...you can fit a lot of stuff into those pockets! I ended up going with one of their breakfast sandwiches that had typical breakfast foods (egg, bacon, avocado) and topped off with some sriracha-infused sour cream (I think) that made it a properly fusion breakfast sandwich. My wife went with No. 25 - more of a lunch offering perhaps, but it also has black beans, avocado, and definitely more of a Mexican bent. The ham in particularly was quite juicy, providing a nice contrast to the crunch and crisp of the bread. We got a small side salad (corns and black beans being the base), which was pretty much in-line with the Mexican-inspired theme that the breakfast sandwiches take.  Overall - a really delicious meal at great prices. You'll definitely come away from here filled, and I really do wish there were more stores selling jaffles (which seems to be the name used in most other ex-British colonies, according to trusty Internet research). Although the sandwich may be unique, the fillings fit right in, and it's hard to go wrong with any of the choices offered. If I'm back in Phoenix anytime soon, I'll definitely be swinging by here for a meal!

eaNsbKxj6uDkJE8e_tBHbA.text: So I used to cater from this place before she moved into this new location across the street. My guys used to complain that the sandwiches weren't big enough so I usually ordered 1 1/2 - 2 sandwiches per person, problem solved, the sandwiches were $5.75/$5.95 each so it wasn't a huge price to incur when you're simply feeding a lunch meeting.  Now I decided to take my son in for 2 sandwiches (because I KNOW one isn't going to fill him up, he's a teen and they're always ready to inhale everything after school). Imagine my surprise when I see she's increased her prices to $8.50 a sandwich, same flavors, same size just MORE money. So for 3 almost hot pocket sized sandwiches, a bag of chips and 2 small..and I mean small side salads the total was $27 and that's with NO DRINKS.  I'm sorry but it appears that she moved into other new snazzy location in the AJ's lot and is passing the cost on to her customers. Good sandwich, and I mean just good..nothing spectacular or extraordinary but for $27 I can walk around the the walkway to AJ's and buy a pound of their finest ham, a loaf of their gourmet, fresh baked bread and some imported cheese and go home and make 8 toasted sandwiches and still have money left over for a couple cookies to eat afterwards.  Shame because there were already complaints of the sizes of her sandwiches for the price when they were cheaper but now at this rate, she won't be in that corner long.

SD9OgF8Y5k_Z3FIzuhyB_g.text: It's not that Zookz Sandwiches are bad... they just aren't good.  The location is nice and the staff is great, but the sandwiches are very bland and unsatisfying.  The bread is grilled in a novel fashion but that was the highlight of our visit.  There are better options if you are looking for something with flavor.

ayk8cUMVv_IqwEywZYcY3g.text: Went for breakfast and had the #66. Great crispy texture of toasted bread surrounding filling that included two perfectly poached eggs for $5.95.

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States

9Qqng6SjIL6TFB-ZEUEkCg.text: I am a freshman at Grand Canyon University and recently ran out of money in my meal plan so I have been adventuring off campus to get food since I'm not limited to spending money on campus anymore. Zookz is by far my new favorite place to go. The employees are very nice and helpful, the place is very modern and inviting. The food was not what I was expecting. I honestly don't know how to describe it but the sandwiches are similar to paninis but not similar at all.. take my word for it, this place is worth the extra cash! I will definitely be coming back and bringing my friends!!

2mxLpdxGiYTdlHjXbhhMwA.text: Love Zooks!!     I actually crave the chickpea side they offer (you get one side with your sandwich) ... and I order two chickpea sides so I can have one for later.    I've had a few different sandwiches here  and loved them all.     The owner is also very nice and you can sense the passion she has for what she does  :)

bmiG-fW7ubOiH6ovvFQQBg.text: I had no idea what to expect when I came into ZOOKS and I have to say I was totally impressed!it was really laid back and  such a comfortable place to eat! Plus you get the food quickly and it's so good! My boyfriend isn't much of a breakfast person and he loved it as much as I did! The service was great and the atmosphere was awesome I can't wait to come back!

GF5M-yXi-qzsqJdkkiNAQw.text: It physically pains me to write this review. I've been wanting to try Zookz for years but didn't see many vegetarian sandwiches and when I discovered I'm gluten intolerant I put Zookz out of my mind. Luckily I saw on Facebook a couple of months ago that Zookz now has gluten free bread AND from my favorite bakery, Gluten Free Creations.  My husband picked up Zookz yesterday so we could have for dinner. I got the No. 40 which I've had twice before on gluten free bread, they even write "gf" on it. I don't know what went wrong yesterday, but OH BOY!!!! I ate half the sandwich last night around 7:00 and by 1:00 am I was writhing in pain. Anyone who has gluten sensitivities know exactly what I mean. I am positive the bread was gluten free, but Zookz does not have a gluten free kitchen nor do they claim to have one. I believe cross contamination occurred at some point.  I enjoy Zookz. The owner is super nice and actually cares about her business and customers which is why I'm saddened that I can no longer eat there. My husband has no gluten issues so he'll be back.

Srgu8o7tpXrBb8bo7h7HUA.text: I must be missing something  here.. I stopped in yesterday  and ordered the #35.. Very little ingredients  for the stiff price of $9 with tax.. I found it average at best and won't  be rushing back.. (Woman at the counter  wasn't  very friendly  either)

9DE6i6YFsZzIWBERC5Bumg.text: This place is adorable and super yummy!!! Everything on the menu looked delicious. I order 66 and it was so amazing!

MnzwDjTI8WQTpDtetDQ_0w.text: I had lunch at zooks with my family. We had a fantastic experience. The food was delicious and between the four of us we got 4 different sides that were all great. The owner was amazing and sweet. The ice tea selection was great and delicious! I will definitely be back anytime I am in Phoenix.

nSStdavFG2n1ayfuMhXUYg.text: Yelp brought me here as I was downtown in the morning and needed breakfast. Zookz had great reviews so I figured I would give them a try... Well the reviews were right! Great place. Nice atmosphere, great friendly service and decent prices. I had the Number 33 and it was so good I went back to try the Zinger special sandwich. So much flavor! Excellent place! Outstanding offerings! New favorite spot for sandwiches.

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Number 33

I94ElrqJKfjV2dnNxvZzcw.text: Was craving sandwiches but wanted something different. Really glad we found this place! Love the decor and the open concept. The restaurant was bright, colorful and friendly. The server was very friendly and provided us with great recommendations. I was curious what their mustard sauce tasted like and before I could ask the owner came out of with a spoon for me to taste. We ordered one breakfast sandwich and one lunch sandwich. Both were delicious but I liked the breakfast one better.   Definitely coming back!

9h1-EF03t2aWVEW8T0xEsA.text: A good place to grab a quick lunch.   The sandwiches are uniquely packaged and yummy! The inside was clean and designed for in-and-out customers. The service was great and the manager came to each table to greet and ask about the food.   I will come back again.

98RqBfnvAZfS07qKG5jLTQ.text: Great place great sandwiches. Love the story behind the sandwich press. Owner was awesome came over and chatted with us, and made us a breakfast sandwich for us to try! Definitely will be back and can't wait to try more breakfast sandwiches!

oK7rsMcJoS309tRyHU9HeQ.text: One of my favorite lunch spots!  Great food and the owner is always there to make sure we have the best experience.  Portions are perfect.

HoLmIDMdz53yu9YhshEu5A.text: Absolutely fantastic place. We are from out of town and found zookz on yelp.... best decision we made all day! Food is a great price, the staff and owner were extremely helpful, and best of all the sandwiches were DELICIOUS!! We highly recommend #20, #25, and #55 as well as the kale salad.   Excellent place to stop for breakfast or lunch! The grilled circle sandwiches "with an edge" are original, unique, and refreshingly full of flavor. The specialty dressings that come are delicious as well. I HIGHLY recommend this place to anyone looking for a new place to grab a meal.

5COdAYVqpTcGWmqd2UkBQg.text: Awesome concept and great taste. Suit to order option and breakfast selections are superb.

0W-IwrhgFTmEAssTEjuzlA.text: We saw this restaurant today after we saw it featured on the morning news show. We walked into a very clean bright happy atmosphere love the yellow flowers in the flower boxes on the outdoor patio. We were greeted by the owner and truly wanted us to have the best experience by explaining the menu. I had a #45 with a side of Kale and husband had a #60 with a side of Potato salad. The food was really good but the kale salad was amazing. I would stop by just for the salad alone. I am a diabetic and this meal really agreed with me. No spikes or crashes witch says a lot about the quality. For drinks I had a delish pomegranate ice tea and husband had a fountain cola. He would of loved to see a root beer. That was the only thing missing for his drink but they do have many other choices. We will be back!

iW6MJ54W-3uT1rmy3JqHLg.text: Wanted something quick and easy and found this place thanks to Yelp. My husband and I shared #20: thinly sliced turkey, crisp bacon, fresh avocado and tomatoes, shredded cheddar cheese, Zookz sweet heat mustard sauce. The sandwich comes with a side of your choice (kale salad, potato salad or garbanzo bean salad) and a drink. We picked the garbanzo as a side and pomegranate iced tea. The sandwich came out hot and toasty and the first bite I had was pretty tasty! They bake their bread in a special cylindrical pan so every bite had a lot of flavor and it was so crispy! I love cheesy crispy bread! Reminds of me grilled cheese sandwiches but better! The garbanzo beans was also a good choice! I choose this side because it was different. I've had many kale & potato salads before so thought giving garbanzo salad a try and it was very good. I actually want to try making this at home. The pomegranate ice tea was a refreshing choice and just what we needed since it was so HOT today! While we were eating, the owner also came up to us and asked us how everything was and was really sweet.  We really enjoyed everything we ordered here and definitely want to go back to try some of their other sandwiches especially their breakfast ones!

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. #20 with side of garbanzo salad and pomegranate iced tea! Delish!!!

PYoWB0mIZkcTXy8bJgLZDw.text: Wow! I was really surprised! I have never had a sandwich like this! It was so good. I had a breakfast sandwich and my husband had a turkey. They were both really good. The staff was really helpful!

cU-hq2-u8d-Bzkz8LV_u9A.text: Love the new location.  Great energy, music and now some local brews.  Nice updates! Only wish I saw the 10% off on yelp to use on my order. Will be back to do so!

RDjDQdsFi4puBx5nFDieUA.text: So to start off the second we walked in, the owner walked up to us and introduced herself and completely explained the whole menu to us. One of the most friendly people there is. In addition the food was awesome. Such a great innovative new idea. Lastly as we ate she checked up on us at least 4 times to make sure everything was perfect. It deserves a 5 star for overall rating for sure

ENRz8hWtRlKfDncoJmdMRg.text: Food was great. I would def come back if I lived in the neighborhood! I got #66 and it was quick and fresh and decently priced!

h4xPeijrDlAbmE2a_VwmMQ.text: Great place and I can't wait until I come back!  I got the #20, a delicious turkey, bacon, avocado, tomato, and cheese concoction alongside the garbanzo bean salad.  Service was friendly and efficient. You just walk up to the register and order, and when your order is done, they will bring it out to your table.   They have water cups out in the table area and also a public sink where you can wash up without having to go to the bathroom.   Parking lot is a little small, but manageable. They have indoor and outdoor seating.

6N5N12RGCE3ELkB37zeTFA.text: Today was my first time back at Zookz since they moved locations. It is beautiful! Zookz never disappoints and I seriously cannot express how much I love this place. Great food and the customer service you receive is unbeatable. This is a truly all around amazing place!

2gD8HHjnznGMbG_yhaKm_Q.text: Zookz is a great quick sandwich option for lunch. I have been in the restaurant and also have had their catering at work.   I've had the No. 33 Breakfast Sandwich (2 Poached Eggs, feta cheese, parmesan cheese, fresh spinach,tomatoes and fresh basil), and the No. 45 Lunch Sandwich (Fresh Mozzarella, sliced tomatoes, basil and arugula, Zookz Honey Balsamic Vinaigrette)  The bread I would describe as a croissant type texture, with a pita pocket shape. It's super yummy, and not as carb-loading as a normal sandwich bun would be. If you are really hungry, I would suggest getting a side salad along with your sandwich.   The price point is low, around $5 for the breakfast sandwich, and $7 for lunch.  Their catering is great, it came with labeled boxes, a sign that had the description of every sandwich, and 2 large side salads. Really organized, and a quick clean up.  If you go into their restaurant, you can get in and out quickly, the food comes out fast.  Overall, wonderful, affordable sandwich shop with a little twist! It's definitely a good break from your normal Potbellys, or Jimmy Johns.

-RbZBMyjmpZC5-m79CTdIA.text: What a great unique little find. These sandwiches are not only fun but delicious. The owner came over to personally check on us and was very nice. Make sure you finish with the Nutella, peanut butter, & banana for dessert... DELICIOUS. They lose one star for parking but I hear new locations are on the docket and I look forward to them as well.  Overall the food is worth finding a space. Delicious, quick and fun for all ages.

1r0iSsuTtUwblNz4-KIw5g.text: Friendly service, cute building, awesome sandwiches, and large/delicious sides! Definitely recommend!

0dCYj-AsgiXK6trAdU3jnQ.text: I can't say enough good things about this place. The decor is clean, adorable, and trendy. I went with four people, we all got different sandwiches, sides, and drinks and everyone of us raved about our meals. Seriously the most delicious sandwich ever. My garbanzo side was so good too! The choices of flavored tea was impressive. The food was well worth telling friends about and a return visits. But we also had to good fortune of meeting the owner. Probably one of the friendliest kindest businesses owners I've ever met. You can tell this place is a work of passion. She has a way about her that makes you think you're sweet and fun aunt is cooking for you. She's the type of person you want to invite to family affairs. She was so helpful in explaining her menu and being hospitable. She even brought our table a free dessert which was amazing and I now unfortunately will not be able to go back without getting one in the future! Go here! You will not be disappointed!

WdhJoty82zso8B_4I1S41Q.text: Wow ... Stopped by for a late lunch and to my surprise, I was extremely impressed.  They take pride in their work and each sandwich is meticulously put together !!  With an explosion of flavors and awesome presentation, I'd say this was the best sandwich I've had in a Long time !!  Well done !!

-T_E6aGVKonW3XjioSmIRw.text: Our intention was to go to Mazie's next door, but there was a 30 minute wait so we decided to give Zookz a try and we are so glad we did!     I'm not exactly sure how to describe their sandwich:  a round panini,? a round grilled cheese sandwich with other stuff in it, or as they say "a warmly toasted, round and sealed sandwich?   However you describe it -- it is fabulous!  My adventurous hubby tried the No. 15 Thinly sliced turkey, dried cranberries, shredded carrots, roasted almonds and a mild curry sauce.   My adventurous 12 year old son tried the No. 45 Fresh Mozzarella, tomatoes, fresh spinach, roasted red peppers and fresh basil with honey Balsamic Vinaigrette.  And, I, probably the least adventurous on this day, ordered the No. 20 Thinly sliced turkey, crisp bacon, fresh avocado, tomatoes, shredded cheddar and Sweet Heat Mustard Sauce ( I was told it was the most popular sandwich ordered).  All three  of us tried each others sandwich by proclaimed our respective sandwich the best.  The sandwiches are served with a little side of Kale salad.    Price point for sandwiches is around $5.75  They do serve breakfast sandwiches as well, which we plan to try!  Operational Notes:  Hopefully you are enticed enough to give them a try, but beware of their hours - M- F 7am - 3:30pm (they aren't open in the evening).  I believe they are closed on Saturdays (that seemed like an odd decision), but they are open on Sunday's (which is the day we happily came across them).   The interior is cute, and they have outdoor patio seating.  Staff is super friendly as noted on other reviews.  No alcohol is served, but who needs the alcohol... will only numb your tastebud's from savoring those flavorful sandwiches!

UuvH9sf3s9NhaCmST6LAxw.text: After taking a look at reviews on Yelp, a friend and I decided to chance it and head over to Zookz.  We found an empty restaurant at 11:45am on a Monday, which piqued our curiosity.  The inside was adorned with a few flat screens, a gourmet beverage station, and the clerks even took our orders on iPads.    The staff was attentive and helpful, explaining that their sandwiches required a custom-ordered machine - sounded enticing.  We ordered and received our food promptly.  They were tasty, but the sandwiches are literally the size (and shape) of a baseball.  They are kind enough to serve their sammies with a side of salad (potato or kale salad), that is around 1oz. That's right - a baseball sized sandwich with a 1oz. salad - for approximately $8, not including a drink.  The sandwiches were solid, albeit a bit different than your usual fare.  But we left unsatisfied, and headed over to AJ's to grab an additional bite.  Check it out if you must, but you'll leave hungry.

K8PYmP9IfoR0FJfHv1QCHA.text: I can honestly say this was a great place to eat! I was here in Arizona for business and wanted to eat at a quick but good place and stumbled upon Zooks! Such a great staff and good food! The owner was very courteous and friendly. I would definitely recommend! Will be back next time I'm here for business again!

7L6anChKpHo0sSr3z0oklA.text: This place is absolutely adorable. I love the bright colors. They have a nice little patio with misters. The owner is so passionate and so nice. All the staff were actually very friendly. We ordered a cocoloco, zinger, and number 25. We chose the kale salad for a side, which was super fresh and had just enough citrus. The eggs were perfectly poached. The zinger sauce is amazing. And the sandwiches are super affordable! We so wish we had one in our neck of the woods. We will definitely be coming back next year!

-zKxxVWlzVpGtOtvbY-J3Q.text: Very yummy! Staff was uber friendly and enthusiastic. I had the Zinger minus the bacon and the sauce was awesome.

P1tb2oOf9oKig71ysfk6XA.text: Services was super friendly and helpful! And the food was great. Usually u see pictures of the food and the actual food looks nothing like the picture but  this place made the food match thier pictures! And it tastes just as good as it looks! I love the choice of making it the way you want but i didn't even need to cause it was already perfect! Wish they had one in Yuma cause i would be there everyday!

hVed4cOmGiHBYRE_uuwMzQ.text: Wow, what a great sandwich! I didn't expect it to be that good, simpliy because I didn't know exactly what is was. it's basically a super thin but mega crisp pita like pressed sandwich packed to the gills with great ingredients.  I went with the number 20: Turkey with avocado, bacon, cheddar, tomato and honey mustard. What can I say but VERY good! They had quite a few other "sandwiches" there that looked good as well. My sandwich came with this little corn, black bean salad that was dressed perfectly. I also got to sample this oatmeal cake, that was super good. All in all, great little place to pick up a unique sandwich for under $7. My only drawback would be the limited hours they're open, but I get it for the area. Luckily I was home sick today so I was able to get there for lunch.

ejH9BjrjyvjnCq_ZIG7PAg.text: "Meh, I've experienced better" perfectly describes this place.  In fact, I ditched my plug in grilled cheese maker years ago, maybe they are coming back into fashion, I don't know. Either way, all the sandwiches here are pressed and grilled in a circular fashion.  Not many options for a herbivore either, I think one sandwich, and maybe a sweet nutella version.  Again, totally underwhelming experience.  Won't be coming back....well, ever.  Make the trip a few blocks south to Pane Bianco, you won't regret it.

kH-OGpdEWHMKHrQ4Rp0tYA.text: Occasionally, you find a place you like so much, if the staff is bad, you eat there anyway.  Then, there are places with food that comes out so-so, but the service is so amazing you choose to support them in spite.  This place is the best of both those worlds.  I needed some breakfast, and the wonderful yelp community pointed me to here.  That's where the story gets better.  After being greeted by the owner when I walked in the door, conversing with her gorgeous self for a few minutes, and staring at all the amazing sandwiches, she finally convinced me to try the zinger.  I thought it was amazing!!  A sandwich that easily fits the Aristotle creed "the whole is greater than the sum of its parts". This sandwich had poached eggs, which I thoroughly enjoy, some ham and various vegetables. Then, they put that between some delightful bread and make it into more or less my favorite sandwich in the whole wide world. GRILLED CHEESE!!  I think when you grill a sandwich, it can only be as good as the bread allows it to be, and they don't lack in this.  I heard her say the bread was fresh baked for them, and I should find out from where cuz I would buy bread from that place any day.    So, to be short, this place is amazing, I want to try every thing on the menu, but I don't get to visit Phoenix often.  I will be visiting this place whenever I have a chance though!!

muZomIbRUsjwymiew07D5w.text: Stopped in for breakfast and left a happy camper.  I love toasted breads and the outer crust of this sandwich was cooked/paninied/whatever-they-do perfectly. I really enjoyed the 33 but wish the egg yolk was left a little runny...not sure if that's possible with these sandwiches. I also sampled the 44 but did not like it as much. The egg ratio was way too much and I was hoping to see more crispy bacon. Breakfast prices are reasonable but if lunch portions are the same, then I'd be a bit more hesitant.

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States

0X5UYBkt_Pz3cYqf-XKiUw.text: Unique spin on the sandwich & a delicious one!  We brought in a large group with no prior notice and still got all of our food within 10min.  Everyone was very helpful & the variety was excellent.

GMwu23yImwHG8PJLctCdng.text: My friend told me about this place so I had to check it out.  Everything about this sandwich place was five stars. Friendly staff, cleanest environment (saw one of the staff constantly cleaning everywhere), cute decor, wonderful owner, and the most delicious sandwich I have had. This place will be my must go restaurant when I visit Phoenix. My friends from Tokyo (gourmet eaters) also gave their big thumbs up and said Zookz would be a hit in Tokyo if they ever come to Japan.

pA958sQLBHxlinecJmeZwg.text: Omg zooks is so delicious....the staff Stacy, Goergee were both awesome and delivered great customer service...I highly recommend this place my daughter , my grand daughter and myself...  Order#60 & #20 both were fantasic ...the sides are awesome too!!!

5TLwE0GauC8gW8lJzpe6ag.text: I'd been meaning to try this place for months and was finally able to yesterday. I stopped in around 1:30 on Sunday and not a single other customer was in the place. I was greeted by a smiling man behind the counter who was friendly and gave me some helpful suggestions on what sandwiches were popular. I opted for the #10, even though that wasn't on his suggestions. It came with turkey, apples, parmesan cheese and hot mustard and I opted for the side of their kale salad over a few different kinds of potato chips.   After a short wait, my to-go order was brought out. As I took my Zookz sandwich out of the bag once home I realized it was a warm panini like sandwich that reminded me of those crustables PBnJ sandwiches you see in the freezer aisle. To my delight, the sandwich was really good. The apples gave the turkey a nice crisp sweetness and the flavor mixture was good. I really enjoyed the kale salad as well and dressing that came on it was nice and light and perfect for the salad. I would consider it a light lunch but it did fill me up for several hours.  I can't wait to go back and try all the other options! I checked their website for nutrition information but didn't see any. Anyone know if they have it? If not, I hope they do soon!

64vEwWdRpuLzxRge8usRKQ.text: Love it!  Place- clean, casual, and modern. Inside outside eating areas. Service-friendly and curtious. You order get your drink and they bring your food to your table.  Food- fresh, non greasy, filling, and delish! I've had the no. 20 &22. Yum!

9frm7wGkhrjhB6SLIdmmDA.text: I absolutely love Zooks! I am surprised it is not all over the valley. The staff are amazing, very friendly and seem like they enjoy what they do. The owner is very down to earth too. I had the kale and potato salads-amazing. I also liked the turkey sandwich I had. The meals are light, does not feel fattening! You must check them out

9nPqgBbvXA1-W1urlW3iHA.text: Breakfast prepared just right with a good blend of seasonings, not too greasy, bread had a nice bite to it. Recommend breakfast no. 44.

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great breakfast sandwich, good blend of seasonings, prepared just right. Nice outdoor seating. Great prices. Highly recommended.

cwuzDtLEiz2spxuAfVhJVQ.text: First time here today and I met the owner. She was lovely! Very personable. I appreciate the welcome right when I walked in. It's a cute little place very modern industrial. Definitely a place to stop by for a bite. They serve breakfast all day long!! That wins my vote!!! I recommend this place to anyone who likes fresh local food!

GqSceaUr0Zkxtd2W0kFwPA.text: Fantastic and fun sandwich shop on Central! The sandwiches are all interesting and delicious and pressed with perfectly crispy edges!   I had the #25, Chipotle sauce with avocado, black beans, ham, cheese, and some sort of Pico salsa. It wasn't spicy, but it was delicious. My husband and daughter both loved their sandwiches as well.   Aside from great food, the costumer service here is beyond exceptional. I'm hard pressed to think of any place I've been that's more accommodating, helpful, and sincerely good with kids. I love this place and we'll definitely be back!

PWiSTvFI0--JiZax3joBDg.text: I went here with coworkers for a quick lunch and was not disappointed. The staff was friendly and helpful. The manager also came out to see how we were enjoying our meal.  I am not sure how to describe the sandwiches that they make. They look like two pancakes, but they are not, that are fused together with the delicious meat, cheese, and vegetable combinations stuffed inside. I had the turkey bacon and avocado and it was scrumptious.  The sandwich came with an orange citrus kale salad that was unexpectantly delicious and I don't normally like kale.  As a surprise from my coworkers the staff brought me a piece of their oatmeal coconut cake. I wasn't sure what to expect but it did not fail. The cake was light and moist and the coconut was not overpowering.  I would highly recommend that if you are ever near camelback and central for lunch to check out this place.

wp8qLrNQ7znozTQAsqikUg.text: Wow, excellent sandwich and a great kale salad. Meet the owner Carol, she was great. Highly recommend this place.

37tCgXpLhhTe7wOI9Ofeug.text: I got the #11 breakfast sandwich with eggs, bacon, cream cheese, shredded cheddar, tomato, and basil. Sounds delicious, but it was not. It was bland, overpriced, small, and chewy. The bread seemed to be regular white bread that was microwaved making the crust too hard and chewy to eat and then pressed into a round mold to look toasty. Not impressed.

GdUVmsJaFZp0ok8QiXC03g.text: Good not great. Wasn't super filling but it was a fun atmosphere and unique sandwich experience.

RvjuNB02002Y3QkJwiqMkw.text: This is a great neighborhood spot! Their bread is from Wild Flower A local bakery that delivers it fresh every morning. Everyone of their sandwiches comes in a delicious pocket. The Coco loco is a great after sandwich treat. It is like a mounds in a pocket. If you haven't gone you are missing out on this downtown Phoenix gem!

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Coco Loco.

vR6vk1D_NwFx9U4txXnFGw.text: Discovered this place just looking for someplace to eat that was pet friendly.  Well, they're not only pet friendly, but, people friendly.  The owner greeted us and made us feel welcome.  I had seen some of their unique sandwiches on this site and had one thing on my mind....good poached eggs.  I was not disappointed.  I had the No. 11 breakfast sandwich and I can say without a doubt that it was the best thing I have eaten out in recent memory.  My wife had the No. 25 and she loved it as well.  Our pet Dolly got a nice bowl of cool water and a dog biscuit (she was much more interested in what we were having, though)  When I ordered, the owner informed me that they cook their eggs through and if I wanted them any different, just to ask.  I custom ordered it with my eggs just before fully cooked.  I got my sandwich and they were done to perfection, not to mention the sandwich itself was perfection.  Crispy on the edges, good "tooth", in the middle and the inside was pure deliciousness.  Their unique method off cooking a sandwich makes any of their sandwiches simply delicious.    Hey, and don't forget one of their hand prepared sides.  Like potato salad?  You'll love their version.  Like kale? Their kale salad is like no other.  If you think you don't like kale or have never tried kale.......try it!  You'll be glad you did.  I'll definitely be going back to try all their other sandwiches and try to pick a favorite.

adjNm8kT074nwSqFfFxbeg.text: My wife and I travel across the country nine months per year.  We always look for local favorite breakfast spots on Yelp. This is the most unique experience we have had. The breakfast sandwiches are beyond good.  In fact, we have been there six times over the past two weeks! The restaurant is exceptionally clean and the staff is very friendly. They even remembered our names after the first visit.  The breakfast sandwich is plenty enough for a satisfying meal.  Our favorites are the #22 and the #55 (Nutella, peanut butter, banana, almonds).  Try it once and you will go back. Little wonder it was named "Best Sandwich Spot" in the valley by a local magazine.

S9szRuA4AZXPkATU1sVpHQ.text: I loved the bread, especially.  The side of potato salad was tasty, too.  I made a special trip here, and I enjoyed it.  I'd go again!

_TItNPXymzx1YW6wZTGK9g.text: Great place! Love the food, love the atmosphere, love the service! All around a great place to eat. Carol is the best I love her glowing smile. Shout out to #22 sandwiches

c3nILuJsMV6buUiMy5Lmgg.text: This place is amazing! I was starving and wanted a fun and unusual place to eat for breakfast. I found Zooks on Yelp and I'm so happy I listened to the reviews. The owner is so friendly and inviting. She helped me pick out my breakfast sandwich. She convinced me to try the "Zinger" oh boy was that thing delicious. She also mentioned that if I didn't like it that she would make me another sandwich no problem. The sauce on the sandwich with was a cream cheese siracha sauce and it was so yummy! But the real show stopper for me was the side kale salad. It was sweet and savory. I've never had a better tasting salad in my life. I can't wait to go back with my fiance! You have to go!

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The yummy &#34;Zinger&#34;

0sUyEP6-ET5izeQFzAv1EQ.text: Zookz was great! I went because of all the reviews and the pictures just looked awesome. Very unique concept. The owner was behind the counter and introduced herself, and thanked me for coming in. You don't see that much anymore....you can tell she cares about her business and her customers. Great sandwiches, highly recommend!

5JmXouYm2lRXB_I5WztZyg.text: Very friendly service! My friend had been dying to try this place. When we came in we were greeted and while looking at the menu, the owner came out and greeted us and struck a conversation with us and helped us with the menu since it was our first time. I believe I got a No. 40. The sandwich was unique and delicious . It was surprisingly filling too. I couldn't even finish it. This place is definitely worth a try as it will not be like any sandwich you have ever had.

9K2bNtensoC4VdDhJrt6pw.text: Very unique sandwiches, healthy, delicious, fresh and warm.  The staff is very friendly and there's a great story behind the place.  The owner is there and pours her soul into the sandwiches and the customers, delightful lady.  The place is neat, clean and inviting.   Get a sandwich with an EDGE and support a fledgling new business.

2WZDXHXlZqlf2Mw6wQDTQg.text: A splendid little uptown spot with arguably the most unique sandwiches in the city -perfect portions and great texture - upbeat and friendly staff completed the experience. I would definitely come here again.

3kawG34WoyCJQTc-5O580Q.text: I really want to give it a 5 star review but I can't..... Yet.    Stopped in here to try somewhere new and after reading all the reviews I knew it wouldn't disappoint.  I ordered the 45, which had spinach, basil, tomatoes, mozzarella, red peppers and probably something else I forgot.  I also had to try the kale salad.    My first bite was delicious!  Yummy bread, good flavors... A real winner.  Then I took a second bite and realized the inside was still ice cold.  :-(. The big chunk of spinach was super cold and the cheese wasn't melted.  It was sooo disappointing but I still ate it because I was hungry and it didn't taste bad cold.  The kale salad was out of this world!  Sooo yummy!  I will definitely be back to try it again and hopefully it will be fully cooked.  Even with the sandwich being cold inside, I still liked it enough that it warrants 4 stars.  The fact the ingredients were fresh and it wasn't frozen spinach helped with the good rating too.  I will try it again soon and update my review to what I'm hoping will be 5 stars!    Seriously... the kale salad is yummy... go try it now!

F33QqCL7ZOkTCDH26B19qA.text: We were a few hours early for our flight out of Arizona and decided to grab some lunch before heading in to the airport. I searched around and saw that Zooks was pretty highly rated and affordable, so we decided to try it out.  I'm glad we picked Zooks for our last meal in Arizona, because it was awesome. The location is small, but incredibly clean and bright. The menu is easy to understand, and every employee was incredibly pleasant and helpful. I got the number 35, which was excellent, and my mom got the...Turkey club one. Not sure about the number., but she liked it. We also tried the potato salad, which while different than the egg or mustard potato salad I'm used to, was good. Creamy with a bit of spice, but not overseasoned. My mom got the garbanzo beans, which she loved, and then an employee who may or may not have been the manager also gave us a kale salad to try for free, which was, like everything else, fantastic.  This ran us about $20 with fountain drinks, which isn't bad for lunch. If I'm ever in town again, I will definitely be coming back to Zooks (or maybe they could open a location in Dallas? :D)

lmOFopPfxWTo6I7HJLD2og.text: One bite and  I'm hooked. #30-ham, a layer of Brie, a spoonful of apricot preserves and a sprinkle of roasted almonds all gooey and melted is definitely the way to go. I also really loved the kale salad side dish. It had a sweet vinaigrette and had pecans (and maybe bits of apple?) in it. I only wish it were larger. :)  My friend had the turkey with the curry mayo and cranberries and it was awesome too. I really can't wait to go back and chow down on these little frisbees of awesomeness. Do check in while you're there and you may get a 10% off coupon. I didn't discover that till we were leaving but it said I could use it next time!

5sSktkTo-j-w6e2q5STXlg.text: Amazing fresh food and service. I came and tried the sandwiches with the garbanzo bean salad. The sandwich was amazing and flavorful with just the right amount of ingredients. I personally did not like the garbanzo beans as much but there are plenty of other choices to choose from.  Not only that, but the service was excellent. The staff was very friendly in helping me to decide what to order and struck up a conversation with me while waiting for the food. Even the manager came out to ask how the food was. Highly recommended.

Nhe8U9rrMnM7bsl8UuZzbQ.text: This place is amazing. Fun and funky twist to what easily can be a regular old boring sandwich. The secret is their bread. It is an old family tradition but similar to a pita. The sandwiches are similar to a panini but with much more pizzazzzzz(snap). Very friendly staff and very affordable. This is a Phoenix must try.

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States

lmsVWz_6UtYQbn_UcS3frQ.text: I checked this place out on yelp before I went, I saw a lot of good review so I ventured and got me a sandwich after church. I was really impressed with the place, it has a very colorful atmosphere and a personal welcoming feeling from the staff. I ordered the #22 breakfast sandwich, and the guy asked for my name. I personally prefer being called by my name rather than a number on my receipt. The sandwich looked sorta small when I got it but it was very filling. You get a 10% coupon if you check into the restaurant, so make sure to check in into yelp.

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States

cW1-Q1o1OJOttDQHCX89Fg.text: This place is great pretty awesome! My girlfriend and I come to Phoenix every year for at least a few days for Spring Training. Found this little place and it was amazing. I was referred here by the Dutch bros coffee place down the street and we were so happy we visited. The sandwiches are great! Such a cool take on breakfast sandwiches that I wish we had one of these in socal. Service was also great l, very fast and efficient.

_b5MmxLeHdClMw-k3Um0kA.text: The sandwiches are good, but the crust is a little tough.  We had the carrot cake and it was out of this world fabulous!

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States

TWxaQ6yve9OEe2NBEIMFEg.text: So delicious! The four of us got different sandwiches so we could try several then we split 2 dessert sandwiches. Everything we tried was delicious! Their sandwiches are big enough to fill you up but not too big that you can't finish them. If you are really hungry I would grab a dessert sandwich to go with it. The sandwiches are small enough you won't walk out feeling like it was too much.  Fair pricing! A sandwich and drink come out to about $7 and dessert ones are less than $5. A must try if you're nearby!

7vY9RAlR26ZQqsDwv37mIA.text: The sandwiches that I have had so far were delicious. I enjoy the huge window and door that opens.

ANJ3RfGgzmz9rVoOMXp1cQ.text: Walked right in on Tuesday after Christmas.   No sign on the door, nothing indicating place was closed.  Door was open, employee sitting inside said, "sorry were closed."  Closed forever?  Closed for today?  Closed until when?  Why was door open and no sign saying clised?

80yUDXXaegjELELFLxsmxg.text: You must give this little sandwich shop a try!! It blew my socks off. Plus the owner is a ray of sunshine. Wish I lived closer.

NcmOVsXc9ySAusesJz9x4g.text: Zooks just popped up on my UberEATS and I had to check it out. I'm indecisive and starving so ordered a breakfast, lunch and dessert sandwich. Oh. My. God. Every single one was incredible. I can't wait to go in person.

XlNzywPHKIUu6J0C0VI5cA.text: I was craving a good salad and was also feeling lazy. After some searching, I discovered you can order Zookz online and walk right in and pick it up. Score! I ordered the No. 5 Salad which is fresh Mixed Greens, chicken, crumbled bacon, roasted almonds, cranberries, diced apples, shredded carrots, and Zookz Creamy Apple Mustard Dressing. It was everything that a salad should be! Light, refreshing, yet extremely satisfying. I ordered the dressing on the side to be a little healthier, but it was so good that I ended up eating it all anyways.  A week or so later, I decided to try breakfast. I went with the online ordering again and got a Nutella, peanut butter and banana sandwich for my boyfriend and an egg sandwich for myself. The sandwiches look a  little on the small side, but are surprisingly filling. They are also more like an uncrustable than a regular sandwich, but that's part of the charm.  The Nutella sandwich was pretty good, and not overly sweet considering its contents. I liked my egg sandwich that included bacon, ham, cheddar, black beans, avocado, and zookz chipotle sauce. My only dislike was I wish they let you do a little more customizing when ordering online.  I hope they consider some later hours in the future. They only open through lunch right now, and it would definitely be convenient to order online and pick up dinner on the way home... if I still lived in Phoenix.

SsxRK8P7SW8Gy5PxaI7ilg.text: Why don't I come here every week?! Delicious food! The staff are very friendly and the place is cute. Most importantly, the food concept is great. I ordered a #10, turkey with cheese, apples, and mustard. The flavors are complex but Mix together in a perfect arrangement. They do a neat thing with their bread, toasting it together like a pita. My boyfriend had the #35, roast beef, cheddar, horseradish. It tasted like prime rib! The sandwiches came with sides, we ordered kale salad with mandarin oranges and potato salad. Again, many ingredients that come together in perfect harmonious flavors. The portions seem small but they are perfect and fill you up.

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The #10, delicious! Thinly sliced turkey, apples, cheese, mustard.

swE55A52mGoT3K8tjmxnGw.text: I consider their sandwiches adult hot pockets, and they're awesome. I've only had breakfast here but #11 is really good and #22 is my favorite. The owner is always here either in the kitchen or out talking to guests. It's a quiet atmosphere with a very tasteful decor. I get down here about once a month because it's 30 miles out of the way but if it was closer I would come here daily they're that good! One of the few places I've been to that deserves a 6th star.

MhPK91qf5XGqr2X8_lsDlA.text: Mediocre sandwiches. Great service.  I like veggies, especially lettuce and tomato on mine and there is none of that.  Also no crusts, they are cut off in the process of sandwich making, so I guess all the best parts are missing.  No kids menu means a 16 dollar lunch for an adult and child.    Eh, won't be back.

hVvwh5ATKmByGbmeN7B0wA.text: First time, delivered through Uber Eats, order was accurate, interesting take on a sandwich. Very good. Didn't love the outside crust but the sandwich itself was fantastic.

djQMlUghzDuXRtv2OKYqgw.text: What a darling little sandwich shop!   Do you remember those old fashioned round sandwich makers our grandmother had?   The owner,  Carol, took it to a whole new level.   Yummy stuffed sandwiches,  from breakfasts to lunch,  to sweet.   Give it a whirl.  Try #66.  A breakfast favorite.

cYjb8OLvqSwW-Ux6TYWMWg.text: Excellent, fresh, fast and affordable. Again Yelp has brought me to a place I would never have known about. So nice to walk in to be greeted by the owner who cares about her customers. The sandwiches were amazing, can't wait to try them all.

gLwTNOI3lmUhr-lWVg5uaQ.text: This is an outstanding lunch spot.  The sandwiches don't look too big, but they're actually pretty filling. I got the #20, and it was absolutely delicious.  I had a salad on the side, and that was very tasty and super nutritious, too!  More than anything else, the service was great.  Both people working the day I came in were incredibly kind and patient, offering solid menu suggestions, but without rushing anyone.  I really hope to return soon.    ENJOY!

o7LbYs0A62g5i-vMkMjqYg.text: My boyfriend and I are new to the area and are constantly having to rely on yelp for recommendations and I have to say this was a great recommendation! We got numbers 20 and 25 with sides of potato salad and a free side of the kale salad! The staff was very welcoming and helpful with these recommendations and we will definitely be back sooner than later!!

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States

mP83L3TrIfHfaBl6LaEc9Q.text: Yup... delicious! Bread was unique and superb while the sweat heat mustard was incredible on the Bacon, cheddar, turkey, avocado sandwich

_Zw3G3K9SVhy7NKmIfhlxA.text: Stopped by on a whim and so glad we did! Friendly and attentive staff. Reasonably priced items on menu. I ordered a cheddar cheese and sliced ham sandwich that came with a choice of sides. I chose potato salad and it was delish! The sandwich was super delish! I indulged in their Strawberry iced tea. Amazing flavor! I will highly recommend this gem of an eatery to my friends and family!

6sd2HrgBAaNRXJ2yhAHdUA.text: I've passed by zookz many many times, but, for whatever reason, I never went in. After the shop moved to its new location, I finally decided to give it a shot. The new location is super cute...I love the color scheme. I went for breakfast and had their sandwich with eggs, spicy cream cheese, bacon, and green onion add basil. I really enjoyed the sandwich except the fact that they can't control the cook on the eggs resulting in overcooked egg yolks. Who wants that? Anyway, the crust and the rest of the ingredients were delish and the prices were inexpensive. I would definitely return!

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cute new location

6B3C56j-hOKm46JNHVRlXQ.text: What a great idea!  Making a sandwich like this took me back to my childhood.  Went with my daughter who is vegan and Carole the owner went out of her way to make sure she was taken care of.  Strongly recommend.  Quick friendly service.  Sandwiches were so flavorful. We will be back

yzSalHcWfhRVNuYGpzeosw.text: Got the 20 to go but absolutely amazing. I've never had a sandwich like this and I'm a big fan. The chocolate coconut dessert is great too. Im not a big eater and finished it with half of dessert so some of you should order 2. Ill be back for a breakfast sandwhich and a beer for sure.

_f61Xdq441iEiUv-npIs3Q.text: Awesome breakfast sandwiches and love love love the you can substitute avocado for bacon!

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States

_6HSqEHBCQEGpnrx7rXmJg.text: Their sandwiches are very unique comparing to others.  I definitely come back again with my little one.

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This is #35.
Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This is #22.

BLXRSTSqQWY82l8DAtDs-A.text: If you're looking for a quick fix, a yummy breakfast, and a semi-non-messy meal, go to Zookz. These tiny little sandwiches are like little pies ready to be devoured. Is it a calzone? Is it a pie? Is it an empanada? I have no idea which exact family Zookz sandwiches fall under, but just know that there is a delicious filling tucked into a circular blanket of dough. I've ordered the popular No. 11 a few times now, which has cream cheese, egg, and bacon in the filling. Biting into it, the cream cheese gushes out in ample glory and egg yolk drips in suit with each bite. I adore breakfast food and can't help but be a fan.

LpUWQpIGpAXmZpj4jFLe9Q.text: I love and miss this place so much!!! They're sandwiches are not your normal sandwiches or panini for that matter. Stuff between 2 slices of bread? Yes. But it's the way they prep/cook it. They're round and toasted in custom jaffle molds. Sandwiches come out piping out and filled with deliciousness. My favorite are the breakfast sandwiches, particularly #22. But really, everything is delicious.

io5mD_2dgODRG_xSm-Gh8A.text: Food: Sandwiches comes with a salad or bag of chips. I had the Kale salad which was good.  - #10: Thinly sliced turkey, slices of green apples, Parmesan cheese, and sweet mustard sauce. Ohhhh, this was so good! My husband and I went halvsies so we can try both sandwiches and I wanted to steal his half! lol. The sandwich is, indeed, unique. It's kind of like a pan fried crispy-soft pita bread. This was my favorite out of the two. 5/5  - #20: Thinly sliced turkey, bacon, avocado, tomatoes, shredded cheddar cheese, and sweet mustard sauce. This was good as well. It was a little messier to eat because it was stuffed with fillings. It, too, had good flavor. 4.5/5  Service: The cashier was really friendly and talkative. I did mention that I found Zookz through Yelp but the waitress failed to mention that if I checked in I would get 10% off. I have a habit of checking in while I'm waiting for my food, in other words, too late. It would have been nice if she said something. The owner stopped by to ask us how we liked our sandwiches. She was really nice and approachable. 5/5  Final thoughts: My husband doesn't ever compliment food. Everything is okay to him. But he loved Zookz! He said it was one of the best sandwiches he's ever had. If he likes it, it's gotta be good! I can't wait to come back here when I'm in Arizona!

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Kale side salad
Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. #10
Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. #20

6HoZjlvREhJ0qqpql5kfSA.text: Wait Time: 10 minutes for food.   Unique Factor: 5/5 - Elevated Smuckers! - That might be an understatement. Unique flavor combos served between toasted crustless bread is something so simple, yet satisfying. Great place for a light lunch, or nice breakfast. The eggs in their breakfast sandwich are cooked perfectly. We need one in the Bay Area!  Service: Friendly Staff and Owner. We were offered a dessert sandwich on the house!

RuA2Yx8mf7_y149gb-_W9w.text: We are from out of town and watched a live feed from this establishment on the morning news. Wife and I decided to try it. Did not disappoint. I had #25 the ham & cheese and the wife had the #33 poached eggs. Great choices! The bread was toasted to perfection. With the lunch sandwich you get a choice of a salad or a bag of chips. Great seating area with water misters on the patio. Definitely recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Poached eggs
Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ham and cheese

cyX4WHsoggPPh5dXg7_Iyw.text: Perfect for eat in our car on the way to Sedona lunch. Sandwiches were so yummy. Breakfast sandwich with poached eggs probably wasn't the best for our situation. While good the other two we got were better. We got the 22 with roast beef with horseradish was by far our favorite. The turkey with Parmesan apples and cranberries was also great and a hit with the kids. Would definitely come back.

4Pz7qHctBtopiaso42UkMQ.text: We just strolled over this morning to the new location at Uptown Plaza.  The modern rustic-luxe environment is perfect for Zookz.  Located directly next door to the trendy organic and healthy Flower Child by Sam Fox, Zookz has delectable unique sandwiches that hit the spot.  They offer about 20-25 variations and even have a few that are for dessert.  We chatted with the owner this morning and she informed us that since moving from their previous location near Maizie's on Central, their numbers are up about 300%!!!  We love supporting unique local eateries that offer great food in a cool environment.  Check them out soon!  Also, they are hiring due to the increase in foot traffic.

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lunch for breakfast, got the #20 this morning.
Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The # 11 with an Arnold Palmer for brunch this morning.
Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great brunch today at Zookz new location at Uptown Plaza near Flowerchild.  Had an Arnold Palmer with Pomegranate Tea!

J2oso3QsxWQnemwNgyHBlA.text: I've been dying to try this place for months; I bookmarked it over 7 months ago. Mr. B. and I decided to give it a try on Sat. (we loved it so much that we went again after our Monday morning workout). The customer service here is second to none and the menu is perfect (not too little, not too much).  Saturday the cashier suggested we try the potato salad along with the jalapeno chips (key here is to use the chips as the spoon..holy toledo Batman!). As a first timer she asked if we like Kale salad and offered it up for free (another excellent selection). The dressing is made of mandarin oranges and it is good.  I had a #33 (feta, parmesan, tomatoes, spinach, fresh basil and 2 poached eggs [they were more on the soft boiled side in my opinion but, good nonetheless]) and added bacon. My entire face was in my plate but, Mr. B. had a #66 (cheddar, 2 poached eggs, bacon, tomatoes, green onions and zookz ginger cream cheese sauce). That sauce that was absolutely divine.   Monday we tried #'s 45 & 60 with a few modifications that didn't disappoint. This is definitely a place to stop by if you're in the area or drive the distance if you're not. Regardless, you won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. #20 (cheddar, bacon, turkey, tomatoes, avocado and zookz sweet heat mustard sauce). Mr. B added fresh mozzarella
Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. #45 (fresh mozzarella, roasted red peppers, tomatoes, spinach, fresh basil, zookz honey balsamic vinaigrette). Added chicken.
Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. #33 (feta, parmesan, spinach, tomatoes and fresh basil). I added bacon for a little fat content!

_XjgoWEdu0MlpL5gZL_mpA.text: At first you wonder what the hell these little things are... you then bite into them and realize who cares... because they're delicious! I order them from DoorDash and it's here under 30 min, you can't go wrong. Soooooo yummy. The #11 is prolly my favorite. So easy and basic yet amazing. I've only had the breakfast ones tho, I need to go for lunch soon!

3avVZcuTaxJItCBhH2BQdA.text: It's like a giant fancy uncrustable. If you like a toasted sandwich this is a must try. We might even come back tomorrow.

eKtIkqARQxH1L-9JpJ2S7g.text: Enjoyed lunch today at Zookz Sandwiches. My 10 yr. old daughter hesitated given the sandwiches looked different but she really changed her tune after taking a bite. She had the pork and slaw and loved it. Dad snuck in a nibble as well. The family also enjoyed one of the breakfast sandwiches and the roast beef as well. The establishment was very clean and staff were very friendly. A great place for a quick meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. #35 roast beef. It&#39;s good but #60 pulled pork is better in my opinion.
Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. If your looking for a great breakfast sandwich, here ya go!
Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. U can&#39;t tell me that doesn&#39;t look so yummy?!?!

MT0NVaPYFvetLdqere58lw.text: They put chicken in our vegetarian sandwich order. Agreed to give refund and then called to tell us we were wrong that it was mozzarella. The turkey sandwich ordered had a fishy taste :( and the corners of the bread were very hard and inedible. Almost all of it went in the garbage.  Pictures looked so good on the menu. Was very disappointed and then angry the owner called to tell us we can't tell the difference between mozzarella and chicken. I am sure most anyone can tell the difference from cheese and chicken. just...no. Stay away.

gNAz0fhfZd0yZBA0cyrHCQ.text: The sandwiches were sooo delicious! My boyfriend and I came from Michigan to visit. We wanted a quick breakfast bite to eat after the gym and Zookz hit the spot! We had the #44 & #66, a mimosa and iced latte and it was perfect!

YLT-9OfgznGenacdrsbKkA.text: Zookz is serving up some really yummy sandwiches!  Their sandwich is definitely unique. The way the bread is toasted/pressed together makes it even more enjoyable.  I'm pretty sure the press used to make the sandwiches is proprietary so this was the first time I've had a sandwich pressed in this style.  I went with the #20 ($8.25): Turkey, bacon, avocado and tomatoes, with shredded cheddar cheese, and honey mustard.  It was really tasty, perfect amount of everything so each bite was delicious.  It had the perfect amount of honey mustard, I ate it all up and was hungry for more. It is a modest portion, but was so enjoyable.  The wife went with the #45 ($7.25): fresh mozzarella, tomatoes, spinach, roasted red peppers, fresh basil and honey balsamic vinaigrette.  She absolutely loved it. Very good vegetarian sandwich.  Again, just the perfect amount of ingredients including the very tasty honey balsamic vinaigrette.  The potato salad was pretty good and had a southwest take, including black beans and corn.  I'd be back for the sandwiches. Very tasty and a great to go option when on the run.

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. #20
Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. #45
Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tasty sandwich and really good potato salad with black beans

f5X4lJAnl6c6kp3X73zWxg.text: Zookz has been open for about 18 months now... and I am truly upset with myself for not trying it sooner.  On the flip side of that, at least now I have a new regular lunch spot!  The owner Carol was extremely outgoing, friendly, and cordial!    These sandwiches could be described as fancy "hot pockets" on a phyllo-style dough... BUT I don't think that description actually does these sandwiches justice.  I'll just default to Zookz' description as "sandwiches with an edge"...  a very good edge!  And lunch and breakfast sandwiches are served all day long.    The #25 is a glorious combination of ham, turkey, black beans, melted cheese, tomatoes, avocado, and some sort of sauce that I can't recall because I scarfed down the sandwich so quickly!  Sooooo good!  Yay!

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. #25 can be described as OMG!
Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Kale side salad!

bngL3gN-sSQQ5qyoTQsBZw.text: I'm not really someone to leave reviews but when I tried this place my life had changed when it came to sandwich eating. I was here for a weekend from California and was looking for a place that had breakfast and coffee so this place popped up and decided to give them a try. I gotta say , they have some very sensational flavors in their food, I love the aesthetic of the place and they seem to use very fresh ingredients. Their mocha iced coffee was probably one of the best iced coffees I've ever had!!

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mocha Iced Coffee

yXmWbGMX3YxmG1m8KW10bA.text: Stopped here for lunch on a Saturday afternoon. We were a little early for the lunch crowd I guess but the place was nearly empty- something we were totally okay with. It's very modern looking and in a really cool complex of other restaurants. There are lots of delicious options to choose from for breakfast or lunch. I decided on the #20 and was so pleased. I also got the garbanzo bean salad- much like a potato salad- as my side dish. The "sandwich" is not like anything I've ever had before. Kind of a cross between and "uncrustable" and a panini and so, so good! The whole story behind the restaurant and contraption used to make the sandwich is on a little card at each table and I kind of love that it's a little family tradition that developed into such a great place to eat. A major plus is that it is super affordable! $14 for a full meal and mimosa! I feel like you get a lot for what you pay and I love a good deal. Will definitely pay them another visit when we are in the area.

Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The story behind the restaurant
Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Indoor/outdoor concept

tDr_GvBQtcz1CuaXWddiGg.text: I love Zookz! I have ordered them for catering and they do a fantastic job! All of the sandwiches and salads are amazing. There is a great selection. Everything is fresh and yummy!

_Ohxi_mXtWwp4PsIiitFtQ.text: Great sandwiches and amazing kale salad. 12/10. Will return. The atmosphere was great and the cashier was very nice. We really enjoyed our brunch and were super impressed.

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States

V2aflhsLrBgTY3Zjks-C1w.text: Amazing.  Everything is amazing.  Sides? Amazing.  Sandwiches? Amazing.  Dine in environment? Amazing.  Lol  Nutella sandwich nice treat to split.  All the breakfast ones have been on point!! Like seriously never had one and said nah not gonna have that again.  Allll so good.     Restrooms cute and always clean.   Parking not wonderful but not bad by any means.

ka-PvRG09Fq5wyyC7iZOQQ.text: I was in the area and wanted a quick breakfast so I decided it was time to try Zookz. They have a good variety of breakfast and lunch sandwiches, which all come presses into this tasty bread. You order at the counter, receive a number, and on my visit they delivered the order to the table.   I went with the #11 breakfast sandwich, which came with eggs, bacon, cheese, tomato, basil and cream cheese. It was sooooo good! The basil really added to it for me. It was easy to eat, not too filling, and tasty. Not to mention the price point: it was only $6.25.   They have coffee beverages as well as a few iced tea selections. They also ave gluten free bread for those with allergies. They also had recycle and trash separated, so you gotta love that.   The interior is super cute and trendy. It was clean and had a nice vibe. I'd definitely return to check out some of their other items!

wpPdFWU5C1xsFxdeRTCweg.text: Wow, the sandwiches are good.  We both ordered a #20.  I had kale salad side.  My husband had the garbanzo beans salad.  Both tasty, but the garbanzo beans extremely tasty.  The sandwiches melt in your mouth.  Love the crispy crust.  The mustard adds just the right amount of sauce so the sandwich does not fall apart.  We left full and happy.

djJ0jZAl2FekriRSUzRoow.text: Delicious toasted sandwiches which the right blends of flavors! Highly recommend number 20 with turkey and avocado. Great place to check out if you are bored with a regular sandwich out. Light and toasty.

gTGrWb16DFtqY3tO6a6cPQ.text: This was my first time to this place.  I was not sure what to expect.  I ordered the 45.  It was good.  I could taste the mozzarella and basil.  The only thing to me is that the sandwhich is small for what you pay.  I think they should have two sizes.  If I am in the area I will try it again.  I am interested in the Nutella and Peanut Butter one next.

uLFWqCueoaZHTXWQYQ_GOg.text: Great sandwiches. Choice of three sides. Priced fairly with a side. Hot and tasty. Open aire to outside . Seating metal chairs and accent yellow . Staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful.  Music not to loud too!

DaPmcw9BRYa2voHyhXHmXw.text: Wow!!! I can't believe this was my first time here. This place was amazing! We ordered a #66 (breakfast sandwich with eggs,bacon, cheese, tomatoes, and green onion) and #20 (lunch sandwich with turkey, bacon, cheese, tomatoes, and avocado). They were both equally delicious! I also got a freshly squeezed orange juice and it was worth the $4.  We sat outside since it was a beautiful day and enjoyed our delicious sandwiches. I love the vibes and ambience and I definitely recommend!

3fU6b-R26p00aBDbh9R3tA.text: Ordered a number 11 breakfast sandwich via Uber eats with an espresso coffee. I was super hungry and in a rush to get to work, and needed a quick fix for breakfast. I decided to give them a try because of the reviews.   Not sure if I chose an underwhelming sandwich or if it declined in quality from the ride over...but I probably won't order that sandwich again. Hate to say it, but I would have preferred a breakfast sandwich from the mermaid queen of coffee aka SB. Might be awhile before I try this place again...To each their own. On the plus side the coffee was good and delivery was prompt.

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breakfast No. 11 Sandwich: 2 poached eggs, cheddar and cream cheese, bacon, and tomatoes. It had potential but was just OK
Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Coffee and No. 11 Sandwich
Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breakfast No. 11 Sandwich. I prefer a fluffier texture of my bread, this was reminiscent of a crust of some type.

Oei64fRahXna4FXn1fug1Q.text: Went in for breakfast a few days back and was pleasantly surprised to see they served their breakfast and lunch menu both which was great. The owner also came around and greeted us at the counter. She is very nice and helped explain their menu and what their sandwiches were (the pressed theme). She also came and checked on us after we got the food. She is definitely on top of everything and seems to care that you're taken care of.   The kale salad was really good. Kale can be hit or miss in almost everything but theirs is tasty and not bitter. I ate two of their sandwiches and both were good though the edges make it a little tougher than I think you'd expect. You end up chewing a bit on the pressed part. Overall it's good and worth checking out if you want something different than the normal sandwich fare.

LOBVfDKbrNtY40MxoQhnhA.text: My favorite sandwich shop! That being said I usually opt for  the yummy kale salad that is loaded with grated carrots, chips of almonds, bits of tangerine mixed with a lovely light citrus dressing.  What makes this so good is the expert handling of the kale.  It is sufficiently bruised and deveined which renders the kale tender enough to eat without the addition of other greens.  I have had kale salads other places and usually most it is inedible due to the chewy ribs left on the kale.   I paid extra to add skinless, boneless, skinless chicken to this supurb dish! It  tasted blandbut worked well with the tangy dressing.  The owner Carol is welcoming and provides a clean, attractive dining area.  All the recipes are creations of Carol"s extensive wealth of experience as a chef.  Love this little gem!

THbzsNW9N-VpqZ3XyKGflw.text: First time at Zooks saw their delicious looking sandwiches on Yelp gave #66 breakfast sandwich a try delicious gooey goodness eggs poached perfectly special cream cheese sauce so very good pleasant helpful staff hip decor with patio seating as well give them a try if ordinary sandwiches don't thrill anymore.

v28kCZUWy-TJ35dehqw6BA.text: Super fresh, super yummy, warm pocket sandwich. Such a cool idea! About $8.50-$9 each for lunch, breakfast is about $6.50 each, 1 will get you full for a bit but if you eat as much as I do, 1 is not enough for you at lunch!   Quick and easy, tasty and satisfied clean food! lM_rkg5VQ9CXPMdkkOR19w.text: Came to pick up an order. But when I got there I got an iced latte with caramel flavor. It wasn't the best drink but it wasn't the worst drink either. Definitely want to come back to try their food. The menu looked great. They have seats outside and a huge open window which is cool. Also their door is so big but definitely not heavy.  Check in on yelp & get 10% off

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Iced latte with caramel flavor

4DI9IbjjIjI7i5LF-9zBgw.text: Just OK.   I agree with folks saying the size is slightly too small. I agree with another reviewer that said the quality of the turkey meat was disappointing. The kale salad was good especially compared to the sandwich. The garbanzo beans side was fine.   The best thing we had was the banana Nutella dessert sandwich, but I definitely could have made that myself in two minutes.

VRykLDkXrF1nukbHex7aXA.text: I got #66 and an iced latte. The sandwich was so good! And I love the story behind it!

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. #No. 66 Sandwich

VEj7kGj6aTbBXubL6xtcww.text: I would NEVER pass up an opportunity to stop by Zookz when I'm in the area. Heck, I'd even drive a few miles extra to be able to stop by and grab a sandwich pillow full of delicious goodness, made with fresh ingredients, toasted and sealed to perfection. Quite honestly, Zookz has the BEST sandwiches I've ever had -- they're a cross between an adult gourmet version of hot pockets and paninis... and if THAT'S not a great combo, I don't know what is!   Not only do I make it a point to stop by Zookz when I'm in the area, I bring someone with me every time. One bite of the deliciousness served up by Zookz and you get hooked, I'm telling you. I brought my mom with me and at first she was a bit skeptical, but it was love at first bite. She ordered the No. 35 (Thinly sliced roast beef, crisp bacon, fresh tomatoes, shredded cheddar cheese, and Zookz Horseradish Sauce), which came with a side kale salad. I ordered the No. 66 (Cheddar cheese, 2 poached eggs, bacon, tomatoes, green onions, and Zookz zinger cream cheese sauce). It was all extremely flavorful and delicious, so much so that it's almost a sad and disappointing moment when you finish your last bite and realize you don't have more left. On the plus side though, you can always order more (if you're still hungry), or come back for more another time. Yaaasssss!!!  Moral of the story: Don't judge a sandwich just 'cause it looks small and cute; not only will Zookz satisfy your tastebuds, but it will also satisfy your hunger.
