OiLVJGxYXhjMvrqBDsaE-A.text: This place is delicious. The food is incredible. I thought it wasn't going to be very filling, but it was very filling and tasted great.  service was unbeatable and at a fair price. I will definitely be coming back when i am on central for lunch!

zYK_l6h_JuFZ1CX9pwY5dg.text: Oh my gosh! The baked goods are AMAZING FRESH delicious. NEVER had Caribbean Cake until now. WOW. Now I have another ZOOKZ addiction.

yF0ABNs7IUuDqvqivwJeUQ.text: What a wonderful find in the Central Phoenix area!  We just finished the Children's Museum and wanted to get a quick, healthy bite to eat before heading home.  After two attempts at different deli establishments (both closed on Sundays), we stumbled upon Zookz.   I had #15 (the turkey, cranberries, roasted almonds, and a light curry sauce) with a side of Kale salad.  It was light, tasty, filling, and satisfying!  The combination of these wonderful, fresh ingredients made my mouth as happy has can be.  Of course, the best part was the toasted bread-you've got to experience it!  You'll see nothing like this anywhere.  My boyfriend had a breakfast sandwich (don't recall which one it actually was), but he said it was delicious too!    If you crave something fresh, healthy, and original (the toasted bread-like Panini pocket), you have to try this place, it's totally worth it!

aJZUR1To6Xs5DEzMsdi44g.text: Great little place. The guy at the counter was very helpful explaining this new sandwich concept and pointing out popular items.   They take two slices of bread sort of a french bread, put the ingredient in the middle and press it in some sort of machine to melt and seal it all together. Very tasty.  I had a breakfast sandwich with poached eggs and my partner had a turkey sandwich that came with a side salad. Both sandwiches were fantastic with all the ingredients fused together  and the side kale salad with orange dressing was amazing. Please make this into a regular size salad with chicken or something, its delicious.

chJ1wPil_3Irxy-p8d3VcA.text: Hands down the most delicious and unique sandwiches I've ever eaten. 20, 25 and 35 are my favorites so far. Clean, friendly and fast.

zPjI7XSxCHwl0Iu0VXm3Gw.text: Delicious. Love the press making the bread nice and crispy. Great side salads. Def recommend.

uBL-HBo5sJRS5D4x6XLByg.text: Not only does this place have some of the BEST and creative sandwiches in town, but the staff is amazing. They have made a sandwich and side for me 2 times now that was a special at one time, but not on the menu, they are so sweet and extremely accommodating. Their salads are fantastic and I love that the sandwiches are stuffed with so much great stuff and it wont fall out because its pressed. YUMMMY toooo

YFHxIyOlIeSOfiHk8IyQJA.text: Ok small toasted sandwich for $8.50. Kind of like those Crustless PBJs you can buy frozen. Came with a side salad. I picked rice salad, the rice was not cooked, the salad was inedible. Wish I gone somewhere else since there are others restaurants in the shopping center.

tvL-fnSYv9bTWzpMeuqZXA.text: WOW- I've never tasted anything like it- the method of sandwich-making at Zooks is unique and delicious. They perfectly toast the edges of the bread to encapsulate the ingredients. I got a breakfast sandwich and made my sister get a turkey sandwich so we could trade halves. It's the perfect serving size- not too big; not too small. Also the Coco Loco was a perfect sweet tooth satisfier. Service was great and the owner was very kind!

m_FRNbW_8TQa3Mf9bBOpAA.text: Great food, packed to enjoy on the go.  Stopped here during a road trip.  Had the turkey, bacon, avocado, tomato sandwich along with their house salad.   The salad is also very delicious -- kale (used for texture -- you cant really smell it), along with several other ingredients and pickling (i believe) -- eg) chives, onion, small oranges, shaved almonds...   Definitely recommend.

KxaKHCXNKylAVDIWnWCv3g.text: Really delicious and unique sandwiches. My favorite are the breakfast selections, which are served all day!! The garbanzo bean salad is also very tasty. Stop in...You won't be sorry!

Q7aHc8x7PJf6A9hvJiutaA.text: One of the best sandwiches I've had in a long time! I got the #35 with the cabbage salad. My boyfriend had the #20 with potato salad. He said its one of the best lunches he's had in downtown Phoenix. Great customer service too!

S6VQXvpTyjDCbOXnt93MHw.text: Good lunch salad for cheap.  I like the place, it is close to my office.  The food is good and the price is reasonable.  Ordering was easy and the take out service was quick.  I'll be back.

_vD1AGwXuDGnhY0XYfPajw.text: In town for business and caught a cold, I looked up sandwich places so I could get soup.  Ended up that soup was a brand new menu item.  I loved the sandwiches and the soups were also very good.  The owner came over and asked how my meal was, always a nice touch.    Definitely going to try and return before I head back to Chicago.

4JN4HH4HjD72p5LWM6vA3Q.text: So glad I tried this place. Note to the owners: That big yellow "best sandwiches" banner you have really works, otherwise I would never have even noticed Zookz! We went for breakfast. I had the #33- 2 poached eggs, feta cheese, parmesan cheese, fresh spinach, tomatoes and fresh basil. It was awesome. I do wish there were more meatless, savory breakfast choices. I can't wait to try some of the lunch sandwiches.

QjP8gptUNI1ENLG6eqi1RQ.text: One of the best "sandwich" shops in all of Phoenix. Its circular design is very unique and traps in all of the goodness inside. They have a wide range of breakfast and lunch zupas to choose from, and their side salads such as the Kale are super good. The owner is super friendly . She truly enjoys what she does, and is often times behind the counter serving her guests. If you haven't tried it out, you should. BTW they also do catering!

WD5w66FRKom8jp_F3KYlfQ.text: First visit here I was not disappointed. The owner greeted us told us about the sandwiches said if we didn't like them she would make us different ones, needless to say she did not have to make us new ones. We had the zinger and the turkey one #20.We also had the kale and a garbanzo salad. Sandwiches were toasty good We will be back They will be moving soon to the AJ's shopping center off Central so make sure you don't miss this unique place. Also very fast service.

gNrZ5QTYAVZ2ePCBPWRJ7Q.text: One of my absolute favorite places here in Phoenix! I love love love this place. My favorite is the #25 with Turkey replacing the ham. I recommend this to all of you!

x3fDFda-CChOJ2q-JkMdgQ.text: The food was delicious and the service was great! The place is cute! I somehow came across this place on Instagram and couldn't wait to try it. The price for a lunch sandwhich is a bit overpriced however. I understand that it comes with a side but it is still very very pricey. Please re-consider the Lunch Sandwhich prices.

Q2Ko_lqTLENQRAEe0o7Rkw.text: This place is heaven on earth. Every sandwich I get changes my life. I love this place for lunch. The owner Carole is a doll and everyone who works there is so NICE. Nothing beats this place. I'd come here over a chain any day. I have not tried breakfast yet, but am looking forward to when I do. My favorite so far is the #25! AMAZING! You have to try it out.. But I warn you that it will be your new addiction!

x0pYzL9ltV88eoq3poBRNQ.text: When I was a child. Yes 50+ years ago we had a device to make grilled cheese sandwiches in the design as this establishment so I experienced a time warp when I got my sandwich These folks have innovated the sandwich. I've only been for breakfast but by far the extra attention they use must be experienced. Whether it is adding cream cheese or basil to a breakfast sandwich which makes you pay attention. Hey if you want ordinary go get an egg Mcmuffin. Excellent. Excellent excellent. My only reason for 4 instead of 5 stars is that I'm a morning eater and to me coffee is king. I would step up the coffee service so people stay and eat there. That's all. These sandwiches are taaaaaasty!!!!!!! Good job. Please it's been a while since I moved to Chandler so you may have improved the coffee service. If not take this as kindly input. And you don't have to go the barista route ($) just get a premium brew and containers to hold them hot without further heating like a hot plate which sours the coffee in 15 minutes. I want you to thrive because I looooove these sandwiches.

2FrmfIhzOXxxX1Due2VE1w.text: First time here at Zookz and so excited to be here after reading the reviews on Yelp. Met the owner Carol.. She was so nice and gave us good recommendations. Picked the #66 without the onions and added avocados. Loved it! Choose the Kale Salad as your side, it's the best  If you're in the Phoenix area, make sure to check this place out for breakfast and lunch!

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. #66 without onions
Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. #66!! Loved the zinger cream cheese sauce!

evPno7fMa0ORNQgHko5G7g.text: My boyfriend and I passed this place driving by and thought the storefront looked fun so we thought we'd give it a try.   Zookz is kind of an order-up sandwich place. Order at the counter, sit down and they serve you. Nice and casual.   One thing I really liked about this place is that the person at the counter was very helpful and was ready with suggestions for those of us newbies. The sandwiches here are interesting in that they are sealed/seared into circles so all the goodies are on the inside not leaking out the back end. The other great thing is that they are really open to substitutions and customization so that you can have the exact sandwich you want. I don't even think they charged me for adding an ingredient. We each got the #20, which is the bacon turkey avocado. He got his per the menu and I swapped the mustard for the chipotle sauce and added roasted red peppers.   On first impression I will be honest I thought I would still be hungry when I was finished, but watch out the size is deceiving! Halfway through I had started to get full, so portion size was actually perfect.  Oh, and try the kale salad. I was skeptical about this as well because I don't normally like kale but this was really good. Julienned with mandarin oranges and almonds. Really tasty.   All in all, a very yummy lunch for about $17 for two. I'd love to go back next time I'm close to downtown.

pSD2hyy9vmZTBKIcvAEDoQ.text: So I've been a roll on trying new great lunch spots and Zookz is just that. I was craving a salad (even though their known for their sandwiches) and I saw one on their menu that made my stomach jump up and down with excitement.   I got the #3 salad that has mixed greens, black beans, corn, sunflower seeds, feta cheese, chicken, and a honey balsamic dressing. And yes, it was as delicious as it sounds! My stomach and I were completely satisfied. I ordered to go and they made sure to put two dressing in there with the salad which made me happy. Nothing worse than an underdressed salad!! Situation averted.   As I was standing in line I was able to briefly skim the rest of their menu and see some pictures of their popular breakfast and lunch sandwiches. They looked amazing and I was surprised to find out that they are unique sandwiches as they're pressed/made/heated into a pocket like form so all the goodies of the sandwich are invisible to the naked eye until bit into (or cut in half). Basically, they look yummy and fascinating. I can't wait to go back and try one out. They also have dessert sandwiches too!  The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. I wish I lived a little closer so I could frequent this spot more often. ALSO, check in on Yelp and received 10% off your bill!! Can't beat that!

4vPmiY1vEPB5mI5_BtIReg.text: Delicious! Had the kale side salad with a #60 sandwich (pulled pork and Coke slaw). Husband had the garbanzo bean side salad and a #15 (chicken with yellow curry, carrots, pineapple, and cranberries). Both fishers were great, but I would get the garbanzo bean salad with the chicken curry sandwich again. Waiting on the peanut butter, banana, and Nutella sandwich now!

xetqCNRrHHEbnQ87LM2Xdw.text: My buddy Jared has been telling me about this place more months. Now that I finally live here and he had a day off we ran down here for brunch. I had the number 33 plus bacon. So good; fresh, and perfectly cooked. I will definitely be back with my wife. Zookz is where it's at for a grilled sandwich and the value was incredible!

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. No. 33

6bejjWCH9tlHcKudbgQUvw.text: Just came in for breakfast. Checked online for their nutritional information and couldn't find any information so I asked the employees about the nutritional information taking them I didn't see anything on their website. They all seemed lost and asked each other and went to the back then came back out and said there is nothing on our website. I said, " I know I checked the website that's why I am asking if there's any where else I can find any nutritional information". They said, " no sorry I guess not". Ok. Poor customer service as well as not good to not provide any nutritional information for those of us who have to log and keep track of sugar levels for diabetic reasons.

4JaZeK5Sl6gfnJw5wvdvEw.text: Excellent food quality & variety, pleasant ambiance, misters for warm days. Had the special chile relleno with ham & side kale salad. Salad and sandwich were delicious. Sandwich was hot and yummy, great taste. Salad was moist, mandarin orange, nuts, really good. Staff and owner are some of the best people Phoenix has to offer. Friendly and genuine. The restaurant is open, airy and very inviting. Best sandwich place around. Great place to visit.

pHhyvEW2CW-XFjCAdgBKIA.text: The food was great and the service outstanding. The owner is hands on and takes tremendous pride in everything served. I would recommend and will be back for more.

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cute spot and sandwiches!

vmMsiA7VdUcpCYo0q01ubw.text: Extraordinarily mediocre and overpriced. The kale salad was essentially inedible. Tasted as though they had dipped each kale leaf individually in a bowl of sugar.   It's worth mentioning that it's not really a sandwich place it's more of a hot pocket restaurant. If you're really into people who think they can reinvent the wheel this might be the spot for you.

XrDiitJ8ApJF304l7mMKuA.text: Sandwiches taste good but not blown away and they are pretty pricey for what u get. I have to order two to get a meal big enough to fill me up.

uY3-XK4eKA880KyWiMhaMA.text: I like the concept and that the sandwich I had was not greasy.  I could see where this type of sandwich could get really greasy, but I did not think that it was as amazing as the reviews led me to believe.  It was good, but I've had better kale salads and potato salads.  The customer service was excellent.  Perhaps I will go back and try a different sandwich, but it did not wow me.

Z3daQr9oN4GxoXicW2m0Cw.text: El Hubbo (aka the Hubs or Hubby) and I stopped in on our way from Phoenix Sky Harbor Airport to Sedona AZ, as I had bookmarked this place as our lunch destination after reading the great reviews of it!  First and foremost, I don't know anything about the Phoenix area, but the location of this place looks a little sketchy and in fact, I took a business call outside, prior to going into Zookz (because I didn't want to be obnoxious and talk on the phone while trying to order), and some random dude that was walking by starts mocking me.  LOL.  Weird.  Anyway, enough of that nonsense!  Zookz is a small place and when we did go in, we were the only ones in there because it was like 2 p.m., so clearly after lunch time for most normal people (including me, but I'm not normal).  I ordered the No. 20, which has turkey, bacon, avocado, tomatoes, cheddar cheese, and Zookz mustard sauce, and a small kale salad.  I was so hungry that I ate the kale salad immediately and it was OMG scrumdeliumtious!!  I really wanted more of it but knew I had a sandwich coming.   When my sandwich arrived, it was cute & round!  It reminded me of the sandwiches I use to make at home way back when with my little Presto Sandwich Maker, and that's how it tasted, too!  It was really yummy!  I liked that it wasn't too filling, it was just right.  I kind of felt like I could eat 2 of them, but then I knew I would be in a carb coma on the way to Sedona.  The employees here are super friendly and I also liked that they have a Hot Dog Cart Showroom across the street.  Are hot dog carts big in Phoenix that they need a showroom?!  BAHAHAHA!  We would definitely return again if in the area!!

dVsODsLVm1gEPRWfkiLYFg.text: Zookz gave me one of the best sandwiches I have ever had. We actually went for lunch and liked it so much that we went the next morning for breakfast.   Carol, the owner, was incredibly personable and made me want to come back. She has put a lot of work into making a great business, and I highly recommend Zookz for breakfast and/or lunch (they serve both all day).   Get the #22 if you go for breakfast.

BVcL0KWhkLssFLwIOqcgmA.text: Yum you have to try this place! They are the nicest people. Be sure to mention Yelp for a 10% discount.

Zhb4wYYNWWz75j44X4e1vw.text: I ordered using UberEATS and had placed a comment that my friend had an allergy and they happily accommodated a sandwich to her liking. Amazing place and great service !

KoR5uz-Zg77o3o_1PVNn9g.text: A place we found after flying in to the Airport and starting our day.  Very unique sandwiches with a French flair on the toasted bread.  The breakfast sandwiches, which are served all day, were particularly delicious and included great flavor profiles and poached eggs.  Highly recommend!

bNvp5FpqEFEUxV4wUOtOQQ.text: Super yummy toasted sandwiches!! The potato salad is AMAZING!! The owner came by our table and is just a lovely person! Great choices of iced teas and Coke products. Hubby had the #10 Turkey sandwich and I chose the #17 roast beef. Excellent lunch and service!! And breakfast sandwiches are served all day. Patio with misters and indoor dining.

zReVIEabF3KT6-Axf59kGg.text: This place was delicious! Tried it on a whim Sunday morning and I don't regret it. The staff was super friendly, and checked on us twice. We ordered the #44, #66 and the peanut butter Nutella sandwich.   The bread was nice and toasted. The ingredients were fresh. I also got their special, which was a mimosa with the sandwich, and it was yummy! Definitely recommend.

i9dTOolRlK008Qm0ne0wnQ.text: Great price point for the area! Decor is wonderful and the staff is warm and inviting! The menu is diverse and the side salads are delicious! Definitely recommend the potato salad

_njXG7myZS9hrTxnMC_aFQ.text: I had my first Zooks experience yesterday for lunch.  Carole the owner of Zooks created great place to go in District 4. I got the #30, a creative combination of ham, brie, apricot and roasted almonds, my mouth is still watering from it.  Not only was the sandwich amazing but Carole suggested that my team and I try the kale salad and the oatmeal cake, what a good suggestion that was. It was an amazing lunch and can't wait to come back with my team.

Bx0KzQThGfzNYliShA6_Yw.text: I had the #20.  Deeeelish, kale salad was yummy too.  I had never been there before and the guy behind the counter was so nice and helpful in making my sandwich choice.

f3VBJFPyagfRbCizuFrAXA.text: A girlfriend of mine recommended this place so I decided to stop in and check it out for lunch.  The staff was very friendly the second I walked in the door and I was greeted by a number of their staff.  I had never been before so the employees were helpful and made recommendations based on their personal favorite sandwiches as well as popular orders from other customers.  I selected the #20 without tomatoes and the citrus kale salad as my side.  Both were excellent!  Overall it was a great experience, great food, pleasant staff, very reasonably priced and awesome outdoor patio.  I will definitely be back!

V9dd-LdrbOILdPrppYZkOw.text: This is my favorite sandwich place it 's delicious.  All the fresh ingredients come together perfectly in this wonderful mouth watering pocket of goodness.  Everyone is extremely friendly & welcoming.  I love the people there & they make my lunch enjoyable every time I stop in.  The kale salad is amazing & If you get a chance to try the special on a Wednesday your mouth will be pleased.

3x1wvei2mjNFlSl6MQqs4w.text: What a fantastic breakfast and lunch place.  Unique, tasty and affordable.  Grilled sandwiches filled with fresh ingredients.  We had the turkey, dried cranberries with mild curry sauce. Incredible.  My husband had the ham with brie and apricot preserves.  Equally fabulous!  And the kale salad is to die for. Freshly prepared food in a clean and modern environment at these prices just can't be beat!  Breakfast sandwiches are only $4.50 and the lunch sandwiches are only $6.50.  A great experience.   Service is quick.   Owner came out to meet us and is lovely. New location is corner of Central and Camelback next to FlowerChild.

X1UiwtCJ-8e2_C-WX7Yzlg.text: I can't recommend this sandwich joint high enough!   It makes paninis look old hat.  We tried the turkey and cranberry and the ham and Brie with apricot chutney.   Yumm!  The kale salad and pasta salad are fresh and delish.   The prices are very reasonable for such high quality ingredients.   To top it off, they are canine friendly in their patio and offer dog treats!

EmZGHrKrqutouy_oK6f-Fw.text: This place is delicious, a cool concept, and has awesome customer service. I love their breakfast sandwiches! GET THE KALE SALAD.

SiqCGm0gQBU8UbhwuCk1lA.text: Awesome tasting "flying saucer" sandwiches! Her desserts are diet killer! So good. The kale salad with the light dressing is full of flavor.

aM4CPMrzH3tWNgL-JcTtaw.text: Great concept, Great potato salad.  The only drag is the lack of available parking.

eS61JN3wtsLcfVzzGwvqQQ.text: What a great idea! Toasted sandwiches seared around the edges and filled with lovely, inventive, tasty fillings! Some may call them called Toastites or Toasties. Delightfully paired ingredients for breakfast or lunch. Quick, fresh, hot, delicious...what more could you ask for. Oh yes, breakfast around $4 -$5 and lunch around $6.50. Tasteful modern clean interior. Now open every day this will become a fast favorite. Try the Kale side salad (included in price) with chef/owner Carole's secret dressing. Wow!

6VL1U1hzwkodUqg7a8G-Hg.text: Been hearing good things about this strange sandwich shop. I love a warm, toasty sandwich and these were definitely Tasty. The Zook is served with a choice of side salad, unfortunately all their salads have nuts. I have nut allergies as do many people in this world, so be aware of the ingredient list when you order. I complained about the nuts, the owner said she would make me a new salad. I was not in a mood to wait after driving around for 5 mins. trying to park. So I took my order and went back to work. 15 mins later the owner showed up at my shop with a nut free salad! WOW, now that is customer service. I'm not even sure how she tracked me down, I was amazed. Thanks Zooks Lady. She even said she is going to rethink having nuts in so many menu items.

jrZ4QlcdjA1je6FsKQNUPw.text: Still a huge fan.  Love the new location in Uptown Plaza, the new menu additions, logo and vibe.  If you have yet to experience Zookz, drop your boring sub sandwich in the trash and try these unique, fresh, toasted sandwiches.  I am hooked for life!

gONoOM3IG0c6-QQQEJ8TlA.text: First time here and we will absolutely be back! Stopped in for a quick bite before golf and we were pleasantly surprised. Food is delicious and homemade. It's like being at your moms house. Service is great and the owner is very friendly and you can tell she really cares. Great job! Great food!

JDM9wehMwfCgP33QF-gpYA.text: This place is absolutely amazing! I went there today and it was awesome! I went with my boyfriend and his sisters, and we all fell in love with it from the moment we stepped in.  I had one of the breakfast sandwiches and I about stopped in my tracks. The owner was so sweet in helping me make my decision -- something I struggle with. LOL. I wanted a salad as well, and was about to buy one. The owner gave me a fresh serving of the kale salad for free. I have never tried kale before, and it is amazing!!!  The salad was delicious! It was so good I ordered another one to bring home. I also had one of their desserts. YUMMY! Everyone left happy and full. Definitely coming back for more.   Everyone there was so nice, I can't wait to go back. Maybe next weekend... :)

5tcgv83auI92JL3PAAmk6g.text: Very unique sandwich shop.  The ham, Brie and apricot preserve was great.  And don't miss out on the kale salad - seriously - not what you think it will be - its really good.   Top notch place.

reW951O0rAoqmLAKorxmPA.text: I wanted to love this place, but....service was slow (I was the only person in the place), the portion size was small (for the price) and my drink was watered down and ice machine was either empty or broken (which meant a metal container was left on the side with a paper cup in it - how many hands touched the cup and toss it back in?!) No Thanks!  I will say that the taste of the food was good, but it's pricey.

S1v6ij3PVbyjg4UdUZPRcQ.text: The hubby and I were in the area the other mornin and wanted breakfast.  We love breakfast sandwiches so we came here.  They were very nice and our sandwiches were great.  They did still add sauce to my husbands sandwich when he asked them to hold it, but he liked the sauce luckily.  I had the first sandwich on the menu with bacon, tomatoes, basil and cheese, it was very good.  The hubby had the second, it was southwestern with chipotle sauce.  He liked it.  We will be back for sure, the other sandwiches on the menu sound awesome!!

oOeOAfvDkEcKUSVf_zkpAg.text: I'm hooked on Zookz!  A friend raved about their sandwiches to me on a Saturday, and since they're only open M-F now, I was craving them even before my first bite! And my friend was right about it all... Delicious ingredients- hot, flavorful, fresh, wholesome- in an easy-to-eat pocket sandwich with crispy sealed edge. The serving size was perfect- just the right amount without leaving me hungry or too full. And the price was great- I think I spent around $6 for the #44 (2 egg frittata w bacon, ham, feta, parmesan, roasted red peppers & basil) and a large green iced tea. And I also had to buy the #55 to-go, because how could I walk away without dessert for later... peanut butter, nutella, bananas, and  roasted almonds! A great big YUM! The staff was super friendly and helpful. Carole, the owner, made it a point to say hi and ask how I enjoyed my food. I loved the garage door front that allowed in the beautiful fall morning air and sunshine. And even the bright natural colors and fruit/veggie mural on the wall gave it a feel-good vibe. I will definitely be back to try even more of their sandwich creations... as well as their salads. I hear Carole's homemade dressings are amazing!

eKgQbJrgZ47h-9JM9ypzMQ.text: My coworker and I were looking for a place to go to lunch the other day. She said that I had not steered her wrong yet on picking restaurants based on yelp reviews. Zookz Sandwiches helped me continue with my success. Their sandwiches are unique and delicious. I would describe them almost like a fresh hot pocket, but way better than a hot pocket.The owner is super nice and let my friend and I try the kale salad, cause she said it was a must. She was absolutely right! the kale salad was amazing and I will definitely be ordering it my next visit. We both thoroughly enjoyed our lunch and experience. My coworker even went back the next day with another coworker.  :)

t8b5N2c9iqLtTH9c829t6w.text: Been wanting to come here for a while and finally stopped in earlier this morning. I got the number 20 and it was pretty good. The potato salad on the side was okay, nothing special. Overall it's a nice place, food is good, but I feel like the portions are small.

cGJrNoLDhX7t2YV7GGJmfA.text: My friend Nancy, read a story about Zookz, and thought we should try it out. Even thought it was quite a ways from Fountain Hills, it was definitely worth the drive. My husband and I shared the #66 and the #20 (one breakfast and one lunch)....delicious. Nancy also had the #66.We loved both of them though I was partial to the #66. The potato salad was so good, also. We met the owner, Carol, who was delightful and made us feel like we were friends as soon as we met. The service was fast and friendly. We will definitely be back, as it's the kind of tasty food that keeps calling our name :-)

Sty808iGyY0ormC1riBXyA.text: I love this place. It's fresh and delicious. It's my favorite place to stop while Im out running errands because I know I won't spend more than $8, it's healthy and fast. The owner is so nice and I love the story behind the sandwiches.  It's definitely a local business worth supporting.

9I9A6IB42Uw34ZYT-5T8Yw.text: This is my favorite sandwich shop in all of the Phoenix area. The salads are amazing, so flavorful and unique. The sandwiches are like nothing I've ever had. We drive about 30 minutes each way so often to come here - highly recommend!

Ajrp1sAwgnT6KQqLmdZ4tQ.text: I have been wanting to try this for a while now. Went in today with my bestie. The design and vibe is gorgeous. The owner overheard that it was our first time in, she came and introduced herself and suggested her personal favorites and chatted for a few minutes. Very sweet. Once we ordered she came to check on us and started to explain how Zookz came to be, great family story. The sandwiches were heavenly, the side salad was perfect, the best fresh tea I've had in a while... I loved the entire experience. Most of all, I appreciated how kind she was... Would give ten stars if I could. Thanks for making our lunch perfect :-)

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States

oVdwWLT-aU44KQyFbRRI0w.text: A friend and I are new to the area and found this place on Yelp! And  WOW! so impressed!  We went for lunch time. Pulling into the parking lot, it already had a good vibe. Clean and friendly. There are sliding glass doors that can be open to allow fresh air into the building and a patio to sit at.   We didn't know what we wanted to eat because of the different style sandwiches and the owner helped us. She was awesome. Even suggested what to add to my sandwich. While allowing my friend to sample the sauce she was unsure about.  A side comes along with the sandwich, and my friend picked chips and I picked the potato salad. The owner insisted we try the salad... and just gave it to us! So Impressed again!!  We decided to sit outside on the patio and enjoy the weather. The cashier came out to make sure we were okay as well as the owner. I will definitely come back here again for the great customer service and the amazing food. Thank you so much for the great experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sliding doors!

EmHxLLARrR5dEQc_lxbzQw.text: we order here several times every week because it's delicious healthy fresh food.  The pricing is fair even when you include Uber delivery and the customer service and the owner is amazing.  I wish everything were as amazing as Zookz

mMR9UrDcITwEdrEm3okyCg.text: This is a MUST, if you're in the mood for something new and delicious. The breakfast combos with mimosas are a great weekend meal, and the #55 desert sandwich will blow you away. Check this place out!

r3xPgaer7AsEs4xdrGkAHQ.text: We've loved this place since it first opened.  But about 1.5 years ago my s.o. had to go gluten free, among other dietary changes...so we didn't come as often.  But now they have gluten free bread! And it's amazing! In some ways it's even better than the regular bread.    Zookz has the most wonderful sandwiches & it was a happy day for us when they were able to make a gluten free one :)

S_qkKautj9na1Kz8xDINAA.text: Tried it, lunch sandwich was tasty however small.  Potato salad has beans and corn in it way too much going on.  Would have been helpful to tell me the tea was unsweetened and the cookie wasn't a real one it was oatmeal or something.  Oh well im sure plenty of people enjoy this kinda stuff.  Not my cup of tea.

ZhksTGtq_tEPFqsY1CstPQ.text: There's definitely a lot to like about Zookz and their unique twist on a sandwich shop.  The prices are great, the service is friendly, the atmosphere is chill, and online ordering is a snap.  I wouldn't call my first visit here a home run, but I can see why so many CenPho folks make this place their lunch staple.  I actually decided to venture here after leaving early from work on a Tuesday.  I had read the stellar reviews on Yelp (as well as a glowing recommendation from my sister) and figured I'd give it a go.  Their website makes a point of advertising the online ordering process so I figured I'd play it safe this time and order in advance in case of a big lunch rush.  The online ordering process is quite easy as you just pick your sandwich, choose a pickup time, pay, and done (I understand some folks may have reservations about paying for food in advance but I digress).  I came by around 11:30am to pick up my food.  As many have accurately pointed out, parking here is a chore.  In fairness I knew that in advance as I've patronized numerous restaurants and businesses in the area but parking has always been scarce.  Here's a tip, park a block north of Zookz on Pierson Street.  There's usually a decent amount of street parking and I believe the parking lot on the northwest corner of Pierson and Central can be used (though don't quote me on that).  I parked in that parking lot today and had no issues, so there you go.  Or if you take the light rail, the Central & Camelback station is just a couple of blocks away.    The restaurant itself is fairly small, but actually has a great deal more seating than I expected (including a decent amount of outdoor patio seating).  The orange and green color scheme is rather, eh, interesting, though they do keep the restaurant pretty clean.  Maybe I came at the right time, but there was barely anyone there when I got there at 11:30am.  Perhaps the lunch crowd hadn't yet flowed in.  In any event I came up to the counter, my food was ready, they let me pick a salad (I went with potato), and off I went.  The sandwiches here are unique in that they're made using an old school stove-top method.  They describe the process on their website, but essentially you get a sandwich that almost looks more like a stuffed pancake.  I got the #20 lunch sandwich (turkey, bacon, avocado, tomatoes, cheddar, and Zookz' own housemate sweet mustard).  Super tasty sandwich and for the most part the unique bread was a good compliment.  My only complaint was that the outer crust of my sandwich was pretty rock hard.  Not sure if thats normal, but it was a slightly unpleasant part of an otherwise pleasant experience.  The potato salad side I got was also pretty tasty.  Total price for the sandwich and side salad was $7.  I actually got a $1 off my order as they had a holiday online promo code I could use.  And I believe a Yelp check-in can get you 10% off if you're just a walkup customer.  Good price for a good amount of food.  I didn't feel uncomfortably full, but satisfied.  I'd certainly come back here again for lunch or to try one of their breakfast sandwiches.  I'm not sure they allow it, but it'd be nice to customize my own sandwich with my own choice of ingredients.  I'll investigate that possibility the next time.  Overall, a good choice, Yelpers.  A few kinks to work out before I give it the 5 star treatment, but Carole Meyer's creation shows a lot of promise.

WuvitTDCExkqe-cEYJjYrA.text: I love the sandwiches here!!! Ordered several to try them all and first of all they're hella cute. Little sealed in grilled toasted cute things!! Secondly they are super yummy! No complaints at all. I would say maybe add a smiiiiiiidge more salt but not really necessary I suppose. I also got the mocha something or other drink which was really sweet but interesting and delicious. I like the food and overall vibe of this place (: would recommend to a friend!!

Yfl5bYX98Wh60BzIRuKuRg.text: In AZ on vacation and wanted to try something new. Was extremely  happy with the food and atmosphere! The portions are a good size,  enough to be full but not over stuff yourself. They have a couple of natural teas with no added sugar which are all really good too. I highly recommend the No.20

Dt9AiDI1VuPR3GWCL8WZrg.text: We had a couple different sandwiches here and they've never failed on their taste! Will always recommend to out-of-towners for breakfast!

oSkRbHyUyFi3e-5pepWGvg.text: Unique, delicious take on the sandwich. The owner is always there, and will guide you through her culinary delights, which she preserved from her grandmother's cooking.

oqJFjLWr4eYzYovuU4L4Ow.text: I wouldn't really recommend this place to anyone. Food is meh. Nothing special. Wouldn't eat here a second time. Save your money. You're just buying gentrified uncrustables.

2I81OGn-KT7qv53-jX4pZg.text: Had to convince my mother to come here. We always struggle when it comes to dining places because she craves very unhealthy foods that do not appeal to me at all.   I think she enjoyed it!! I know my #33 was fabulous ... Every bite was heaven!   Great patio out front dog friendly with misters which keeps it nice & cool! Thank you for being so thoughtful   Will repeat. Mom said it wasn't as she imagined & the food had flavor which means we don't have to fight about my selection!

qByadPAg2O0BeTItN52Qmw.text: Best #33 in Phoenix Poached egg, feta, Parmesan cheeses  with spinach, tomato  & basil .... Yummy

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Best #33 in Phoenix Poached egg, feta, Parmesan cheeses  with spinach, tomato  &amp; basil .... Yummy

CH9hEWc72_Ft6gofwCM47A.text: Super friendly staff and amazing sandwiches. Definitely a must try. It was our first time here and it definitely won't be our last. Had the #66 breakfast sandwich. Delicious!

VLVyNwX3mtwnb1YmaL34gg.text: I think this place is awesome! The restaurant alone is adorable and the owner who I got the pleasure of meeting is really nice! It had great customer service and it's easy to order a delicious sandwich. I ordered the #20 with the garbanzo salad which was super tasty! My favorite part of this place is not only was there a beautiful portrait of the owners grandmother on the wall but also there was a collage of her story on how she started  Zookz! I highly recommend this place to anyone that wants a warm fast sandwich!

Yy57gLrCQJSoEkd3zNLygQ.text: Traveling with a coworker who lives more locally, I am super glad I fessed up to being a snob about eating at chain restaurants.  I turned down Subway and broke out my Yelp app!  Zookz was nearby and had good ratings so we checked it out.  What a different idea.  It reminds me of Uncrustables in the freezer section of the grocery store but with much more adult and better fillings.    I walked in and saw a picture of the #13 which is poached egg, feta, spinach, tomato.  I didn't even look any further..this looked amazing.  And it was!  I wish I could have tried more!  I do think my coworker could have eaten more but they did have some side options available.  The sandwich was less than $5, I believe.  All options appeared $7 and less.  They also have Coke products...I'm a sucker for a fountain diet Coke.  The service was really friendly with someone greeting us immediately, taking our order promptly, and even asking how our meal was and how we heard of Zookz!  My only desire is that they open one in Dallas or Plano, Texas!  (:

2sgT6CCGFwhXI-B7wPxQBQ.text: My boyfriend and I stopped for lunch after seeing  Zooks on the PBS program "Check Please" We both loved it! I had the #35, which was above and beyond what I expected. He enjoyed the #60. Both of our sandwich's were out of this world amazing. The kale salad is to die for. I enjoyed a local craft beer him a soda. Service was excellent, great atmosphere and I highly recommend it for lunch.  We both left comfortably full with a smile and our total bill was under $25 . Best eatery for food, atmosphere, and to relax. Not to mention affordable.

wWEgSDtfZeZ8U5DBUqDOdg.text: This is a fun place to try Imagine round filled pastry/bread filled with tasty ingredients.  I had number 45 Turkey and Latte Nice people who offer to answer questions Yes they have almond milk and some high tables for outdoor seating

8U-gXTSv9PtDwRr9y1HD4Q.text: I think I was confused and didn't check out yelp ahead of time but I was really surprised when they brought me a fancy hot pocket.

Cq3nUlrZs_oDVYL0poTFMg.text: The sandwiches are toasted round filled with different delightful ingredients. You can order more traditional breakfast fillings with eggs and maybe cheese and sauce and tomatoes or a number of different things. Then there are the rest of the sandwiches with turkey or beef ir ham and ... too many  lovely things to tell in this venue. With the "lunch" sandwiches there are several salads that accompany the sandwich and they are wonderful too. The people who serve you are also very friendly. It's a pleasure to go there and I would recommend it highly.

eNPp6lTz8jfIFT0YHzTanQ.text: Delicious looking menu, friendly service. I ordered the caprese sandwich, the roast beef sandwich, and one of the sweet sandwiches (I don't remember the numbers). Ordered to go which was probably a mistake because the bread was on the soggy side when I got home. My fault completely. The garbanzo bean side salad - best part of the meal.  I will be back but I will be eating in.

lJHwviYcrUXUcrpKT8PxBg.text: This place is mediocre at best. The name is ridiculous. They should have named if after the sandwich her grandmother made. These are basicly hobo pies. The portions are really small. For $12 I left hungry. Plus the layout is all wrong. You have to double back to get your drinks and fight the crowd to sit down. I was not impressed.

f6pzETZLbsYYE0gTzWmkkA.text: First let me say it was good.  That being said, some observations...  - 4 different types of tea.  So that was good. - Potato salad appeared to have olives in it.  Not my thing.  Also, it was more of mashed potato salad.  Don't know if that is by design or if they tried to make the salad with the potatoes still hot. - Chickpea salad seemed to have a slight tuna fish flavor.  Maybe it was just me.  Good salad just an odd taste I couldn't fully identity. - 35 sandwich was good.  Horseradish sauce made the dish. - 45 sandwich was a disappointment.  Bland in taste and missing any of the honey balsamic vinaigrette that was supposed to be on it.

whR7fY5kxEgzhtCTil8Khw.text: Place was dirty.  The bottom of my shoes slowly began to adhere to the sticky mess of dried soda while waiting forever for a disappointing meal. Not what we had envisioned when we read the menu.  Save your money and buy a sandwich press.  The sandwiches are tiny and flavorless.  Service is rushed to take order and a long wait to finally get meal

6rMpaFSVqJkZGh7usGd4wQ.text: Great place to go for a light breakfast/brunch/lunch. The sandwiches are filled with your preference since you can substitute items. Great for couples and friends. Open windows & patio seating allow you to just sit & enjoy. My only critique is I would like a little more seasoning added while it's being cooked but I am able to add salt & pepper once I get it.

yoXE5sv4cUzolwRB4kBvsw.text: Randomly picked this out - looking for a deli before we flew home from Phoenix.  Neat setup - very good sandwiches.  Great customer service - staff met us in line, asked if we'd every been here before and made menu recommendations.  Would definitely come back.

9aVEWrn9idqeXk_FZ9ywsQ.text: Exceeded expectations. I've been wanting to try this place for a while and finally did. Sandwich was delicious, loved the sweet heat mustard sauce. Side salad came with the sandwich- I chose kale. So fresh. Kale, carrots, almonds and mandarin oranges. Very refreshing. Can't wait to come back and try breakfast!

icR9nDngD6HcM3wZkypScA.text: -Zookz- We've driven by this place a ton and finally got to try it the other day. I love sandwiches of an kind, and these reminded me of the ones we would make while camping growing up. They are made in a press to get that unique shape, and it actually keeps everything in and makes it less messy. First picture was the #26, it was filled with ham, bacon, tomatoes, avocado, potatoes, cheddar, and one of the House sauces. Second picture was the #60, it was filled with apple cider pulled pork, monterrey jack cheese, and their house slaw. Third picture was the #10, it was filled with Parmesan, turkey, apples, cranberries, roasted almonds, and their sweet heat mustard sauce. Last pictures just shows the sides your got with your sandwich and both were super good. One was the kale salad and the other was there chickpea salad. This place is definitely worth trying out. Very unique and done well, plus the staff was super helpful and friendly. I'd love to go back and try the breakfast sandwiches.
