Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States

XxM399UX2nCmId2n8Uv_MQ.text: Today was my first time trying this place out , the food was very delicious and atmosphere was very peaceful and unique.  I got the No. 33 Breakfast sandwich which included 2 poached eggs , fresh spinach ,feta cheese, fresh basil and tomatoes . The most unique thing about there sandwiches are that they are in mountain pies( campfire sandwiches) and so delicious , it reminded me of going camping during summer camp and making mountain pies around the campfire.  Thanks for helping reminisce on old times.   Beware during lunch you may have a hard time finding a parking spot in front , but there is always parking on the other side of flower child ,Or by see' s candies.  The staff was super friendly,  they have Wi-Fi here but unfortunately my computer wasn't letting me use it for some reason (famous: connected but no internet error).  Only thing I would have liked was to have outlets outside or inside (then again i didn't see any where I was seated) so that people could sit out side and work .

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Picture doesn&#39;t give it justice , this gooey amazingness  is No. 55 nutella, bananas, peanut butter and powdered sugar . OMG SOOOOO GOOD
Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States

4jwhd6vzsll8B6TfzhRRJw.text: A wonderful, casual "sandwich" place.  My friend and I had ordered the #35 lunch sandwich and the #11 breakfast sandwich and traded halves.  We also got the #7 salad to share.  The lunch sandwich also came with a side of potato salad, so it was a bit of a sampler on my first time there.  Everything was excellent.  The owner picked up on my deer in headlights look and came out from behind the counter to explain the menu in a bit more detail.  I really appreciated that.   Apparently the breakfast sandwiches can have the eggs tailored if you prefer scrambled as opposed to poached/over-medium consistency.  There are some spicy items, which I did refrain from because I knew my friend wasn't a fan and we'd be trading halves.  However, he must've missed the fact that there was horseradish in the lunch sandwich we picked...and although I detected it, he didn't seem to notice (or maybe didn't mind) so I assume spices here are not overpowering.  I will definitely be back if I am in the area.   The space itself is decorated in a homey, cute, cozy, charming way.  There ceiling fans inside keep the fresh air flowing in from the giant window-type bar area.  The 20 foot bench up against the wall provides seating for the east side of 5 different tables, and has cute accent pillows.  The vibe is chill, the clientele is a good mix  (young, old, hispanic, caucasian, families, lunch dates)

67bJ6aCD5bDNGwgzh3lz_w.text: We saw this place on tv show "Check Please Arizona" so decided to stop in for lunch. They didn't seem to have as many sandwiches as what we thought from seeing on tv. I had the #11 and my wife the #10. We both enjoyed them but afterwards both questioned why they didn't have a grilled cheese with tomato soup. How good that would be with their pressed circle bread. There teas are awesome, similar to Flower Child. Even now Im looking at there menu and see sandwiches as high as #77, but there menu board only seems to have 2 or 3 columns. Definitely unique and tasty and can be healthy too. Must try!

6DjXs7qcaZ8lNd-GpZ-VMA.text: After seeing amazing #foodporn pics of sandwiches from Zookz via direct mail and on local billboards on numerous occasions, I decided to head over one morning to bite into one!  Zookz offers a central location, plenty of parking, a fast-casual atmosphere, friendly service, free wifi, and indoor/outdoor seating.  The menu consists of a variety of moderately priced breakfast and lunch sandwiches and a couple of salads.  I went for a breakfast sandwich (#11).  Sadly, I wasn't overly impressed... I felt my sandwich lacked a ton of flavor despite having eggs, cheese, bacon, tomato, etc... I added sriracha sauce and gobbled it up regardless, but I don't know that I will rush back.  That being said, if sandwiches are your thing, this place is worth checking out.  I hope that you'll be more impressed than I was!

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. #11 - cheddar cheese, 2 poached eggs, bacon, tomatoes, fresh basil, cream cheese
Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cute packaging of my breakfast sandwich

FG1DwU3uJOCrtP6zdCfr6Q.text: They have a gluten free crust which tastes just as yummy as the regular.       So what is a zook? It is a cast iron pressed sandwich that has a crust somewhere between a turnover and pita bread stuffed with fun lunch or breakfast items. Like today- we had #26 which is thin slices of ham, bacon, avocado, tomato, roasted potato slices and a buttermilk sauce. You also get a choice of side with the lunch sandwiches and they are delicious, I really like the potato salad.      It is fun and delicious, so check it out! Hopefully you won't start thinking you could just dust off you George Foreman Grill - you shouldn't- it is not the same.

OBi-RYMddORrWP_bRsNnwA.text: Loved Loved Loved. As I'm eating my way through Phoenix I came across this lovely sandwich shop. The customer service from Brian was spot on from helping me choose something yummy to giving me the restaurants backstory. I'll definitely be back. As I read the backstory on each table a tear (or a slew of them) fell as I can very much relate to a Grama who fed my soul and belly at the same time.

IboqMTrO1JcWYAnOUXK9dw.text: One of my favorite places to go when I'm around my office near downtown Phoenix. My to go items are the breakfast No 33 and lunch No 20. The portion looks pretty small at first but it definitely fills you up. The food service is pretty quick so it's perfect for in between work. The parking is alright - can be hard to find space during lunch time.

jEYONsbU3EeQsn0WIAfipA.text: Sandwhiches are my favorite food because you could be so creative with it.  This was the firat time and I LOVED it!  The staff is so friendly and the environment very clean.   I ordered a No. 66 with avacado  and Chipotle sauce.  Sooo...delicious!  Lots of flavor and filling.  The poached eggs are more on the firm side ao if you dont like runny egg yolk, you will be good with a breakfast sandwhich.  All sandwhiches are available to order at anytime and you can substitute all you like.   I also ordered the chocolate & coconut sandwhich for something sweet.  This had too much coconut for me.  I suggested to the staff to have a bannana foster one or a blueberry & cream cheese  one (like a danish) for those that want a little bit of sweet with their meal.    They have awesome herbal unsweetened ice tea.  You have to try a cup.

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chocolate chip and coconut.  Uuuhhhh...it was just ok.
Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Strawberry lemon mint herbal ice tea.  AWESOMENESS
Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. No.66

cPcvsU7hC6rpR2DSWgdOig.text: I've been here twice now and have got to say that I'm in love! I've only gotten the No. 66 breakfast sandwich and an iced latte. Both are delicious. If you like fast service, handheld food bursting with delicious flavors, and good coffee, then this is THE SPOT!

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Iced latte

h3ENK5xTpdv3zfSYZVzL4Q.text: Different, but excellent.  I was a little worried that the sandwiches looks small, but it definitely filled me up. Would go back again.

1HTfjeIPZdh8F50xzqvgAQ.text: Decent roast beef, bacon, cheddar, and horseradish sandwich.  No. 35.  Taste is decent nothing extraordinary.  3-stars.  The roast beef is standard low end roast beef you can get at the grocery store.  Bacon, not even good quality bacon.  The cheddar cheese was on the mediocre level.  All lower end ingredients.  The kale salad is very good.  It has a nice fun taste to it.  4-stars.  They are fun to eat and the place has a nice selection of caffeinated and non-caffeinated teas.  Nice atmosphere and friendly service.

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. kale salad.  comes with sandwich.
Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. No. 35.  roast beef, bacon, cheddar, and horseradish sauce.

7XxXhARlzSXTLgwyTu5H9A.text: Was immediately greeted by the sweetest owner who walked us through the menu. She was SO welcoming and made my sister and I feel right at home. The only issue I had was that I wanted to try everything on the menu because it all sounded so delicious. We ended up ordering two sandwiches, two sides & drinks and everything was SO DAMN GOOD. If I'm ever in Phoenix again I will 100% be making a trip back.

gsNpPs0Y9U5JbZv8D2QV5w.text: I messed up the order. I asked for no bacon and they made it perfectly, but I didn't realize it also had ham on it as well.. I misread it, totally my fault. After I got it I realize there was meat and I'm a vegetarian, I brought it up to the cashier and he quickly made me a new one with no meat no hassle. Amazing service. Very sanitary, cool music and the tea is so refreshing. I wish I could give them more than 5 stars

SXKX-AHgetJgJWGcNGP3TA.text: Never thought I'd say this but I love round sandwiches. This place offers a unique twist on you every day sandwhiches. I had to order 2 lunch sandwhiches and a dessert to try. Everything was delicious and fresh. I wished we had one in albuquerque. The food tasted great and the staffs were super friendly. We came in on new years eve and although they had abbreviated hours, they did not hesitate to stay open until all their customers got their food.  Can't beat business practices like that.

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. #55
Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. #15
Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. #33

7sEUSlOg_2kh7YuHthTsvw.text: Can't say enough about this place I LOVE my #22 breakfast sandwich, this an exceptional brunch hotspot and the ambiance is always enjoyably relaxing, there hasn't been another substitution for the style of sandwich making this place has to offer. I've come here more than a handful of times, and have always brought along another person to try this gem.

gkdbVB-mMjlZsfkIiw5r3Q.text: So, this place is overpriced for the product. I can't say that LOUD ENOUGH.   It's a chill spot in a chill location, but I was not impressed with how unfilled I felt after eating. It was a just a small lil hot pocket looking thing that wasn't really that special.  The staff was friendly, and the service was quick. But $9+ wasn't really what I was expecting for such a small portion.   Their house salad that comes with a sandwich....it's pretty basic & flavorless.  I can't in good conscious give more than 3 stars. I will not be back.  Too proud of their inferior products.  3 stars

7Iijl8MTQD54sNRR2upCcA.text: Ordered a breakfast sandwich, and a lunch sandwich.   Nobody (cashier) bothered to tell me that a side salad came with the lunch salad. I just happened to look up, and see it on the menu board, overhead.  These felt like Hot Pockets, but not hot, and not as filling.  I tried Zooks, but I won't be back.  I like to go where I get value for my money.

YZ2Byrq9jLiw5-5-MaRqIw.text: When you need a hug from the inside out, head to Zookz! Sandwiches + Salads + Service with a SMILE.  The entire staff is an incredible team that makes you feel right at home. Healthy, indulgent, and custom options available, including Gluten-free, meat-free, and dairy-free items. Their beverage offerings are tasty, too! Say hi to Carole or Bevy Jo if you get a chance!

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Zookz: Sandwiches + Salads + Service with a SMILE.

iyivyjGew7IADcREZIv9Qw.text: I have never been in person but my best friend and I get it delivered to our home at least 3 times a month. The lunch sandwiches are great and come with a kale salad. The breakfast sandwiches are my favorite. You really can't go wrong with anything on the menu. I always love to get an apple juice with my order!

zgSGb5Gpkmc1-GYmZys6XA.text: We went here randomly after driving around starving bordering on being hangry. I'll lead with my favorite thing here- their teas! Like 6 different fresh brewed choices, I got peach and then the green tea. I run the other way when I see machine tea Lipton as it's a tea joke. Moving on, this is a panini lover's heaven. There are a bunch of different choices; we ordered one that had eggs, spinach, ham and sweet mustard in it. They press the sandwich into a closed circle, the bread was a good different, I can't place it but it was somewhere between a waffle and toast. The service was great and I appreciated the openness of the layout. Perfect breakfast and lunch spot. They even have mimosas which I heard were really good. We loved it here and the urban vibe of this restaurant made me feel so cool!

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Such a cool spot!

DDFnVq1m1no1C2IQv6tHJw.text: The location was adorable, so cute and fun to sit and people watch.  We ordered a 25,30, 20 and the dessert sandwich with Nutella, PB and Bananas.  My daughter thought the horseradish on the 30 was too strong but she still ate the whole sandwich so that tells you how good it was.  The 20 and 25 were both incredible.  The toasted bread is the perfect texture and thickness and the ratio of filling was perfect.  The kale salad wasn't my favorite.  But we were all big fans of the Tims chips.  The sweet sandwich was kind of mushy and just had a strange texture.  It was hard to swallow with the thick Nutella, PB and mushy bananas.  The lady who took our order was so friendly and informative.  I was super impressed with the service.  The sandwiches arrived promptly to our table.

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States

pZ7nziyIyDJkvNawZjCWxA.text: After I finished facilitating my meeting for work, my co-worker and I decided to get a bite to eat.  We were starving, we were hungry, we were cranky.  Unfortunately for us it was still early so everywhere we wanted to go was still not opened.. That's when we decided to give this place a try.    The restaurant was clean, service was good, staff was helpful and nice, the food was unique and good, plenty of lighting and unfortunately the price is kinda high, but no big deal.   Overall a good little place, we had a nice time, and I would probably only comeback....

zf_YPFZ0-qsCtGoMYLCnGQ.text: Modern and trendy sandwich place.  I got the #25 and it was OK overall... It tasted basically just like a normal hot sandwich that just happened to have a unique shape to it. In other words, it was fine, just nothing memorable. Prices are high given the quality of ingredients (which IMO, seemed pretty run-of-the-mill) and portion size (small).  In short: More flash than substance...

3fOp_BI5wbjMKDWOXHqUcA.text: This place is great! They have fun and creative sandwiches in a way that I've never had. I've tried a breakfast sandwich and a lunch sandwich and both are delicious. With the breakfast sandwich, it's nice that they ask if you'd like poached eggs or scrambled, and the poached eggs are great. The lunch sandwich I got was a turkey bacon avocado and was out of this world. The side salads are also something different, and so far I've liked the kale over the others. Also, try the teas that they have, they are fantastic. Great place for lunch and super friendly staff!

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States

4jZFaibOc7QkrL1YgnJ1sA.text: I got the number 45 and the kale salad, both of which were outstanding :D will definitely be back to try the dessert sandwiches

oS6Ue_m7uAZzVfcDtXD2Ig.text: Zooks is a cool place to grab a good samdwhich. I. Like everything about the place the way it's decorated inside, the help I received from the workers there seeing that it was my first time. And the sandwiches are made fresh to order. They are unique sort of a little pocket of goodness wrapped up in them. I ordered the #22 on the breakfast menu. Packed full of poached eggs, beans, avocado, ham, and zook sauce. Tasted good and hit the spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. #22 on the breakfast menu
Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States

X5Rz81EQHVICRVVyXfpfow.text: Wow yes!!! I will absolutely come here again!!!! The owner greeted us and told us favorites we picked the No 20 sandwich! It's sooooooooo beyond good!!!!!!! Thank you for an amazing lunch!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States

BGWlAyPFajIQP7l9kqs7Pw.text: I wanted to get some sandwiches to go. I thought, with the good reviews that I was making a good choice. Would have been better off with a fast food version from Subway.  Zookz was $9 and the sandwiches are small with weird items on it. I am a foodie, we gave #20 and #26 a try. Both ham sandwiches were gross in flavor and quality, soggy, and one had obviously canned grainy black beans in it.  Now that my stomach hurts, I can say that I wish I could just rewind and never eat at this place in the first place.

Pdc5aGg95VwzBHsCiVaRfg.text: Best grilled sandwiches, nowhere else is even close.  Unique circular shape with a pressed hard outer crust. Any of the breakfast sandwiches (poached egg) are great. Get the Zinger.

0bK5ABV6yLeF0kLptF3B9Q.text: Such a cute place with large windows so you have lots of natural lighting. Portions are a filling size and it comes with a side salad!! I'm a health freak so I'm super into super foods and they had a mandarin kale salad that was delish! Employees were very sweet. I'd say y'all should go in and give it a try:)

uCyksBouE-FaE4mTnEvpnQ.text: Found this place by accident, best gluten free breakfast sandwich in awhile. Sort of like hot pockets. I told them it was our first time here. They brought us a complimentary Kale salad, seriously good tasting. I usually don't like Kale. They had a special breakfast sandwich and Mimosa for $10. Such a deal! We sat outside, beautiful day, the owner stopped over and introduced herself. Trendy little place for a quick breakfast or lunch. Has a happy, open vibe! Loved it!

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Stopped in at Zookz today first time, planned on Flower Child for gluten free lunch, but there was a line, saw cute little place next door.

7ocB4dDrckL12CulEo5Vog.text: Excellent service! Have talked to the owner a few times and she is such a beautiful soul. The food is really good. They are really willing to help you find something you'll like. They also make the effort of you have allergies to ensure something great regardless of your limitations! A weekly meal!

_2yrMvCmrDKmkx3KWNoKOg.text: Crisp light lunch in a perfect size, round, grilled sandwich. It's not your typical, greasy Phoenix food. When I eyed the kale and coconut salad (which is really good, by the way), I was transported back to LA. Food here is both healthy and delicious. It made me feel good about yourself instead of feeling weighed down and heavy.

fFXvPA4N7oSQ6d75Uzh3ew.text: The owner is such a delight! Every time we are in there she stops by to say hi and make sure we are enjoying our food. The sandwiches are unique and delicious! Try the kale salad side and one of their yummy fresh brewed iced teas to complete your meal! Best of luck as they continue to grow into their new shop!

JP2QT80PJBL9g3cdIYqyAA.text: So I need to get better about writing reviews because I only do them for the very best or very worst. Zookz is one of the very best. Such a cool and yummy concept! It's like uncrustables filled with the best stuff, and the back story is really cool (you can read it on the wall if you're so inclined) I'm not going to say I had a mimosa at 8 am on a Tuesday, but if I did, I would bet the passionfruit one was soooooo good. I don't eat meat, and the owner was super accommodating and made great suggestions. We did breakfast, mine was egg and cheese and avocado and a crazy good sauce, my friend got the frittata one because he doesn't like runny middle eggs but after, the owner told us we can get any Sammie  with harder cooked eggs. He loved his too. This is my new regular breakfast stop for sure

1o2QxkM-OoFEHC7kGUCI5Q.text: Quick place to get a pressed-sandwich. Prices are reasonable and they have convenient online ordering so you can order your sandwich ahead of time and have it ready to pick up. The #55 with peanut butter, nutella, banana, and almonds is my favorite - highly recommended! I tried the #77 with chocolate, coconut, and almonds once and wasn't overly impressed - there was way too much coconut and not enough chocolate, made it pretty dry.

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States

T71ANK1XnwIxBFK9clDd9Q.text: Wow! Loved my sandwich, tea, and side kale salad. Everything's seems fresh, and what a unique and creative idea for sandwiches. I loved it. Recommend trying it if in the area. Definitely left me with an itch to come back and try different sandwiches! I had the 35, basically roast beef with horseradish sauce, it was very tasty!

CRedXnnm-aV2CNOMNU-gvg.text: Good prices, great concept, no flavor. Maybe I should have asked for salt and pepper. The bread has very little flavor and very tough on the teeth. Thank God I have perfect teeth but many don't and this sandwich could be uncomfortable to eat. Mouth feel of a soft thin brick. Egg was cooked rare and without the salt and pepper had no flavor either. The pictures look amazing but the product has some shortfalls.

W15NcPrzwBoTdRk875aMhg.text: I've been meaning to post a review for months now because I have literally NEVER been disappointed here. The sandwiches are amazing and the prickly pear tea is delicious! The owner is the sweetest woman you'll ever meet and almost always there. Really gives you that small-town, personal feel.. right here in Central Phoenix!  Great food, great people, quick service. Try out the #20. You won't regret it! Oh! They also have gluten-free bread now for anybody with a gluten allergy!

RPMNth0gmid6H1eh1EXQaQ.text: Wow is all I can say about my Breakfast Sandwich !!!  Plenty of parking, a very friendly staff, who will walk you through your order especially if it's your First Visit.  The Breakfast Sandwich was Delicious w/scrambled eggs, bacon & cheese. A tasty sandwich w/apple juice all for a Great Low Price !!  My only complaint about the Restaurant, is it's in Phoenix and I was only visiting for Five Days.   I'll be back next year and it will not be just One Time.

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States

VSwe5TODQK4sG3HYsqzCaw.text: Seen this place on a billboard ad and saw some friends try this place out so a friend and I decided to check it out and we were impressed! The atmosphere was relaxing and the staff was extra friendly. We tried the number 22 and number 11 breakfast sandwiches and they were both great! We will definitely be coming more often!

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Number 22

C8yNBJknBfvxrlHUz7FTDg.text: Boy, are you in for a taste sensation! ! I ordered #25, ham and cheddar, etc and hubby got #35 roast beef. Wow oh WOW! ! Both are excellent,  can't decide which is favorite,  both are just pain yummy! ! And that potato salad is to die for,  a long with the kale,  which I could eat every day!! The place is just south of Camelback, on the west side of Central Ave. Very cute and clean interior,  with outside eating also. Staff is very friendly,  and eager to explain "Zooks". Carol, the owner is delightful, warm and friendly.  They also cater, which is good news, because you just want to share these sandwiches and salads with family and friends! !     They serve breakfast and lunch sandwiches,  all is available during store hours.

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cute, colorful industrial inside!!

ZLsDyysJNCt8PeNk7WUNgA.text: Breakfast sandwiches served all day long. It is like a dream come True. If you also a late riser, missing the preposterously early 10:30 AM mark, then, my friend, this is also a dream come True for you. They close early-ish so no breakfast sandwiches are to be had for dinner. But, hey, first world problem.  The bread is odd and tasty...like a cross between a pita and a hot pocket. I dig it.

9tT5DhEY7tjX3xbS03Zt1A.text: 5 stars, as usual Zookz. This place has seriously become one my favorite places to get a quick, affordable breakfast/brunch.  Ventured off the breakfast menu today, ordered the pulled pork sandwich and it was incredible. Would absolutely recommend this place to anyone.  The care that the owner puts into the restaurant shows through almost all aspects of the place. Really a great place.

Pxu_U9cYBh8ec24EI1w5hw.text: Fantastic place and the idea is genius! I love the sandwiches, they taste so good, perfectly seasoned and totally out the box idea! I met the owner and I loved hearing about her background and how she came to open the restaurant. I'm looking forward to going back for seconds soon!

F4hktDfFaXH8AFr40TErJw.text: Delicious toasties and teas in a breezy open air cafe. I'd definitely go back if I'm ever in town again!

K4ezuXQvyClUZlwx_xkaRQ.text: This is the second time I've been here and again they have good sandwiches.  Also if you're a tea person they have fresh brewed (unsweetened- my personal favorite).  It's a cute place set in downtown right off Central.  There are lots of other things to do around here as well and I suggest making the time of your hungry for breakfast.

F_j9ei-zR6OBS4GfLG2Hlw.text: Very different approach on sandwiches and I like it.   I love the ingredients and all the different options that they have. It is fresh and yummy for sure.   Portions are perfect but not everybody would agree with me on that one. For me it is just right amount of food.   Service is great and atmosphere is nice. Location is awesome and I cant wait to go back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Gz0j4xnjvMbbmsg4_Ekduw.text: I agree with most everything Greg W said, though I don't think they are overpriced as he implied. The sandwich was pretty good, but small. I had the #15-- turkey, dried cranberries, almonds, shredded carrots, and curry sauce. All of the ingredients were really good but still not sure about the bread/wrap. Definitely unique, not offensive in any way, just don't know that I like it as much as regular good old fashioned bread. It's a nice change of pace at least. You also get a side salad or chips. I had the kale salad and it was quite tasty. Service is very friendly and they care about what they do so my review is really a 3.5. Bottom line: good quality food and friendly service but maybe just not my cup of tea.

LfeviA8gRyMNkF5wZlsOkg.text: Great place to eat, friendly staff and the food is good!  I like the unique style..definitely recommend this place!!

4BRMQmFlY_WZsbQsFlImkQ.text: The employees were incredibly friendly and helpful, even offering a suggestion to my 12 year old daughter who is a bit picky with foods. We had the #35 and #20 and both were delicious! I thought the portion size was right on, especially since it also comes with a side. Sure you could spend a dollar or two less at a fast food drive through but this is is quick, casual dining with high end taste and ingredients. Also, we always love finding a local spot that is family friendly and satisfies our foodie palettes!  Definitely will be coming back to Zookz and recommending to others for both the food quality and excellent service.

_4459bpDjZZkLJVIPJDJDg.text: Love Zookz! I work downtown so time was limited. I ordered online from their website, zookzsandwiches.com. It was so simple to do. I got to choose my pickup time. I got there at noon and was able to go directly to the counter. The cashier was friendly and had a big smile on her face. My food was out within 60 seconds and my sandwich (the #45) was nice and warm- and 10 minutes later when I got to my office it was still warm and fresh. I had kale salad on the side. The flavors were excellent and ingredients were fresh and crisp! With placing my order to go, I did not get a good look at inside, however I did notice it was clean and open to the outside eating space in the front. With the quick & easy online ordering, the quick & friendly staff, and the fresh & delicious food, I will definitely be back!

G_vBYYRxZNdD_JmnsAvYyQ.text: Um...I might have an addiction! Every thing I have ever ordered there has been great! The owner is very cool and checks to make sure everything is perfect! She even brings us samples of new things to try and asks for our feedback! Love that! Can I just say...the #55 with peanut butter, Nutella, bananas and almonds...I die!

QrPMjZhk1Pmh8tkd5PV9mw.text: Delicious! The bread is buttery, soft in the center and a little crispy on the outside. The kale salad it fantastic as well as the potato salad. I had the turkey bacon sandwich. Very good!

6LnnviLoh_i7A61IBdnYMQ.text: Delish! Had a breakfast sandwich to go and it was rich, filling, and perfectly sized. I really want to try their other sandwiches.

eO-j1reoAOxak0kbPMmWsQ.text: We had the breakfast sandwiches. The chipotle one and the basil spinach one. I liked the basil spinach one the best. The eggs ended up being more hard boiled than I was expecting since the menu described them as poached eggs, overall they were really good! *Be sure to read the cute story on their wall about how they started!

wp5fYNH92Dw63wC915Wi3A.text: Great for lunch, perfect portions....(unless you just finished trying out for the Cardinals then you might needs something a little more substantial).

o8-fn4w2JhWB5sjpa7P6Qg.text: Definitely a great new sandwich place! We had the #20 and #32 with side kale salads. They were hot and full of flavor! The kale salad was great as well! Looking forward to trying a different sandwich next time.

nQJMf-sdeCojXINTxaKlAA.text: We discovered Zookz today after driving around endlessly looking for something "different" and finally finding it! This is the best sandwich I have had in YEARS. I used to love Bennigan's Monte Cristo sandwich but they went out of business quite some time ago and I couldn't find anything even remotely close afterward; Padre Murphy's Monte Cristo didn't cut it. Zookz' #30 with thinly sliced ham, brie, apricot preserves and roasted almonds isn't a Monte Cristo but it's just as tasty in it's own way. We will definitely be back to try everything on their menu - Zookz is that good! The Kale salad is awesome too. I have a feeling that everything will be delicious, no matter what we order. Thank you, Carol, for opening such a great restaurant! :0)

3njGzwkQ4HLVDzzIYRaKPQ.text: These are the best sandwiches in Phoenix. The owner is so friendly and will make sure that you enjoy what you get. It creates a wonderful environment of great guest service.   The only problem is that since the sammiches are so good, you never get enough! I've ordered two before because I couldn't stop eating them.    The kale salad they use as a starter is so good that it could be its own meal.   It's seriously a treat to eat at Zookz.

lB1qu7NFfUQoPmY79pE2RQ.text: Unique sandwiches & perfect portion for a light lunch. I had the pomegranate green tea & the kale salad to pair with my sandwich (#20 is the most popular). Kenny was very helpful in suggesting what sandwiches were best to try. I ordered The Zinger (one of their most popular sandwiches posted on the wall) for breakfast tmrw & he made sure it was in a to go bag & not cut in half, that way you could heat it up with no issues for the next day. If you get a lunch sandwich you can combine it with a salad of your choice or a bag of chips. They have iced tea or you can choose a beverage from their fountain drinks. If you choose a breakfast sandwich, it's a la carte, so i suggest a lunch sandwich to experience the whole shebang! You don't want to cut yourself short on a foodie adventure. No one likes a person who half-asses anything. Go all out! Or be bold an order 2 sandwiches! They also have something sweet for those of you who are sweettooths.

KaTHe3LKEECz_-APmGUolQ.text: Zookz is the best sandwich in the game, period! Most sandwiches in Phoenix are overpriced, traditional, & particular boring - whereas Zookz is cheap, unique, & healthy! Everyone from management to the cashiers are respectful & loving, & I am always excited to eat the best sandwich in Phoenix!

xsUFEUPY6tb_HN74esCujg.text: We went to Zook's from a friends reccomendation.  We walked in and it was the cutest clean and fun all mixed together.  The staff at the counter were smiling and happy.  Later found out one of them was the owner.  She was great and personable.  I tried the ham, brie and apricot preserves sandwich.  when it arrived, I was surprised by the cute pocket sandwich.   Hot and fresh.  The kale salad side dish was great too.  ( I am not a kale fan).   Definitely a place I will return to and try one of the morning poached egg sandwiches.  They looked delicious.  Hours are 7 am - 3pm.  Stop by for a great healthy breaskast to start your day.

blccr9wI83Gg7-tCUoviwQ.text: Zookz makes some tasty sandwiches!  The sandwiches are in a tasty bread shell.  I had the no. 20 and the flavor combinations are excellent, and the ingredients tasted fresh.  I also had the black bean/corn salad as a side and it was very tasty and refreshing.  The service was also very good, and the sandwich came out quickly after I ordered.  I would definitely recommend it!

fbbAuzZ9NC2Gk13-8DO5oQ.text: No 20 with kale salad $7. Refreshing, yummy and fast. Happy friendly staff. Clean modern atmosphere. I thought it was a pita from the pics but actually actual French bread pressed into a circular panini like press

3AktHLhtcNMzC5lCqpYZZQ.text: 1st time here.. interesting place. Food was good, on the small portion size. I will try it again.

HeI-tJllIOwFdZVSqkHMJg.text: This place is delicious! The sandwiches are reasonably priced and very filling! If you get a non-breakfast sandwich it will also come with a side. Both times I have visited the owner is there and she is very pleasant and will explain the menu in depth to first timers. The zookz chipotle sauce is also quite tasty and adds a special taste to the sandwiches. I would recommend this place to anyone. The only downside is that it is on central and parking is very limited, especially because the hotel behind the restaurant won't allow parking on their lot.

24SdCpM1GbymgTm-K_bKXg.text: These are unique and fabulous sandwiches. The "edge" keeps the juices in the sandwich not running down your arms. I often order these for my office when we have a working lunch.  It doesn't feel much like work when we get to tuck into these. Just one try and you will be hooked.

grlyosFsjwHKH8QmKRPitA.text: AWESOME!! If you are in PHX, you need to to go. Stacy was awesome and we loved hearing the amazing history of the sandwich (epic!) from Carol. Thank you

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Number #66.

YxFNEVjyCnI7zoLmkWkWBw.text: Yummy sandwiches, the price is unbeatable! The restaurant is cute and clean, the staff is friendly. I had # 66 it was SO good. My kids had a bacon, cheese and egg sandwich and loved it. I'll definitely be back :)

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Number 11. So good! Egg, bacon, cream cheese, tomato &amp; green onion.
Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. #66 bacon, egg, cheese, tomato, green onion, &amp; cream cheese sauce.

DyFjSFZcWCCqUZ9QKdxbJA.text: I know Zookz may not be everyone's favorite sandwich joint, but I think it's all about ordering the right sandwich for you.  I love #20 and my husband always loves #66, and I appreciate that their sandwiches are always warm and toasty without the greasiness of a grilled cheese.  Their teas are delicious and I love not having to wait for them to bring me my side so I can whet my appetite as I wait.  Service is always exceptional, regardless of how busy they may be!

ec8U_Z5M1gProAwFeJ6lkA.text: Fabulous! New favorite place to eat! Cool atmosphere and excellent food, as well as quick service! I ordered the #22 breakfast sandwich and would definitely order it again. They do breakfast all day, and also have lunch sandwiches available too. My only complaint, is that there's only one location! Crossing my fingers for more locations!

Xjz2Bts8p1Pg-Y0pYxOypg.text: First time here last weekend and I really enjoyed it. The cashier guy was super friendly and helped us pick a sandwich based on what we like. The owner stepped out, greeted us, and checked in on us as we were enjoying our food. I really liked the fact that the seatings extended indoor to outdoor, really opened up the restaurant and made it a very welcoming atmosphere. I also like the fact that they have a small sink near the soda dispenser so you can conveniently wash your hands without going all the way to the bathroom.   On to the food: I got 2 egg frittata sandwich. It was very good. Delicious flaky bread, yummy fresh ingredients. Apparently they get their bread specially made by wildflower bread company.   I am totally coming back! And you should definitely try it out.   --keep eatin'

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States

IEe9KrlFbxYvK047VrZZKQ.text: First time there and it was a good impression. Not great but good. Ordered the Chicken curry sandwich and the side Kale salad. Sandwich was warm and the portion was good. However, I'm use to Kale salads being sour. This one was sweet. I know it said a Citrus dressing but I wasn't expecting sweet citrus. I was impressed with the tea selection. Very good unique selections. Overall, a good and expedient experience.

hwkrif7Xa-jQy9PbGiHygQ.text: Try number 35 if you're a horse radish fan! Extremely good value, terrific concept! Would recommend in a heartbeat!

JP6yuLkBKqcK0DOmenE-3Q.text: Awesome twist on the sandwiches. They have around 8-10 options,but you can always customize and add/remove ingredients.  The size portions may be on the smaller side if you have a big appetite,but the side salad(i love the chickpea one) helps.  They cater to your sweet tooth with the Peanut butter jelly sandwich as well. The owner(I think its the owner) is really involved and will make sure you have the best experience.

Th7qbZT1N76-XYqfWKmNNw.text: Real pleasure stopping in for an awesome breakfast sandwich this mornng, meeting Carol and learning about her awesome shop.  She said she's poured her heart and soul into the shop the last three years and it shows.  So happy she's moving a few blocks north to the restored Uptown Plaza.  Sounds like a great indoor/outdoor seating area right on Camelback is coming.  Save me a spot please!

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States

nPsG7Dlt_v9nKVVRwJVDXA.text: The sandwiches are good, no doubt about it. Definitely get the sides, not the chips with your meal. The sides are where it's at. Never tried the kale salad but I've heard it's very good. You can't really go wrong with any of the sandwiches, but my personal favorite is the No. 20. I've been eating here since they were at the old location right on central, and the new location across the intersection is great! I was worried that with the move the place wouldn't be the same and that the expansion would negatively affect the quality and taste of the food, but it's still great! My only gripe with them is the size of their meals, it's just not enough for me. I am 6'5 with a big appetite so I rarely go when I'm really hungry. With that being said my girlfriend thinks the portions are perfect so don't let that stop you from going! Plus the owner is super nice! Enjoy!

D0VL-hwkn2wlXrgmo-DreA.text: Excellent fast casual sandwich spot. Perfect for a quick, savory breakfast sandwich that's grilled in a pocket-like pasty. I'll definitely be back. Very reasonable prices too.

-tm05swCnCMezxMPXE1__A.text: Unique and addicting sandwiches! These sandwiches are one of a kind and a must try!! If you like trying new foods, try this place! Their sandwiches are all great, fresh and bread/crust is amazing. Always made to order. Like Cornish Pasty but better in my opinion! Service is top notch! The staff is always friendly and caring. Yes, they seem to care about your lunch! The owner is very genuine and you can tell she loves her restaurant and staff. Highly recommend this place and bring friends here whenever I can.  Love the Kale salad but I wish it were a little larger in size in my opinion. I just get two salads because one just isn't enough.  Don't forget to get a punch card! You will be back. :-)  Thanks Zookz!

N_0poWzjDdS9FHghxznkxQ.text: I just had a wonderful experience here so 5 stars it is. If George Foreman owned a eatery it would be Zooks. Lol- they make their sandwiches in a machine that transfers your meal into a pocket type of sandwich melt kind of like the grills Foreman makes. See, so I made that fun connection. However, the difference is the owner Carole is a gem. (Okay, maybe George is too but I don't know him personally or have ever met him before - Call me George Foreman the next time you are in Phx and Zooks is on me.- lol, silly me.)   After I walked in looking a little lost, a woman comes running over to me with a big grin on her face. She was so welcoming and explains the entire sandwich making process to me. I had no idea what to order so we began to chat. "Wow, the staff here are so helpful and nice," I am thinking to myself. ( especially after I tell her I meant to go to another restaurant and found my way here by mistake. Well not really since Zooks was on the "Gotta Try List" anyway. I believe Karma led me here today ) Well, as it turns out this charming lady is to my great surprise the actual owner, Carole. She is so delightful, helpful and friendly. It is apparent Carole loves what she does and is proud of her place.   The breakfast sandwich I received was pretty tasty. They use Wildflower bread, Ummm, "Yummers!" I can't wait to come back and try all of the different menu item sandwiches. I read all these great comments on the Kale salad so I will have to try that too.   The only thing you might want to note is that the sandwiches are smaller than the average way too big portions we seem to be familiar with in America. I was thrilled myself. However, some other people who do not know any better might be forewarned.   Thank you Carole and the pleasure was all mine to meet you. Just a note, I never made it to the other restaurant at all. I might never with you nearby.

jWQ90XnGGZuq7MgNmOPb0w.text: Decent sandwhiches. Ordered the number 22 with no cheese. They didn't put the sauce on it, that should have been. It a was a tad dry. The coffee was good, however it was almost as expensive as the sandwhich. 3 stars  To make it even worse, the owner came up trying to beg us to correct the issue. As we were walking out, the cooks and cashier starred us down. Wont be coming back here. As a professional yelper, zookz has failed.

uX1vYiUw31hgiYB8VWj9xQ.text: Looking for a quick breakfast place while waiting to start on a job. Smelt the toasting of the breads and followed the aroma.   Didn't get in the door a half a second and was met by a bubbly counter lady, Stacie,  who was generous with her happiness. It was nice to see a pleasant face first thing in the morning. She educated me on all their  sandwiches and explained which was best for breakfast and what her favorite was. She even got the cooks in the back the smile while they are making my sandwich.  I had the Zinger, which is a breakfast sandwich and I was trying to figure out how to come back for lunch. They have a large door open between the outdoor and indoor area where you can sit outside or inside, I sat in between and enjoyed the train and the outside air while I ate he delicious pocket like sandwich. This place is a little jewel right off of Central Avenue and Camelback and should really be much busier then it was.  I will definitely start recommending this place and bring friends by, maybe even for lunch today.

WhC5iduyJwWSriLzEdgruw.text: The food is delicious, simple and fresh. The owner and staff are friendly and thoughtful. The store is lively and bright. Excellent neighborhood sandwich shop!!

9aYM2qJeYpl1Stj91u9M6Q.text: I was on my way to another restaurant, saw the picture of #66 sandwich on the, well, sandwich board, and had to have it. Yes, boiled eggs are usually an indication of dry things to come, but it seemed worth the risk. The balance of sauce and other ingredients produce an independent item with near perfect new flavors.    About the only thing better than the food is the service. The staff is friendly, patient, and helpful - in a natural unforced manner.   On a side note: food, especially sandwiches and/or eggs, are generally either not photogenic (see: any place with pictures on the menu) or look over produced (Barbara Walters lens filter with a side of vibrant greens for a youthful effect). Zookz somehow cracked the code - the pictures are great.  Great job!

GafdARTE0-u1y7FdrSattg.text: Was in the area. Didn't have breakfast and was hungry. Searched on yelp and just chose a place. Found Zookz and it looked delicious. Went inside and was greeted by some chill dudes. I ordered the No. 33 which had: 2 poached eggs, feta ans parmesan cheese, fresh spinach, tomatoes and basil in the sandwich. Very very delicious. The outside was crunchy and the inside was soft and savory. It was pretty cheap too. I will come back if I am in the area again.

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States

9ASvXPdE_7bbE6AHgoxNZQ.text: This place is great.   Zooks is just a stones throw away from where I live. My girlfriend recommended to me so I thought I'd check it out. Zooks is kinda like a Cornish Pasty co. on the go and less hearty. Although, I believe Zooks food is completely fresh. I will most likely be back and would recommend this place to others. For breakfast the number 11. sandwich is great.  Pros:  -great service -short wait times -awesome tasting food -great prices  Cons: -I feel like there are random close times on the weekends -not much parking

MuFTkgzv26LyQ57_0S7yQw.text: Stacy was great and had amazing customer service. This #33 add turkey is bommmmb.com. beefy good portion size for the price

uOI-WNCI18UBoc3KV4on6w.text: First of all, parking is awful. It was a Saturday at noon and no one was in the place, but there wasn't a space available!  Park on a sidestreet behind the little shopping center and you'll be fine.  Be sure to get the kale salad. Who likes kale? :-P You will after this salad!  It's tiny, but get it instead of chips. We split #35 and 20, roast beef and turkey. Both very unique!  Skip subway or McDonalds for lunch. Try Zookz. Sandwiches are a cross between a grilled cheese, pita pocket and calzone.  Very friendly service.

9W1hgOnwq2tbWFmva9zaPA.text: I've been coming here since Zookz opened and it has never failed to be delicious! The entire staff is extremely kind and helpful, especially when you don't know what you want to order. I tend to get the 20 or 25, but I've never had a bad sandwich. The sandwiches are all full of flavor because of all the ingredients and healthy (well, maybe not the Nutella one, but that's understandable). One complaint I see here is the crust, but I've never had a problem with it. I personally find it just fine and its part of what makes the sand which unique. My only complaint here is the sandwiches are small, so if I'm particularly hungry I'll order two. However, I usually can't decide between two sandwiches so this is just fine with me! I'd highly recommend Zookz!

mLoJeNCp8djVm68Z6xdY9A.text: We stopped by for lunch today and we are so happy we did! We walked In and right away were greeted by the owner. She was so sweet and explained the menu to us. We got two sandwiches and a desert and they were all so delicious! Our meals came with a salad option and we got the kale salad and the potato salad. Both were so good! Definitely recommend stopping by!

7ftcnOYbbVt_6X0sVuME0g.text: Phenomenal sandwiches, lame hours. If they were open past 3:00PM, I might be able to make it more often than once in every fourteen weekends.

58AQmBSEn3k00fIrV7svHw.text: The owner was kind and friendly to us. The kale salad and potato salad were very unique and delicious! Our sandwiches (The Zinger and #25) were very tasty too.

ibYm7M16Zixj3n8S4F18Vg.text: Soooooo good. Lives up to yelp reviews. Although not big portions, it was just the right amount so I didn't feel like I was going into a food coma. Ordered the Zinger and it was so tasty. Cream cheese made it different than your average breakfast sandwich. The man who took my ordered was so friendly and helped me sift through the menu. He even came by after to see what I thought and like he said the cream cheese adds some "zing or pizzaz". Service was great.

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Zinger! Cream cheese adds the &#39;zing&#39; to the sammy.

xEKUWnqAdquRQoK2LcmYOw.text: All I can say is wow. Awesomeness in the form of warm breakfast and lunch sandwiches. My husband and I tried the "Zinger" which apparently wasn't on the menu originally but the owner said everyone loved it so much it is one of the most popular sandwiches. They also have sweet sandwiches as well if you've got a sweet tooth. We are only in town for a couple days and loved this place so much we are coming back again tomorrow. If we lived in the area this would definitely be one of my regular spots. Also to note the owner is super sweet and her staff is very friendly. They are pretty quick in the kitchen as well so if you don't have a lot of time this is a great place to grab a quick bite. Enjoy! You will not be disappointed.

HdIq9rtpHyB06WGY5s7l3g.text: My hubby and two young kids happened upon Zookz on a Saturday (which they are now open on) & loved it! Hubby had a roast beef something with the kale salad, I had something with cheese & eggs, both kids had the bananas Nutella and PB sooo yummy. The kale salad is more fine and like a "slaw" than a regular salad. I really want to go back & taste something else on the menu. The major plus for this place is the family owned feel. The owner talked to us a little, and was eager to answer our questions about ingredients, how the sandwich was made, etc. For me - good Customer Service is never forgotten!

Etvi83WP01tNdenVQRMMiw.text: I see all the mixed reviews so don't listen to them, listen to me!  PRO:  The food here is very good.  I had a sandwich and potato salad   CON.  The prices are high, charged me $8+.  Which wouldn't be an issue if the kitti-kat portions  were not so small.  That 4 oz salad doesn't cut it.  Which explains why there are so many females in here for their foo foo lunch.  But a REAL MAN who is used to eating a double burger combo with fries and quart of beer will leave very hungry or very poor.  Be warned

xRQ-ILngKubCAGqk3vL1zQ.text: Zookz is awesome and the owners are so nice! My daughter cant eat eggs, so they accomodate her No. 44 request No Egg - Extra ham every time. They are wonderful and the ZOOKZ are so tasty and  priced affordably. We try to get to Zookz at least every few weeks. If you have not tried this place, you will not be dissapointed. Try it!

YoIR6hXmm5KI4p7O-E0DqQ.text: Was there again today and the place continues to win me over and over again. All the employees are very friendly and I've dealt with the owner and she's a wonderful lady. Both the breakfast and lunch sandwiches are consistently good and the ambience is casual and modern. Can be irritatingly hipster at times, but it's downtown, so is expected. Highly recommended!

ht8MVuolzTcacVWgUwZ6gg.text: I was in downtown Phoenix and planned to find a local place to pick up breakfast. Thank you, Yelp, for showing me Zookz around the corner from the office building I was at! Thanks to Zookz for an awesome, smooth cup of coffee (dispensed from pump decanter instead of burning on a hot plate of the coffee maker). The breakfast sandwich lived up to the Yelp reviews. It was a delicious use of premium soft cheese, poached eggs, tomato, etc. My tummy gave me a high five on the way back to the west valley. That's why I adore local eateries! So good!

uhvQgae21FLRX0uorKAzDQ.text: I was looking for a place to eat breakfast or lunch and thanks to Yelp I decided to try this place out.   Zookz has a really relaxing atmosphere, owner is very friendly and helpful. I got the #25 which consisted of ham, tomatoes, avocados, black beans, shredded cheddar cheese and chipotle sauce. Portion size was good for the price too ($7 and some change for the sandwich).  All menu items sounded delicious, and the sandwiches come with either chips or kale salad (for all you kale lovers). I'd definitely come back here again and hope to try out the breakfast items next time.  Bonus tip: Check in on foursquare and you'll receive 15% discount. It's a May deal only so I highly suggest you check this place out and get the discount!

MGu85cNfUqedoBYxWGdyMg.text: Delish! A foodies grab and go dream! Looking for a perfect panini-style breakfast sandwich with perfect poached eggs for breakfast or something original for lunch with quality fresh ingredients!? Try this locally owned ladies sandwich shop who is twisting up something unique and creative. I want one at the airport and in Scottsdale. Yummy!

vDWcl-cI49m2si58vsUAXw.text: Nice Sunday casual food. I had the ham, avocado, black bean chipotle.  It was great! I'm not a fan of hot sandwiches but this might change my mind. The potato salad had corn and black beans and it was a fabulous twist! Atmosphere was very laid back and cozy. I would have liked a wheat alternative to the bread as I don't care for white bread. Worth seeking out! Oh-- I think the owner said hi and that was nice!

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The new twist on potato salad
Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ham, cheese, avocado, black bean w chipotle sauce
Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Turkey, Apple, Parmesan

OTV-KggzlYAq5SsfjRwZuQ.text: Charming place and a story to go along with the excellent food. We had the #10 and #66 and both were wonderful. I give this place my highest praise which is "great food!". We will be back!

eEIfeFgLeprwaC5gWTwkQA.text: Best sandwich place I've visited in a while! Friendly staff, excellent sandwiches (I had to get 2 on the first order),  and the owner even came out to talk to us. Definitely would recommend!

aEx6IhWtZMvF9x_mqDGpcg.text: Interesting idea of sandwich shop, we tried couple different sandwiches and it tasted just average, but kind of expensive.

O51QX992pdiAsIIj22EvZw.text: Heard about this amazing place from a friend. It was like a grilled cheese for breakfast! Nice quality ingredients, and very reasonable prices. The owner was incredibly accommodating and friendly. Very passionate about her business. I will most definitely be back!  I would also like to add that I went here for breakfast and had to take half the sandwich home. They're very filling!

xhKmKjACHpWX4KV1-5jmoQ.text: My friend and I were in the mood for a sandwich for lunch so we decided to look up what was nearby when we found Zookz and decided to give it a try since the reviews were so positive.  The staff was friendly and the interior was clean bright and breezy from the open doors letting in the fresh air and light. It felt almost like being on a patio instead of indoors. He ordered the #25 and I ordered the #35. Both were delicious, if somewhat smaller than expected. For a light lunch the size is perfect,  especially if you have the kale salad alongside it. I actually liked the kale salad so much I decided to ask if I could get a larger order to go to have as a healthy snack while at work.  The owner came by our table to personally ask how we enjoyed our food. I told her how much I enjoyed the salad and asked her if they sold a larger portion to go. She informed me they didn't, but would happily pack one for me. That's what I call great service! I found her very friendly and accommodating. I was pleasantly surprised...There aren't that many owners who take the time or care to go around personally asking customers how their experience was...that's a great way to keep people coming back.  Overall my friend and I enjoyed Zookz and will be back.   By the way: If you check in on foursquare you can get 15% off your meal...also on yelp if you check in, they give you 10% off.

photos.caption: Photo of Zookz Sandwiches - Phoenix, AZ, United States. #35 Roast Beef with bacon, cheddar, and horseradish sauce. Yumm!
